description:
Visionary Integration Professionals (VIP) provides industry-leading management consulting, system integration, and technology deployment solutions. VIP helps its clients strengthen mission outcomes by combining deep industry specialization, agility to adapt as needed, and an unwavering commitment to client satisfaction. VIP brings expertise in how to deploy systems that align people, processes, and technology to accelerate strategic change and to deliver business results in partnership with its clients. Since 1996, VIP has worked with over 1,200 public sector and commercial clients. For more information, visit https://trustvip.com.
Join VIP: A strategic approach to accelerate your career! This role can be remote.
The Project Management consultant shall work in conjunction with the Business Modernization Project team and a System Integrator to conduct project management tasks associated with licensing and enforcement system development.
SCOPE OF SERVICES:
Provide the full scope of industry-standard project management practices (e.g., PMBOK and IEEE) and deliverables in a project management capacity
Manage the BMC2 project including working with the Systems Integration (SI) Project Manager to ensure development and implementation of the SI contract deliverables.
Manage the State and Contractor’s Project Teams, including coordinating activities of departmental staff and Contractor staff as necessary.
Coordinate project activities to dovetail with SI Contractor’s activities (e.g., organizational change management and training) related production operations and California Technology Agency, PLAN-IT, BMC2 Stage 2 development activities.
Ensure appropriate and consistent communication with all stakeholders.
Coordinate with and manage a wide variety of project stakeholders including State department executives, Contractors’ teams, Independent Project Oversight Consultants (IPOC), Independent Verification and Validation (IV&V) contractors, and State Project Coordinators.
Deliver all products and services as specified in Paragraph 6. contractor’s Project Management Services and 7. Acceptance Criteria below for the State’s review.
Consultant shall provide a weekly status report as specified by the DCA Project Coordinator.
MANDATORY QUALIFICATIONS:
Two Project Management engagements, within the last 10 years, for a State of California department Information Technology project. Each of these two projects must have had a budget of at least $5 million.
One engagement managing at least one project with multidisciplinary teams that include technical and program staff, consultants, and stakeholders
One Project Management engagement using the AGILE methodology approach
DESIRABLE QUALIFICAITIONS:
One to three years experience managing projects with a governance structure that includes multiple state entities
One to three years experience managing the deployment of a system that serves multiple programs’ needs
One to three years experience managing projects delivered by contracted system integrators
One to three years experience managing concurrent system development and production operations
One to three years experience developing State of California Department of Technology Stage-Gate Project Approval documents
The compensation for this position is $110,000 to $140,000 per year depending on experience and qualifications. Employees are also eligible for performance-based bonus/ to participate in a performance-based incentive plan. This position is eligible for a benefits package including; medical, dental, vision, a 401(k) plan and company match, short-term and long-term disability coverage, basic life insurance, 7 paid holidays and 13 days accrued PTO.
title: Project Manager

description:
This is where you save and sustain lives
At Baxter, we are deeply connected by our mission. No matter your role at Baxter, your work makes a positive impact on people around the world. You’ll feel a sense of purpose throughout the organization, as we know our work improves outcomes for millions of patients.
Baxter’s products and therapies are found in almost every hospital worldwide, in clinics and in the home. For over 85 years, we have pioneered significant medical innovations that transform healthcare.
Together, we create a place where we are happy, successful and inspire each other. This is where you can do your best work.
Join us at the intersection of saving and sustaining lives— where your purpose accelerates our mission.
Candidates must reside in the MidAtlantic/North East
Your Role:
This multidimensional role, in the healthcare software industry, is pivotal within Baxter Care Communications. The Project Manager (PM) is a field-based, virtual role, responsible for the planning, coordination, documentation, and execution of our Voalte Care Communications Platform - a unified digital care communications solution that allows healthcare teams to connect with each other and their patients.
Care Communications project managers are responsible for all aspects of the client project engagement from sales handoff to transition to ongoing support. Further, PMs play an integral role in planning customer technology roadmaps and customer attainment strategy. Key activities include project planning, prioritization and coordination, project risk assessment and mitigation, revenue forecasting, customer communication and internal collaborator management.
What You'll Be Doing:
Act with autonomy as the point of contact for all client project related needs during an active implementation.
Apply project management software, conduct regular meetings, provide agendas and meeting minutes, and build and maintain project plans.
Provide strong, proactive, project leadership. Drive follow-ups.
Lead project scope and results across multiple, concurrent engagements.
Continually assess and prioritize defined sequence tasks, within strict schedules, through individual effort and coordination of the work of others.
Deploy customer specific communication strategy to achieve desired results.
Meet or exceed established PMO metrics including revenue forecasting, assigned project reporting/results, customer revenue/project count loads, and customer happiness reporting.
Host in-person and remote meetings. Translate technical information from technical to non-technical resources to meet project requirements
Consult with customers and Baxter sales team on long-term technology strategy. Understand the outstanding challenges facing each customer and offer custom solutions.
Act as a resource for sales team during long-term planning sessions.
Define a clear revenue management strategy that enables revenue goal attainment.
Balance the backlog of your customer with knowledge of short, mid, and long-term orders
Travel to customer sites as needed - ~20% travel including overnights.
What You'll Bring:
Bachelor’s degree or 5+ years of equivalent combination of education and applicable work experience in healthcare, IT, business, or related industry.
Demonstrated project management experience, preferably with external customer projects. IT project management a plus including history working within customers’ IT departments, ability to discuss networking, virtual server deployments, IT security concerns, remote connectivity, and software deployment methodology.
Experience with consultative project management approach.
Health care environment experience desired.
PMP or other industry related certification(s) a plus.
Ability to facilitate, run and empower large, diverse groups without direct line authority.
Validated capability of interactions with customer’s ‘C’ level management, and Baxter senior management.
Positive and self-motivated demeanor and ability to work through sophisticated issues, customer politics, and personalities.
We understand compensation is an important factor as you consider the next step in your career. At Baxter, we are committed to equitable pay for all employees, and we strive to be more transparent with our pay practices. The estimated base salary for this position is $88,000 - $121,000 annually. The estimated range is meant to reflect an anticipated salary range for the position. We may pay more or less than of the anticipated range based upon market data and other factors, all of which are subject to change. Individual pay is based on upon location, skills and expertise, experience, and other relevant factors. This position is also eligible for discretionary bonuses. For questions about this, our pay philosophy, and available benefits, please speak to the recruiter if you decide to apply and are selected for an interview.
Equal Employment Opportunity
Baxter is an equal opportunity employer. Baxter evaluates qualified applicants without regard to race, color, religion, gender, national origin, age, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, protected veteran status, disability/handicap status or any other legally protected characteristic.

EEO is the Law
EEO is the law - Poster Supplement
Pay Transparency Policy
Reasonable Accommodations

Baxter is committed to working with and providing reasonable accommodations to individuals with disabilities globally. If, because of a medical condition or disability, you need a reasonable accommodation for any part of the application or interview process, please click on the link here and let us know the nature of your request along with your contact information.
Recruitment Fraud Notice

Baxter has discovered incidents of employment scams, where fraudulent parties pose as Baxter employees, recruiters, or other agents, and engage with online job seekers in an attempt to steal personal and/or financial information. To learn how you can protect yourself, review our Recruitment Fraud Notice.

description:
How you'll make an impact:
As our Project Manager (PM) you will help hospitals and healthcare systems across the country implement our software, StrataJazz® so they can better perform financially. Every day you will manage project timelines, resources, and scope. To thrive in this role, you must stay very organized and have mastered your executive presence across all forms of communication. The day-to-day of the PM role includes:
Providing oversight and guidance to cross-functional project teams, planning, and executing complex projects across multiple organizations and stakeholders simultaneously to enable the launch of new projects and processes throughout the implementation lifecycle
Serving as a client advocate to effectively lead their organization through implementations with a key focus on building positive professional relationships
project communication & progress using Salesforce, leveraging a built-in project management application & Microsoft Office
Developing, maintaining, and monitoring detailed project workplans that leverage waterfall methodology. Documenting project changes & risks in alignment with standards defined in client statement of work
Participating in regular planning meetings to prepare for & manage project tasks in alignment with Strata's Agile operations
Assisting project leaders in defining risks, dependencies, and issue resolution
Reporting progress through weekly status meetings and monthly executive meetings with clients and internal leadership
Ensuring coordination between different consulting teams to ensure implementation tasks are clearly defined and completed on schedule
Managing expectations and escalations of both internal team members and clients
Supporting account management activities as needed with assigned client accounts
What we're looking for:
3+ years of project management experience in a software implementation environment
Experience with software implementation in healthcare or finance is a plus
A drive to learn quickly and constantly adapt to new challenges
Strong self-motivation, and the ability to work effectively with limited guidance when necessary
How we work:
The preferred location for this role is in Chicago, IL or St. Louis, MO. We value our people spending time together and have campuses hosting in-person events located in both cities. We are truly a hybrid environment with all team members experiencing the flexibility to work from home.
Thinking about applying?
Research shows that women and underrepresented groups tend to apply to jobs only when they check every box on a job posting. If you're currently reading this and hesitating to click "Apply" for that reason, we encourage you to go for it! A true passion and excitement for making an impact is just as important as work experience.

Should you require a reasonable accommodation in completing this application, interviewing, completing any pre-employment testing, or otherwise participating in the employee selection process, please reach out to careers@stratadecision.com.
Here @ Strata…
Our culture is driven by our people solving problems together. We embrace learning, collaboration, and continuous career growth. Together, we lift our customers, our products, our company, and our community.
We believe that each of our team member's unique perspectives and experiences is what drives innovation and positive change. Our individual differences are what make us a more forward-thinking organization. We foster a culture of inclusion, equity and belonging, regardless of race, religion, disability, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or national origin.

Our Core Values:
While we celebrate what makes each member of our team unique, our core values are what connect us. They set clear expectations for how we approach our work and how each of us can positively influence the experience of our team and our customers.

Connect with positive intent.
Be helpful.
Own it.
Get better every day.
Stay humble.
Strata is committed to fair and equitable compensation practices. Full-time roles are eligible for an annual bonus based on both individual and company performance. Find out more about Strata benefits here.
title: Project Manager

description:
Job Description
The Project Leader helps Program Management to direct the execution of all integration activities to validate compliance with the Systems Engineering Life Cycle (SELC) and Agile methodology. The Project Leader develops requirements from a project's inception to its conclusion for a particular IT subject matter area (i.e., simple to complex systems). Analyzes functional business requirements and design specifications for functional activities. Plays a key role in assisting other project members with analysis and evaluation.
The Project Leader may also assist with the preparation of recommendations for system improvements, optimization, development, and/or maintenance efforts in the following specialties: information systems architecture; networking; telecommunications; automation; communications protocols; risk management/electronic analysis; software; life-cycle management; software development methodologies; modeling and simulation; disaster recovery; and requirements management. Responsible for understanding the needs of the customers and the realities of commercially available IT products and creating requirements that will allow implementation by the architecture and engineering team and COTS products.
The Project Leader should have the following skills:
Possess and apply expertise on multiple complex work assignments which are broad in nature, requiring originality and innovation in determining how to accomplish tasks
Ability to apply a comprehensive knowledge across key tasks and high impact assignments
Ability to plan and lead major technology assignments
Ability to evaluate performance results and recommends major changes affecting short-term project growth and success
Functions as a technical expert across multiple project assignments
Ability to understand and convey technical information to non-technical individuals
Ability to ensure customer’s business needs are properly translated to technical requirements and tasking
Ability to supervise and lead others
Candidate must have expert communication skills
Candidate must have expert Microsoft Office experience
Expert knowledge of Waterfall and Agile Methodology
Strong understanding of Jira
Key Tasks and Responsibilities
Provide project management and risk management assistance to the PMs
Serve as a backup to the Program Manager and Deputy Program Manager at all meetings
Perform quality control checks on all reports and documentation
Assist with project planning, budget, and contract management
Assist in the preparation of project and program documentation such as the project schedule, and presentations
Assist with the documentation of lessons learned
Assist with risk management by helping to draft contingency plans and write the if/then statements for risks
Attend monthly project review and risk review meetings and assist with capturing action items
Job Requirements:
Required Education & Experience
Bachelor’s Degree and 6+ years of related experience
The ideal candidate should be able to demonstrate working knowledge with several of the following concepts or technologies:
Microsoft Office suite (to include Excel, PowerPoint, SharePoint, MS Project, and MS Project Server), Schedule Inspector, OnePager, JIRA, Confluence, SELC, Agile, Scrum, and DevOps Methodologies, Quality Assurance and Technical Writing
Certification Requirements
Relevant commercial certifications desired
Clearance Requirements
Candidate must be a US Citizen, possess DHS Suitability background investigation or be eligible to qualify for DHS Entry of Duty background investigation followed by DHS Public Trust Clearance
Other (Travel, Work Environment, DoD 8570 Requirements, Administrative Notes, etc.)
None
EOE AA M/F/Vet/Disability

title: Project Manager

description:
Overview:
GovCIO is currently hiring for a Project Manager to support the Health Services Portfolio Technical Management and Strategic Solutioning Support (HTMS) program within the Department of Veterans Affairs (VA) Office of Information and Technology (OIT). The Project Manager will be a hands-on leader who will support a VA Product Manager with day-to-day oversight providing strategy, process, and implementation consulting services to the Product Team. The Project Manager will be responsible for client interactions and ensuring production of quality work products. The environment is dynamic, and client needs are often evolving; flexibility and forward-thinking views are important for success. This role is a fully remote position within the United States with core hours of operation from Monday to Friday 8 AM to 5 PM ET.
Responsibilities:
Creates integrated project plans for contract deliverables and new products in development projects. Manages a project team comprised of a multidisciplinary staff. Reviews, manages and controls status of projects; manages schedules and prepares status reports. Assesses project issues and develops resolutions to meet productivity, quality, and client-satisfaction goals and objectives. Develops mechanisms for monitoring project progress and for intervention and problem solving with team members and line managers.
Manages the direction of a project through the design, implementation, and testing in accordance with project objectives.
Defines requirements and plans project lifecycle deployment.
Supervises professional and technical support personnel performing in their regular disciplines.
Schedules tasks and coordinates with various team members to accomplish the results.
Manages the integration of vendor tasks and tracks and reviews vendor deliverables.
Ensures adherence to quality standards and reviews project deliverables.
Conducts project meetings and is responsible for project tracking, analysis and reporting.
Supports/Advises the VHA initiatives, Biomed, VA Innovations and OI&T staff to ensure product pilot programs are successfully implemented from the start with security, Section 508, and DevSecOps methodologies to enable a successful nation-wide rollout.
Supports sub-Product Line Program Increment Planning activities by generating mural boards, identifying quarterly milestones, and closely tracking established project goals.
Identifies and manages project/schedule risks and issues impacting the progress and outcome of the sub-Product Line.
Supports the monthly reporting requirements for the ACOE monthly metrics.
Qualifications:
Required Skills and Experience
Bachelor's degree in engineering, Computer Science, Systems, Business or related scientific/technical discipline with 15+ years' experience. 10 years of additional relevant experience may be substituted for education
Strong communication skills (oral and written) to relay concise messaging and reporting to all levels of management
Great interpersonal skills and ability to work independently with minimal guidance/supervision
Strong analytical and investigation skills crafting solutions to challenging problems or issues
Strong experience in developing presentations and slides for communicating technical and non-technical subjects to both small and large audiences
Experience taking vague requirements and requests and delivering robust products, recommendations, and/or solutions
Well-versed in DevSecOps and agile IT development and project management methodologies
Solid experience with Microsoft and other collaborative tools including Teams, SharePoint, Jira, etc.
Ability to extrapolate and communicate a client’s main challenges and pain points and the ability to craft strong solutions and make recommendations
Responsible for on-time completion of all deliverables/work products
Must be able to identify and mitigate risks to the project, and escalate program risks, as necessary

Preferred Skills and Experience
PM-related certifications such as PMP and ITIL preferred
Experience supporting or leading within the Veterans Affairs Office of Information and Technology, Veterans Benefits Administration, and/or Veterans Health Administration is a plus
Proven VA (or similar government agency) IT development track record highly desired
Experience in all areas of the software development life cycle, enterprise-wide network engineering, strategic information planning, business process reengineering, structure and management practices
Experience with program control, including development of controls used to manage performance, including cost, schedule, and staff management
Ability to proactively communicate and coordinate with various internal and external project stakeholders, depending on needs.

Clearance Required: Ability to obtain and maintain a Suitability/Public Trust clearance
Company Overview:
GovCIO is a team of transformers-people who are passionate about transforming government IT. Every day, we make a positive impact by delivering innovative IT services and solutions that improve how government agencies operate and serve our citizens.

But we can't do it alone. We need great people to help us do great things - for our customers, our culture, and our ability to attract other great people. We are changing the face of government IT and building a workforce that fuels this mission. Are you ready to be a transformer?

We are an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, disability, or status as a protected veteran. EOE, including disability/vets.

Posted Pay Range

The posted pay range, if referenced, reflects the range expected for this position at the commencement of employment, however, base pay offered may vary depending on multiple individualized factors, including market location, job-related knowledge, skills, education, experience, and internal equity. The total compensation package for this position may also include other compensation elements, to be discussed during the hiring process. If hired, employee will be in an “at-will position” and the GovCIO reserves the right to modify base salary (as well as any other discretionary payment or compensation program) at any time, including for reasons related to individual performance, GovCIO or individual department/team performance, and market factors.
Posted Salary Range: USD $120,000.00 - USD $135,000.00 /Yr.

description:
Job Summary
This role is responsible for collaborating on transition programs across functions, ensuring the implementation of TTM processes, and aligning project plans with overarching strategies. The role participates in the successful transformation of the customer’s transitioned environment to significantly improve service levels and reduce ongoing operating costs. The role provides support to transition managers and project managers, acting as a client liaison, and assisting in developing best practices. The role also leads complex projects and supports operational and strategic plans.

Responsibilities
Assists in establishing and enforcing the utilization of appropriate TTM processes, including reporting, risk management, lessons learned, quality control, escalation procedures, and communication strategies, as outlined in the scope of work.
Handles the transition program encompassing all organizational functions and coordinates both internal and external project activities.
Collaborates with the comprehensive transition/transformation team throughout the pursuit and phases of the deal.
Provides management and support to transition managers in executing project activities.
Ensures alignment and integration of all transition/transformation project plans with the overarching deal project plan and customer transition/transformation plans.
Provides support to project managers of transition/transformation projects in the development of each project's scope of work, cost estimates, scheduling, and risk assessment.
Acts as the primary client liaison during the transition period to facilitate communication with other internal company departments.
Assists with the development and implementation of best practices, tools, and methodologies for transition and transformation.
Solves difficult and complex problems with a fresh perspective, demonstrating good judgment in selecting creative solutions and managing projects independently.
Leads moderate to high complexity projects, delivering professionally written reports, and supports the realization of operational and strategic plans.

Education & Experience Recommended
Four-year or Graduate Degree in Business, Computer Science, Information Technology, Electrical/Electronic Engineering, or any other related discipline or commensurate work experience or demonstrated competence.
Typically has 4-7 years of work experience, preferably in project management, IT, transition implementation, or a related field or an advanced degree with 3-5 years of work experience.

Preferred Certifications
ITIL Certifications
ITSM Certifications

Knowledge & Skills
Agile Methodology
Business Development
Business Operations
Change Management
Client Services
Customer Relationship Management
Microsoft Project
Milestones (Project Management)
Process Improvement
Project Documentation
Project Management
Project Management Institute (PMI) Methodology
Project Planning
Project Scoping
Risk Management
Risk Mitigation
Scrum (Software Development)
Six Sigma Methodology
Systems Development Life Cycle
Waterfall Methodology

Cross-Org Skills
Effective Communication
Results Orientation
Learning Agility
Digital Fluency
Customer Centricity

Impact & Scope
Impacts multiple teams and may act as a team or project leader providing direction to team activities and facilitates information validation and team decision making process.

Complexity
Responds to moderately complex issues within established guidelines.
The base pay range for this role is $69,600 to $107,150 annually with additional opportunities for pay in the form of bonus and/or equity (applies to US candidates only). Pay varies by work location, job-related knowledge, skills, and experience.
Benefits:
HP offers a comprehensive benefits package for this position, including:
Health insurance
Dental insurance
Vision insurance
Long term/short term disability insurance
Employee assistance program
Flexible spending account
Life insurance
Generous time off policies, including;
4-12 weeks fully paid parental leave based on tenure
11 paid holidays
Additional flexible paid vacation and sick leave (US benefits overview)
The compensation and benefits information is accurate as of the date of this posting. The Company reserves the right to modify this information at any time, with or without notice, subject to applicable law.

Disclaimer
This job description describes the general nature and level of work performed in this role. It is not intended to be an exhaustive list of all duties, skills, responsibilities, knowledge, etc. These may be subject to change and additional functions may be assigned as needed by management.
title: Project Manager

description:
Gallo Glass Privacy Policy
Why Gallo Glass?
Gallo Glass, established in 1958, is a state-of-the-art highly-innovative glass manufacturer committed to meeting the needs of its customers while minimizing its impact on the environment. The largest glass plant on the West Coast, and the only glass plant in the world solely dedicated to the wine and spirits industry, Gallo Glass is a family owned and operated company. Running 24 hours a day 365 days a year, the plant turns 1500 tons of molten glass from natural raw materials all sourced in California, into 2 million bottles per day. Come see for yourself and join Gallo Glass: California Pure.
Location: Modesto, CA
Join Our Team: Project Manager for Glass and Bottle Manufacturing at Gallo
Gallo is seeking a seasoned Project Manager to drive the research, development, and implementation of large-scale projects and capital equipment installations supporting our glass and bottle-making operations. This role is crucial for managing sizable capital programs and demonstrating mastery in container glass manufacturing, quality, and technology.

As a Project Manager, you will be influential in advising management and leading teams, workgroups, and initiatives. Your mission includes selling new concepts to Senior Management, preparing capital expenditure requests, and participating in cross-functional planning and management teams to improve organizational processes.

Key responsibilities include analyzing data for new containers, equipment, and technologies, directing project personnel, and ensuring projects progress on schedule and within budget. You will conduct research and analytical studies, develop design specifications, and coordinate the building and validation of prototypes. Additionally, you will plan and develop experimental test programs, prepare design modifications, and analyze test data to ensure designs meet functional and performance specifications.

Your role also involves acting as a liaison with other departments and organizations, preparing project reports, and coordinating activities with governmental agencies. You will identify and obtain team capabilities needed to accomplish project objectives, balance planning efforts with day-to-day demands, and ensure compliance with quality, environmental, and safety regulations.

If you have a passion for innovation, a strong background in glass manufacturing, and the ability to lead large-scale projects, Gallo welcomes you. Join us in shaping the future of our glass and bottle-making operations through impactful project management and strategic implementation.

What You Will Need:

High School diploma or State-issued equivalency certificate.
Bachelor's degree plus 8 years of container glass engineering, manufacturing or operations
experience reflecting increasing levels of responsibility; or 12 years of container glass
engineering, manufacturing or operations reflecting increasing levels of responsibility.
Experience managing projects.
Required to be 18 years or older. This may be in addition to other age requirements, if applicable,
as listed in this job description.

Compensation:

Hiring Salary Range Posted: $130,500.00 - $195,700.00 / year
Actual compensation paid within the range will be determined by factors such as the education, experience, knowledge, skills and abilities of the applicant, internal equity, and alignment with market data.
Perks & Benefits:

This position includes a competitive benefits package.

title: Project Manager

description:
WE'RE LUMA HEALTH.
Needing healthcare can be hard — getting care shouldn't be.
We built Luma Health because we are all patients. We believe it should be easy to see and connect with our doctor. To get the care we need, when we need it.
So, we've created solutions to fix this problem. Our technology makes messaging easier, scheduling appointments more efficient, and it modernizes care delivery from beginning to end.
The Role: Project Manager
We are looking for a highly driven and empathetic Project Manager to join our Professional Services team. This role will serve as a hands-on strategic advisor, Luma product and platform expert to Luma's customers during implementation, and during other Professional Services engagements.
The Project Manager will be responsible for working closely with our Solution Consultants to design and deliver high impact value-driven solutions that align with the customer's business goals. You will be responsible for overseeing the end-to-end process of implementation and engagement delivery, from initial planning and testing to go live and post-go live support. Your primary focus will be to ensure accurate and on time delivery of the Luma platform by effectively managing project timelines, resources, and communication throughout the entire Professional Services lifecycle.
On a day to day basis, you will work closely with technical and business customer stakeholders from all levels through C-suite and cross-functionally within Luma from Sales, Customer Success to Engineering to craft comprehensive solutions that reflect a strong understanding of typical business challenges or common objectives faced by customers within healthcare settings. You are not afraid to drive difficult conversations and remove roadblocks to guide, negotiate and implement new workflows that drive increased business value. You are proficient at analyzing issues and obstacles to identify and settle the issue's root cause, and can identify appropriate corrective action.
You will also serve as an advocate to ensure standard processes are followed and contribute to developing new processes and frameworks to streamline the time and effort involved in professional services delivery.
The successful candidate will be a self-starter who has a track record of successfully delivering impactful healthcare solutions working through complex workflows with multiple stakeholders. This person is passionate about tackling difficult problems in healthcare and is excited by the ambiguity and opportunity that comes with working in a dynamic, fast-growing technology company.
What YOU will do at Luma Health
Become an expert on the Luma Health platform and products
Manage the solution design and implementation of customers from contract through launch that is aligned with Luma's product growth strategy
Project Management - develop detailed project plans, schedules, scoping documents and identify potential risks and issues and proactively mitigate.
Understand customer's anticipated business outcomes and "why" they partnered with Luma Health, working collaboratively and having very strong communications skills across various levels of a client organization
Understand the current state workflows and handle customer expectations; negotiate solutions to complex problems with both the customer and third-party partners
You will provide go live support and own documentation to ensure smooth transition of ownership to Support and the Customer Success team
Who You Are
Background in healthcare customer success, management consulting, software implementation or project management at a health system, payer, EHR company, or third party in the healthcare IT space
5+ years in a customer-facing role or project management role interfacing with executive stakeholders and driving customer technical implementation.
Must be a team player as demonstrated through managing complex implementations with multiple work streams
Have experience understanding health system / customer needs and translating them into achievable goals & impact drivers
Resourceful and innovative thinker who can work through and solve problems
A great listener with the ability to communicate with people in diverse roles
Excellent project management skills and ability to collaborate across multiple internal and external stakeholders
Experience in documenting business processes and wire-framing system designs using process flow diagram tools (e.g. Visio, Lucid) as well as making recommendations for future state improved processes
Have the ability to translate technical concepts to a variety of audiences from technical to operational to executive
Experience leading discovery sessions, defining business requirements, writing user stories and providing detailed system and functional designs
Strong presentation skills; able to effectively present a point of view and clearly articulate the rationale to a variety of partners
Strong communication skills, both written and verbal; able to optimally develop materials that are appropriate for the audience

description:
Here at Wilson Language Training, we are committed to working together for our mission to achieve literacy for all. We believe literacy is a fundamental right and should be attainable for all people. We strive to reflect this belief in our work.
The success of our team members is no less paramount. We’re dedicated to ensuring that every Wilson employee experiences truly satisfying professional development while feeling inspired to bring their authentic selves to work. Are you ready to be a changemaker?
Wilson Language training is growing and is looking to hire a Project Manager on the Program Development team.
The Project Manager will organize, manage, and plan complex projects related to the development of Wilson Language Training Program curriculum programs and professional learning, as well as digital resources and platforms. The ideal candidate will be a leader who is well-versed in Project Management best practices and has demonstrable experience in managing both print-based and digital projects. A track record of success planning projects within an Agile environment is a plus.
Essential Job Functions:
Works with directors, managers and stakeholders to ensure projects are planned effectively and completed on time and to specifications.
Works with department directors to organizes and assign work and assignments to team members based on expertise, work experience, and capacity.
Leads an interdepartmental team to complete an assigned project on time, to specifications, and with accuracy and efficiency.
Responsible for establishing and managing a regular cadence of project health check-ins, with both the project team and management.
Works with team leadership to create project timelines, and ensures individual tasks are understood and delegated accordingly.
Responsible for project budgets
Conducts cost analysis, estimating expected costs for projects.
Prepares and implements a budget based on estimates, and tracks project spend against approved budget.
Conducts risk assessments and clearly surfaces any impediments on a frequent basis to management; provides recommended solutions for mitigation of risk.
Continuously addresses questions, concerns, and monitors team health throughout the project.
Communicates and collaborates with other internal Wilson teams to provide training and information required to promote and inform programs, and systems.
Ensures compliance with federal, state, local, industry, contractual, and company regulations, standards, specifications, and best practices.
Performs other related duties as assigned.
Understands and display WLT’s values
Minimum Requirements
Skills:
Excellent verbal and written communication skills.
Excellent interpersonal and customer service skills.
Excellent organizational skills and attention to detail.
Excellent time management skills with a proven ability to meet deadlines.
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
Strong supervisory and leadership skills.
Ability to prioritize tasks and to delegate them when appropriate.
Thorough understanding of or the ability to quickly learn about the project or product being developed.
Proficient with Microsoft Office Suite and other project management related software.
Experience:
5+ years project management experience required.
Experience managing an interdepartmental team with members from all levels of an organization preferred.
Education/Certification:
Bachelor’s degree in a related field such as Business or Project Managements required, or equivalent bachelor’s degree plus project management certification.
Preferred:
PMP certification a plus
Familiarity with Agile best practices
Experience working in the Education or educational publishing industry a plus.
Wilson has identified the anticipated pay range for this role based on the many factors that we consider in defining compensation levels for our roles, including market data, and internal equity considerations. Actual pay, and allocation between base and any target discretionary bonus, will vary based on geographic location, education, work experience, skills, market data, and internal equity considerations. Wilson offers competitive benefits, including:
Medical, dental, vision, and Life & Disability Insurance
401k plan with partial employer match
Paid Time Off
Paid holidays
Tuition reimbursement
“O’Connor days,” which refers to a company-wide office closure between Christmas and New Year’s Eve, as well as other perks.

description:
Overview:
What We Do
We calm the confusion of IT by guiding the connection between people and technology. If a customer is looking for a better way to manage their warehouse inventory, equip their workforce, or secure their data, we make it happen. All it takes is finding the right combination of tech hardware, software, cloud solutions, and support services. That’s what we do. We’re the IT Department’s IT Department.

Who We Are
Our team is made stronger by a multitude of backgrounds, experiences, and perspectives. It’s what makes Connection unique—what drives us to innovate and create technology solutions that stand apart from the crowd. We’d love for you to be a part of that fabric, to share your ideas and experiences with a team that thrives on fresh thinking, creativity, and helping others.

Why You Should Join Us
You’ll find supportive teammates and a rewarding career at Connection—plus great benefits. We take pride in supporting employees with a total rewards package that provides financial, emotional, and physical resources for you and your family. Our compensation, 401k plans, medical insurance, and other benefits are progressive and competitive. We value the importance of our employees’ emotional wellbeing. To support employees, we provide free therapy visits, mental health coaching and tools, and meditation resources. You’ll also enjoy a generous paid time off package that includes not only vacation and sick time, but also Wellness and Volunteer Time Off days.
Responsibilities:
Working under minimal supervision of the Sr Manager of Solution Sales Operations, referring only exceptional problems and issues for management review or approval, the Microsoft Project Manager utilizes independent judgment and discretion to manage initiatives that drive Microsoft software growth. Working with stakeholders, the Project Manager (PM) manages initiatives that will grow our Cloud Solution Provider (CSP) business, including our CSP Customer Lifecycle Program.

The PM develops project plans, organizes and coordinates project tasks with cross-functional teams and is responsible for ensuring project timelines and deliverables are met. The PM serves as a point-person, coordinating activities across multiple stakeholders. The PM communicates regularly with stakeholders to advance project progress, mitigate risks and ensure success.
Min: USD $74,500.00/Yr. Max: USD $94,244.00/Yr. Qualifications:
Required competencies:

Two to five years of project coordination/management experience with ability to develop a project plan and coordinate activities that result in timely and successful completion of projects.

Good working knowledge of an online project management tool

Strong analytical and mathematical skills

Excellent communication skills and ability to work with cross-functional teams

Judgment with the ability to formulate opinions, compare and decide with good sense

Good organization skills and ability to manage projects across teams

Self-motivated, able to meet deadlines

Detail oriented with the ability to provide clear direction to others

Advanced Microsoft Office skills to include creating presentations, and advanced reporting in Excel

Additional preferred competencies or preferred qualifications, if any:

Experience selling or supporting Microsoft product solutions with working knowledge of the CSP program

Bachelor's Degree or the equivalent combination of education and work expeirence
Years of experience to qualify for the role: 4-7
title: Project Manager

description:
Job Overview:
We are looking for an experienced Technical Project Manager who is passionate about joining a team dedicated to making a difference in the life of learners and educators. You will join a dynamic and fast-paced environment and work with software engineers and cross-functional teams to design, build and roll-out products that deliver the company’s vision and strategy.
Job Responsibilities:
Collaborate with Product Manager as well as other functional leads on business and functional requirements and development priorities
Create, maintain, and communicate project status and schedule from initiation to release
Track cross-team dependencies and communicate risk appropriately
Drive project and development teams to scope and estimate product requirements within the SAFe model
Work with Development and QA teams to create project plans
Establish how results will be measured; complete post-project evaluations to assess results
Work with Product Manager to maintain and document high-level project scope, goals, and deliverables
Provide regular updates to stakeholders on project progress, potential impediments, and milestones
Along with the Product Manager, is ultimately accountable for project results, and delivery of high-quality products
Serve as scrum master with a goal of maintaining focus on key issues
Lead and motivate team members on a proactive basis
Solve resource conflicts as they arise with all stakeholders
Work with external consultants and contractors as needed
Collaborate with other Project Managers to align project best practices when appropriate
Create a collaborative and high-performing SAFe environment that promotes efficiency, transparency, and continuous improvement
Job Requirements:
Proven working experience managing software or web projects, preferably in the educational technology market
A minimum of 5+ years experience managing cross-functional technical project teams
Experience managing software and/or web-based projects throughout the development lifecycle and an aptitude for understanding technical concepts
Familiarity and experience with project management tools and best practices - including Scrum/Agile Methodologies
Experience using issue tracking tools (especially JIRA) to manage and schedule development tasks
Skilled at working effectively with cross-functional teams in a matrix organization. Ability to work collaboratively with peers and executives across functions, facilitation experience
Deep understanding and relevant experience with API functionality
A proven record leading software project teams
Excellent relationship building and negotiating skills. Highly developed listening skills. Excellent written and verbal communication skills
Excellent problem-solving skills and solid technical background with understanding of software development and web technologies
A bachelor of arts or sciences degree required, or equivalent experience. A computer science degree is preferred. A graduate degree is also preferred.
To learn more about our organization and the exciting work we do, visit
https://www.lexialearning.com/
An Equal Opportunity Employer

description:
Job Description
Because this role involves a combination of independent and collaborative work, this position can be conducted 100% remotely. While the scheduled shift follows a 9/80 (8am-5pm EST), the candidate will be expected to occasionally work extended hours during various project phases.
Responsible for the planning and execution of all Corporate Commodity Negotiation Projects (projects) within the Custom Designed Parts category, which include, but is not limited to: Machined Parts, Cable Assemblies and Printed Wiring Boards.
Partner with the Category Management to develop overall project scope, goal, and strategy.
Must collaborate with the Project Administrator to ensure all required documentation is completed in a timely manner.
Determine negotiation team requirements for accommodations (both lodging & facility).

The overall project objective is to contract firm, fixed multiyear pricing with various manufacturers and distributors for the procurement community to execute against.

Corporate Commodity Negotiation Projects may involve multi-sector participation from across BAE Systems globally. While participants will not report to this position directly, the candidate will be responsible for creating and maintaining productive relationships with the various participants to achieve project goals.

This is accomplished by following established and approved procurement procedures and policies to provide the best value consistent with quality and service requirements while maintaining good supplier relations.

Required Education, Experience, & Skills
Typically, a bachelor's degree in business, engineering, or manufacturing engineering with 4 to 8+ years of procurement experience with PWBs and/ or machine products.
Strong Project Management background with exemplary organizational skills.
Sound interpersonal skills; ability to interface, coordinate and influence all levels of internal and external customers.
Develop and deliver effective written communication in various formats.
Confidently lead discussions and present on various topics to large groups of both internal and external stakeholders.
Ability to manipulate & translate large data sets for targeted audiences.
Sound ethical judgement when interpreting policies, procedures, and applicable state and federal laws and regulations.
Process improvement mindset.
Microsoft 365 Office knowledge (Proficiency in Excel, PowerPoint, Teams and SharePoint)

Preferred Education, Experience, & Skills
Experience in direct procurement of build-to-print parts
Experience in Supply Chain Management and various sourcing strategies (AR, VMI, OSS)
Experience with Contract Management
Professional Certifications
Certified Associate in Project Management (CAPM)
Project Management Professional (PMP) certification
Certified Professional in Supply Management (CPSM)
Certified in Planning and Inventory Management (CPIM)
Certified Supply Chai Professional (CSCP)

Pay Information
Full-Time Salary Range: $96470 - $164010

Please note: This range is based on our market pay structures. However, individual salaries are determined by a variety of factors including, but not limited to: business considerations, local market conditions, and internal equity, as well as candidate qualifications, such as skills, education, and experience.

Employee Benefits: At BAE Systems, we support our employees in all aspects of their life, including their health and financial well-being. Regular employees scheduled to work 20+ hours per week are offered: health, dental, and vision insurance; health savings accounts; a 401(k) savings plan; disability coverage; and life and accident insurance. We also have an employee assistance program, a legal plan, and other perks including discounts on things like home, auto, and pet insurance. Our leave programs include paid time off, paid holidays, as well as other types of leave, including paid parental, military, bereavement, and any applicable federal and state sick leave. Employees may participate in the company recognition program to receive monetary or non-monetary recognition awards. Other incentives may be available based on position level and/or job specifics.

About BAE Systems Electronic Systems
BAE Systems, Inc. is the U.S. subsidiary of BAE Systems plc, an international defense, aerospace and security company which delivers a full range of products and services for air, land and naval forces, as well as advanced electronics, security, information technology solutions and customer support services. Improving the future and protecting lives is an ambitious mission, but it’s what we do at BAE Systems. Working here means using your passion and ingenuity where it counts – defending national security with breakthrough technology, superior products, and intelligence solutions. As you develop the latest technology and defend national security, you will continually hone your skills on a team—making a big impact on a global scale. At BAE Systems, you’ll find a rewarding career that truly makes a difference. Electronic Systems (ES) is the global innovator behind BAE Systems’ game-changing defense and commercial electronics. Exploiting every electron, we push the limits of what is possible, giving our customers the edge and our employees opportunities to change the world. Our products and capabilities can be found everywhere – from the depths of the ocean to the far reaches of space. At our core are more than 14,000 highly talented Electronic Systems employees with the brightest minds in the industry, we make an impact – for our customers and the communities we serve.

Our Commitment to Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion:
At BAE Systems, we work hard every day to nurture an inclusive culture where employees are valued and feel like they belong. We are conscious of the need for all employees to see themselves reflected at every level of the company and know that in order to unlock the full potential of our workforce, everyone must feel confident being their best, most sincere self and be equipped to thrive. We provide impactful professional development experiences to our employees and invest in social impact partnerships to uplift communities and drive purposeful change. Here you will find significant opportunities to do meaningful work in an environment intentionally designed to be one where you will learn, grow and belong.

description:

Title and Summary
Project Manager I
This role is not eligible for Mastercard’s work authorization sponsorship. As such, candidates must be eligible to work in the United States, now as well as in the future, without employer sponsorship. For example, students or recent graduates in the United States on an F1 visa (including those with CPT or OPT authorization) are not eligible for this role.

Overview
Mastercard works to connect and power a sustainable and inclusive global economy. We are a vehicle for commerce, a connection to financial systems for the previously excluded, a technology innovation lab, and the home of Priceless®. We ensure every employee has the opportunity to be a part of something bigger and to change lives. We believe in connecting everyone to endless, priceless possibilities.

Launch Program
The Launch program is a development program that is supplemental to the role and is designed to help you transition from being a student to being a Mastercard employee. In this program, you will participate in:
Four-day orientation focused on getting to know Mastercard, building your skills, and be a force for good (Mastercard’s culture)
Professional skills workshops

Social impact – pro bono team challenge

Role Description
As a Project Manager I, you will have the opportunity to:
Scheduling events, managing the St. Louis Tech Hub inbox and handling/routing requests accordingly
Interfacing and coordinating with internal teams, including Facilities, FLIK, Security and others, as well as providing outstanding customer service to employees
Supporting the planning and execution of Tech Hub events
Supporting the implementation and adoption of new approaches, processes and initiatives, including leveraging technology in the Tech Hub’s work
Process documentation

Qualifications
Currently enrolled in a bachelor’s or accelerated master’s program graduating between Winter 2024 – Spring 2025
Adaptability in a fast-paced and rapidly changing environment
Outstanding attention to detail and on-time delivery of project tasks
Excellent communication skills to interface with a wide variety of internal and external stakeholders
Strong organizational skills and the ability to manage multiple projects simultaneously
Strong ability to take ownership of projects and tasks; proactive in being able to solve problems
Mastercard is an inclusive equal opportunity employer that considers applicants without regard to gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, race, ethnicity, disabled or veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law. In the US or Canada, if you require accommodations or assistance to complete the online application process or during the recruitment process, please contact reasonable_accommodation@mastercard.com and identify the type of accommodation or assistance you are requesting. Do not include any medical or health information in this email. The Reasonable Accommodations team will respond to your email promptly.
Corporate Security Responsibility

All activities involving access to Mastercard assets, information, and networks comes with an inherent risk to the organization and, therefore, it is expected that every person working for, or on behalf of, Mastercard is responsible for information security and must:
Abide by Mastercard’s security policies and practices;
Ensure the confidentiality and integrity of the information being accessed;
Report any suspected information security violation or breach, and
Complete all periodic mandatory security trainings in accordance with Mastercard’s guidelines.
In line with Mastercard’s total compensation philosophy and assuming that the job will be performed in the US, the successful candidate will be offered a competitive base salary based on location, experience and other qualifications for the role and may be eligible for an annual bonus or commissions depending on the role. Mastercard benefits for full time (and certain part time) employees generally include: insurance (including medical, prescription drug, dental, vision, disability, life insurance), flexible spending account and health savings account, paid leaves (including 16 weeks new parent leave, up to 20 paid days bereavement leave), 10 annual paid sick days, 10 or more annual paid vacation days based on level, 5 personal days, 10 annual paid U.S. observed holidays, 401k with a best-in-class company match, deferred compensation for eligible roles, fitness reimbursement or on-site fitness facilities, eligibility for tuition reimbursement, gender-inclusive benefits and many more.
title: Project Manager

description:
Job Summary

Manages a project work stream, project plan and/or small project that involves a small number of team members – typically up to 5. May contribute/provide support to larger projects. Tracks progress/activities of team and work products/deliverables utilizing project management software and other standard tools. Budget responsibilities are based on project requirements. Assist Director in running the PMO.

Job Responsibilities
Manages work streams of small projects, and coordinates/manages certain aspects of larger projects in coordination with Project/Program Lead. Acts as an indirect lead to small teams and may perform as track team lead for intermediate projects.
Assists in managing project integration, scope, timeline, and communicates the status, risks and issues associated with each to the correct level(s) within the project structure and the organization to ensure that the projects’ outcomes are achieved as defined. Ensures established budget is adhered to project requirements.
Conducts risk monitoring and controls during the project’s duration to ensure ability to achieve expected outcome. Prepares, monitors and updates project information, files, documentation, reports, and related work throughout the project lifecycle, including but not limited to project plan, project charter, scope and project schedules. Obtains appropriate level of approval for each project document and/or sub teams assigned to ensure appropriate understanding of expectations among all involved organizational levels.
Facilitates hand-offs across functions within the project.
Ensures assigned duties and responsibilities/project results are completed with quality and are timely and accurate in nature in order to meet project leadership expectations.
Tracks progress/activities of team and work products/deliverables utilizing project management software and other standard tools.
Communicates project status to team and business owners throughout the duration of the assignment and post implementation to make certain all impacted stakeholders have an understanding of risks, issues and activities related to the project.
About Walgreens and WBA

Walgreens (www.walgreens.com) is included in the U.S. Retail Pharmacy and U.S. Healthcare segments of Walgreens Boots Alliance, Inc. (Nasdaq: WBA), an integrated healthcare, pharmacy and retail leader with a 170-year heritage of caring for communities. WBA’s purpose is to create more joyful lives through better health. Operating nearly 9,000 retail locations across America, Puerto Rico and the U.S. Virgin Islands, Walgreens is proud to be a neighborhood health destination serving nearly 10 million customers each day. Walgreens pharmacists play a critical role in the U.S. healthcare system by providing a wide range of pharmacy and healthcare services, including those that drive equitable access to care for the nation’s medically underserved populations. To best meet the needs of customers and patients, Walgreens offers a true omnichannel experience, with fully integrated physical and digital platforms supported by the latest technology to deliver high-quality products and services in communities nationwide.
The actual salary an employee can expect to receive, plus bonus pursuant to the terms of any bonus plan if applicable, will depend on experience, seniority, geographic location, and other factors permitted by law. This role will remain open until filled. To review benefits, please visit jobs.walgreens.com/benefits
"An Equal Opportunity Employer, including disability/veterans".
Basic Qualifications
Bachelor’s degree OR a High School Diploma / GED and at least 3 years of experience coordinating projects.
Experience establishing & maintaining relationships with individuals at various levels of the organization, such as peers, superiors, internal/external stakeholders, business partners.
Experience with project management (for example: planning, organizing, and managing resources to bring about the successful completion of specific project goals and objectives).
Intermediate level skill in Microsoft Word (for example: inserting headers, page breaks, page numbers and tables and/or adjusting table columns).
Intermediate level skill in Microsoft Excel (for example: using SUM function, setting borders, setting column width, inserting charts, using text wrap, sorting, setting headers and footers and/or print scaling).
Intermediate level skill in Microsoft PowerPoint (for example: applying a theme, formatting character spacing, inserting a picture, changing slide layout and theme colors, adding transitions, customizing slide numbers, changing chart style and/or formatting font).
Willing to travel up to 10% of the time for business purposes (within state and out of state).

Preferred Qualifications
Certification in PMP Certification as granted by the PMI is a plus
This is a hybrid role with a requirement to be onsite at our Deerfield office for 3 days/ week.
Experience assisting in running a Project Management Office (PMO) is a plus

description:

Who We Are
At Bob’s, we have fun, we love what we do, and it shows in our expansive growth! Bob’s Discount Furniture is more than just a furniture store. We are one of the fastest growing omni-channel furniture retailers in the country with 165 stores in 24 states.
How We Will Support You
At Bob’s we understand there are many companies you can choose to work for, so, along with exceptional opportunities for career growth we offer a fun team-oriented work environment and great benefits! Let us tell you more.
Benefits & Perks- We’ve got you covered! We believe in supporting our employees and their families in the best ways possible is a top priority. We focus on three core wellness pillars: Emotional, Physical and Financial. Below are just some of the benefits that we offer:

Culture and Core Values- At Bob's we have a set of core values that shape the decisions we make every day and help define our company culture. These values comprise what we call "The Bob's Way." Honesty, Integrity, Transparency, Community, Safety, Diversity, Accountability and Fun.
DIVERSITY IS A CORE VALUE AT BOB’S
At Bob’s Discount Furniture, we want you to feel at home. Whether you’re shopping with us or a part of the Bob’s team, we want you to know that you are valued, appreciated, and free to be who you are.

Proven time management and prioritization skills and experience working well under tight.

Excellent time management and prioritization skills and experience working well under tight deadlines.
Excellent problem-solving skills and ability to deliver solutions in real-time.
Experience working directly with strategy, social, creative and production teams.

description:
A great experience starts with you!
Honda Center welcomes fans, performers, and athletes from around the globe. Our team members are an integral part of the event experience through their interactions with guests. Whether you’re looking to create a great guest experience at a concert, support business growth and development, work behind-the-scenes during an Anaheim Ducks game, or anything in-between, this is your opportunity to start the next chapter of your career story and help create a one-of-a-kind fan experience at Honda Center.
Once you've had a chance to explore our current open positions, apply to the ones you feel best suit you, as an applicant, you can always see your application status in your profile.
Job Title:
Creative Project Manager
Pay Details:
The annual base salary range for this position in California is $104,000 to $130,000 per year. The starting pay for the successful candidate depends on various job-related factors, including but not limited to the candidate’s geographic location, job-related knowledge, skills, experience, education/training, internal value, peer equity, external market demands, and organizational considerations.
Reporting directly to the Director of Creative Operations and working closely with the Marketing team and cross-functional leaders throughout the organization, the Creative Project Manager will oversee project resourcing and prioritization for the Honda Center and OCVIBE creative teams and manage creative deliverables from start to finish for key programs.
Responsibilities
Collaborate with Marketing and other stakeholders to define project objectives, scope, and creative requirements
Develop project plans, timelines, and budgets, ensuring alignment with overall marketing goals
Identify potential risks and challenges and proactively develop and communicate mitigation strategies
Work with internal stakeholders to prioritize and re-prioritize projects, constantly weighing business needs against bandwidth
Allocate and manage resources effectively to meet project milestones and deadlines
Coordinate with external vendors, agencies, and freelancers when necessary
Monitor time-tracking and project budgets/expenses to ensure cost-effectiveness
Lead, defend, and inspire the creative team, including designers, copywriters, and other creative professionals
Assign tasks, set priorities, and ensure clear communication and collaboration among team members
Foster a creative and innovative work environment, encouraging team members to excel in their roles
Maintain high standards of creative quality and brand consistency across all projects
Ensure that deliverables meet project objectives and stakeholder expectations
Act as the primary point of contact for project updates and status reports
Communicate project progress, milestones, and potential issues to stakeholders and leadership
Schedule and lead regular team meetings, including project briefs, creative reviews, and executive presentations
Prepare and present project summaries and post-project evaluations
Continuously evaluate and improve project management processes and workflows
Implement best practices and tools to enhance project efficiency and productivity
Seek opportunities to innovate and streamline creative project management across the organization as a whole
Skills
5-7 years of experience as a Project Manager or Producer within a creative agency or technology company
Experience building and training team members on new processes and/or tools
Problem-solving abilities in a creative capacity
Flexible and efficient
Can adapt to a fast-paced environment with a bias towards finding solutions to challenging problems
Attention to detail, organization, and proactiveness
Able to self-manage while finding opportunities to collaborate with other department leads
Able to successfully manage multiple complex and high-profile, high-budget projects simultaneously
Able to think big picture and distill it down into actionable pieces
Able to communicate clearly, both written and orally
Knowledge, Skills, and Experience
Education - Bachelor's Degree
Experience Required – 5+ Years
This position is on-site.

OC Sports & Entertainment, LLC

If you like wild growth and working with happy, enthusiastic over-achievers, you'll enjoy your career with us!

Campus/College Information:
Founded in 1856, University of Maryland, College Park is the state’s flagship institution. Our 1,250-acre College Park campus is just minutes away from Washington, D.C., and the nexus of the nation’s legislative, executive, and judicial centers of power. This unique proximity to business and technology leaders, federal departments and agencies, and a myriad of research entities, embassies, think tanks, cultural centers, and non-profit organizations is simply unparalleled. Synergistic opportunities for our faculty and students abound and are virtually limitless in the nation’s capital and surrounding areas. The University is committed to attracting and retaining outstanding and diverse faculty and staff that will enhance our stature of preeminence in our three missions of teaching, scholarship, and full engagement in our community, the state of Maryland, and in the world.

Background Checks
Offers of employment are contingent on completion of a background check. Information reported by the background check will not automatically disqualify someone from employment. Prior to any adverse decision, finalists have an opportunity to provide information to the University regarding the background check.
The University reserves the right to rescind offers of employment or otherwise decline or terminate employment if the information reported by the background check is deemed incompatible with the position, regardless of when the background check is completed.
Offers are contingent on providing proof of employment eligibility in the United States no more than 3 days after the initial start date. If this proof is not provided within this timeframe, the offer may be rescinded or employment terminated.


Position Summary/Purpose of Position:
Under the direction of the Assistant Director of Project Management (ADPM) and in collaboration with the technical Principal Investigators, the Project Manager is responsible for supporting the research and business services activities in the management of research projects at the Applied Research Laboratory for Intelligence & Security (ARLIS), a Department of Defense (DoD) University-Affiliated Research Center Laboratories (UARC).

The Project Manager provides project management support to Principal Investigators as they execute sponsored research projects. As a Project Manager, you will work with Principal Investigators, ARLIS administrative support teams and University business partners to manage scope, schedule and budget. In this role you will plan and direct all administrative tasks to expense resources responsibly, maintain project scope and schedule, follow University and federal rules and regulations, and remove administrative burden.

title: Project Manager

description:
Job Summary

The IT Project Management Office (PMO) Manager is a member of Camden's Information Technology Department, responsible for providing leadership and direction over all Information Technology projects and initiatives. This role encompasses leadership of resource management, budget management for both capital and General and Administrative spending, and oversight of project management within the IT department, with a strong emphasis on budget management, meeting deadlines, and completing project deliverables and objectives while maintaining excellent customer service. The PMO Manager will manage strategic and tactical functions and participate in planning to achieve future business objectives. It is also critical that this position ensures that their area of responsibility and the entire IT department adhere to all departmental audits, Sarbanes-Oxley, and other internal mandatory controls.

The PMO Manager will also liaise with all business departments and work on responsibilities. This role requires a deep understanding of business processes and effectively bridging the gap between IT and business units.

Essential Functions

You will oversee the PMO , including office procedures, tools, all IT projects, and the IT Audit function

Lead and participate in project/area planning, resource planning, and other IT management functions, including employee motivation events

Establish and maintain strong working relationships with all team members to foster a collaborative work environment

Act as a critical liaison between IT and all business departments, ensuring effective communication and collaboration to meet business needs

Engage in tasks similar to those of a business analyst, such as setting priorities, requirements gathering, process analysis, and solution recommendation, while focusing on strategic IT initiatives

Act as the primary communicator on all matters related to IT projects, ensuring transparency and alignment across teams

Maintain and update the relevant system, process documentation, and develop ad-hoc reports as needed

Lead product and vendor selection through a documented due diligence process and manage vendor and contract negotiations, working effectively with legal services

Collaborate with vendors of outsourced functions, managed services, maintenance agreements, and service agreements

Work closely with IT managers and managers on projects, such as implementing business application software

Collaborate with the IT management team to maximize resource utilization and ensure efficient project delivery

Directly oversee projects, ensuring successful execution and alignment with business goals

Develop and maintain strong communication and collaboration across IT and business areas to achieve project and functional area goals

Work with internal and external auditors to track assigned technology findings through resolution, ensuring compliance with Sarbanes-Oxley controls.

Ensure accurate creation and maintenance of all assigned capital project budgets and deliverables, including labor tracking.

Develop and update support or IT business processes to support new projects or accommodate the evolving needs of a growing company.

Uphold and ensure adherence to Camden's IT policies and internal controls, including the IT Computer Policy.

Requirements

Bachelors degree in Technology preferred

5+ years in a leadership or managerial role, overseeing a team of technical professionals

Management certification, such as PMP or equivalent

Technical Proficiency:
Proficient in Microsoft O365 and Microsoft Project. Experience with Trello, Jira, Monday.com, or ServiceNow is a plus

Project Management Skills:
Expert skills in resource management, project prioritization, timeline management, and project delivery tracking

Leadership & Flexibility:
Demonstrated ability to lead, direct, and oversee staff project work with flexibility and adaptability

Compliance:
Strong conceptual understanding of Sarbanes-Oxley controls and the ability to eliminate risk and achieve real value through compliance

Communication Skills:
Strong verbal and written communication skills, with the ability to effectively communicate across all layers of the organization

Analytical Skills:
Strong analytical skills, solid understanding of IT technical issues, and aptitude for analytical problem-solving

Organizational Skills:
Excellent organizational skills focusing on controls, processes, and procedures.

Travel:
Minimal travel is required

Business Acumen:
Ability to grasp and comprehend business functions and their implications on IT projects

Multi-tasking:
Proven ability to manage multiple tasks and priorities effectively

And here’s the fine print HR wants you to know:
Job is intermittently sedentary but requires mobility (i.e., climb stairs)

Will use some repetitive motion of hand-wrist in using computer and writing

Works in a typical office setting

Emotional stability and personal maturity are important attributes in this position

Must handle stressful, urgent, novel and diverse work situations on a daily basis

May require long hours and odd schedules (including weekends)

Position requires periodic travel by automobile to handle work-related activities

May require airline travel, out-of-town and /or overnight trips

Attendance and punctuality is essential for success in this position

Hazards can be minimized with proper lifting techniques, SDS, general safety training, and wearing appropriate PPE

Contact your HR team for the position’s Physical Demands Analysis

This job description is not an all-inclusive list of duties and responsibilities. Camden may add or change responsibilities in order to meet business and organizational needs. Employees must meet qualification standards that are job-related and consistent with business necessity and must be able to perform the essential functions of the position, with or without reasonable accommodations.
