description:
The HR Project Manager is a seasoned professional role. Applies in-depth disciplinary knowledge, contributing to the development of new techniques and the improvement of processes and work-flow for the area or function. Integrates subject matter and industry expertise within a defined area. Requires in-depth understanding of how areas collectively integrate within the sub-function as well as coordinate and contribute to the objectives of the function and overall business. Evaluates moderately complex and variable issues with substantial potential impact, where development of an approach/taking of an action involves weighing various alternatives and balancing potentially conflicting situations using multiple sources of information. Requires good analytical skills in order to filter, prioritize and validate potentially complex and dynamic material from multiple sources. Strong communication and diplomacy skills are required. Regularly assumes informal/formal leadership role within teams. Involved in coaching and training of new recruits. Significant impact in terms of project size, geography, etc. by influencing decisions through advice, counsel and/or facilitating services to others in area of specialization. Work and performance of all teams in the area are directly affected by the performance of the individual.
The Process and Program Design team is a group of professional Program and Process Managers within HR Workforce Intelligence Talent Acquisition division, Strategy Solutions Delivery team. Our primary responsibility is to provide Program and Process Management execution leadership to drive implementation strategy and delivery of strategic Initiatives, Programs and Projects; including management of resources, execution delivery, partnership with stakeholder groups including Global Functions Technology (GFT) and the Business Execution team.
As part of the team of diverse and supportive professionals, the main tasks are focused on close collaboration with senior management and various stakeholder groups across HR and Technology divisions to establish strong program foundations and drive the execution of regulatory and business driven initiatives.
This person will have the opportunity to work on our Global Recruitment Ecosystem, comprised of marketing connectivity, assessments, workday recruitment, interviewing and offer integrations, and much more. The maintenance and optimization of this ecosystem touches millions of annual applicants and hundreds of internal stakeholders across the globe. The team is currently focused on evaluating system functionality and operational structures, along with new implementations and our existing workday footprint.

As a HR Project Manager you will:
Supports planning, directing and coordination of day-to-day activities of running a program or portfolio of programs.
Assists with business case, review business requirements, gap analysis, feasibility study in long term benefit, requirement, and solution review with stakeholders.
Finalizes the project plan with stakeholders and track closely for successful project delivery.
Implements advanced strategies for gathering, reviewing and analyzing data requirements.
Meets with end users to understand business needs, write requirements, conduct walk throughs on requirement documents and obtain Project Sponsor, Product and Operations approvals.
Reviews Functional Requirements to Business Requirements to ensure Technology has understood and met the end users’ needs/expectations.
Prioritizes requirements and create conceptual prototypes and mock-ups.
Partners with Technology, Product and Operations Management Teams to prioritize delivery of key projects.
Masters strategic business process modeling, traceability and quality management techniques.
Applies best practices for effective communication and problem-solving.
Successfully compete for the most sought-after business analyst jobs.
Leads team of business analysts and testers to achieve on-time and with-quality production delivery dates for system enhancements for multiple projects.
Collaborates with Technology on any project delays, risk assessment and risk mitigation plans.
Performs project Status reporting to Project Stakeholders, Product and Operations Partners.
Prepare Post project MIS, lessons learned and conduct continuous process improvement reviews.
Understand the bank environment and compliance and regulatory requirements.
Work with regional and global team and implement the best standards across teams.
Ensure creation of program plan and charter benefits management plan, stakeholder management plan, acceptance plan, and central program issue log.
Evaluates subordinates' performance and makes recommendations for pay increases, promotions, terminations, and other personnel actions.
Appropriately assess risk when business decisions are made, demonstrating particular consideration for the firm's reputation and safeguarding Citigroup, its clients and assets, by driving compliance with applicable laws, rules and regulations, adhering to Policy, applying sound ethical judgment regarding personal behavior, conduct and business practices, and escalating, managing and reporting control issues with transparency.
Lead the implementation of medium complex projects end to end with multiple systems and countries involved from a Global perspective.
Develop in coordination with Program Manager and relevant stakeholders detailed project plans, schedules, task lists, risk registers and clear short and long-term approaches to achieve project objectives.
Monitor and track delivery of activity against milestones, including managing dependencies across related projects.
Provide credible challenge to the project’s members on their plans, delivery, and documentation.
Support the preparation of executive / management level reporting.
Support the facilitation of regular senior governance meetings.
Contribute to the effort to deploy global process / system strategy.
Provide support to internal and external audits related to controls, governance, and integration points.
Establish and build partnerships across functions, interacting with HR Cluster / Country senior HR, O&T management with support from direct manager.
Qualifications:
5-7 years of prior relevant work experience, preferably within the Banking industry and HR experience in Projects roles (3+ years), either as a Project Manager or Business Analyst
Multiple years of working in a multi-cultural environment delivering results with virtual teams
Good presentation and communication skills
Experience and ease in interfacing with different stakeholder groups (including Technology Teams, Internal Audit, Senior Management, etc.)
PMP or other Project Management certification a plus
Knowledge and experience of HR Talent processes end to end and systems a plus
Education:
Bachelor’s/University degree or equivalent experience

Position Focus:
The Yale Center for Research Computing (YCRC) advances research at Yale by administering a state-of-the-art cyber-infrastructure, providing sustainable research services, and facilitating an interdisciplinary approach to the development and application of advanced computing and data processing technology throughout the research community.
Essential Duties
1. Oversees the execution and implementation of detailed project plans in concert with stakeholders. 2. Manages several routine projects simultaneously and ensures that the design, testing, training, documentation and prioritization objectives are met. 3. Assists in refining and re-sequencing during the implementation and execution phases of assigned projects, as needed. 4. Works closely with business analysts, technical professionals, end users and project stake holders during the requirements, solutions design and implementation phases to develop detailed project plans for implementation. 5. Works on risk assessment, communication planning, development of performance metrics, and project entry criteria. 6. Creates detailed project plans including timelines, budgets, and resource allocation to ensure successful project completion. 7. Manages client expectations and provides issue/risk identification and escalation pathways. 8. May supervise the implementation team of cross-functional project and technical resources. 9. Designs, develops, and executes communication systems to ensure effective exchange of information between project stakeholders, senior management, and staff. 10. Resolves complex project issues that involve representatives from multiple organizations. 11. Complies with standard policies and procedures. 12. May supervise and train junior project managers. 13. May perform other duties as assigned.
Required Education and Experience
Bachelor’s Degree in a related field and five years of related work experience or equivalent combination of education and experience.
Required Skill/Ability 1:
Ability to manage multiple priorities and deadlines in a fast-paced environment, having great attention to detail and ability to adapt quickly.
Required Skill/Ability 2:
Strong oral and written communication skills with interpersonal skills to work effectively with staff, faculty and other professionals.
Required Skill/Ability 3:
Ability to analyze issues, respond and solve problems following through to ensure successful completion of projects.
Required Skill/Ability 4:
Proven ability to work within a team, requiring a high level of cooperation within the work group.
Required Skill/Ability 5:
Experience identifying and analyzing supplier capabilities and use of appropriate metrics for decision making.
Preferred Education, Experience and Skills:
Proven track record in successfully delivering AI/ML projects. Experience working with/on government sponsored grants or contracts. Ability to ensure compliance with university, federal and sponsor guidelines and regulations. Experience managing projects related to data center infrastructure such as power, cooling, and networking.

Preferred Licenses or Certifications:
Project Management Professional Certification certification is strongly preferred.

title: Project Manager

description:
Plans, manages, and coordinates multiple special projects in support of activities to ensure goals and objectives of mid-sized project or multiple phases of large project are accomplished within prescribed time-frame and funding parameters. Partners with the leadership to design project plans requiring assessment, research and analysis. Manages implementation of project plans and evaluates outcomes.
Job Responsibility
Partners with management to define project goals, objectives, target initiatives, timelines and budgets; assists with design of project plan; prepares project assessment, analysis, reports and recommendations; interfaces with the leadership to collect financial, statistical and operational data for analysis.
Plans, manages and coordinates multiple projects in support of activities to ensure goals and objectives of mid-sized project or multiple phases of large project are accomplished within prescribed time-frame and funding parameters.
Collaborates with the leadership in assessing and executing strategies; conducts research, identifies industry standards and new innovative practices for analysis; prepares operational analysis, flow charts, presentations and reports, as required by project specifications.
Evaluates analyses, identifies best practices, deficiencies, corrective actions and makes recommendations for improvements in operational processes, policies and procedures.
Presents analysis and recommendations to management; obtains feedback and collaborates with management to develop project improvement plans; prepares financial analysis and identifies budgetary impact of proposed recommendations.
Studies business approaches, applies financial models and makes recommendations around such approaches; coordinates implementation of project plans; prepares and maintains project plans, based on key stakeholder input as well as ongoing/changing needs.
Partners with management to implement project initiatives; partners with management to design staff education programs and coordinates implementation, participates in educational initiatives, as needed; monitors project plan performance and prepares status reports.
Evaluates effectiveness of project plans; evaluates implemented projects on a periodic basis and compares actual performance to pre-established metrics and business plans; partners with management to develop tools and metrics to evaluate performance of target initiatives.
Collects data for review and analysis; prepares analysis and reports for management; prepares additional recommendations and adjustments to plan, as needed.
Operates under limited guidance and work assignments involve moderately complex to complex issues where the analysis of situations or data requires in-depth evaluation of variable factors.
Performs related duties as required. All responsibilities noted here are considered essential functions of the job under the Americans with Disabilities Act. Duties not mentioned here, but considered related are not essential functions.
Preferred Skills
Familiarity/experience with excel data analytic, and someone who enjoys learning new things
Job Qualification
Bachelor's Degree required, or equivalent combination of education and related experience.
3-5 years of relevant experience, required.


Additional Salary Detail
The salary range and/or hourly rate listed is a good faith determination of potential base compensation that may be offered to a successful applicant for this position at the time of this job advertisement and may be modified in the future.When determining a team member's base salary and/or rate, several factors may be considered as applicable (e.g., location, specialty, service line, years of relevant experience, education, credentials, negotiated contracts, budget and internal equity).

description:
Position Title:
Project Manager - Clinical Operations
Department:
Performance Management & Innovation
Job Description:
General Description: Provides project management support to leadership ensuring appropriate and timely communications, developing project plans and milestones, and ensuring successful outcomes. May oversee assigned project staff and/or functional and operational goals. Aligns project outcomes to achieve financial, quality, and service goals.
Essential Responsibilities:
Responsibilities listed in this section are core to the position. Inability to perform these responsibilities with or without an accommodation may result in disqualification from the position.
Project Management. Effectively manages a variety of projects to ensure financial, quality, service, and operational goals are achieved.
Employee Development. Responsible for day-to-day management and development of department staff utilizing development tools, such as performance evaluations and conducting performance management planning.
Resource Management. Ensures that the department has the infrastructure and resources required to perform its role effectively and efficiently (i.e. data, tools, subject matter experts, etc.).
Time Management. Monitors department time lines to ensure resources are available and applied appropriately to achieve desired performance goals in a timely manner.
Process Improvement. Provides support to 3 - 6 process improvement efforts annually, which are expected
to dramatically improve operating performance. May provide best practice examples from other healthcare organizations or industries.
Supervision. Oversees a department which acts as an internal and/or external consulting group providing
process facilitation support as well as rigorous analytical support to project teams.
Assessment. Provides active tracking tools and risk management summaries for all projects
designated by senior leadership and summarizes individual projects progress and risks to senior leadership either bi-
weekly or monthly.
Personal Development. Keeps abreast of recent trends and developments in process innovation and project management in the healthcare field as well as in related industries.
Communication. Maintains effective internal and external communication regarding the process innovation and project management efforts, while providing timely information to executives, senior management and physicians throughout the system and the State. Provides consultative, coaching, or mentoring services to leadership, department staff, and outside entities as appropriate.
Public Outreach. Participates in meetings and on committees and represents the department in community outreach efforts. Oversees the development and implementation of communication plans.
As Needed. Performs various duties as needed to successfully fulfill the function of the position.
General Responsibilities:

description:
Job Description:

Who We Are:
Saks is a world-renowned luxury ecommerce destination. The company’s unique approach combines a focus on the digital customer experience with a strong connection to a network of extraordinary stores that extends that seamless experience into the real world.
On its website and app, Saks offers an unparalleled selection of curated merchandise across fashion for women and men, beauty, jewelry, home décor and more. In addition to the shopping experience, customers come to Saks for inspiring editorial content, access to digital stylists, lifestyle experiences and other world-class services. The company is currently in the midst of a dramatic expansion, driven by significant enhancements to its platforms and offerings, with the goal of becoming the preeminent destination for luxury internationally.
Role Summary:
Reporting into the Manager, Project Management, this individual will own overall development and management of project plans of omni-channel project plans, and collaborate with cross-functional teams to ensure seamless execution. Marketing channels include but are not limited to direct mail, newspaper, signage, email, site content, display, social (paid & organic) and affiliate.
Role Description:
Create and maintain project schedules for all assets from brief through final asset delivery, and communicate any changes as they arise
Work with cross-functional teams (e.g., price management, IT, promotions) to gather requirements, manage schedule and coordinate go-live activities for promotional events
Ensure briefs are completed correctly and adequately before commencement of work, and work with teams to gather required information if missing
Initiate and lead standing and ad hoc meetings needed for alignment and execution, which includes creating and communicating agendas beforehand as well as recapping notes and next steps afterward
Actively monitor project status and proactively communicate and address any challenges that put a project at risk
Resolve obstacles and manage change requests as they arise, working with cross-functional colleagues to adjust timelines, project scope and/or resources as needed
Ensure stakeholder feedback is actioned on a timely basis and that final deliverables meet project requirements
Conduct project retrospectives with teams as needed
Proactively recommend and advocate for solutions to enhance efficiency and effectiveness of processes
Communicate any process changes, tool updates, training and timing for implementation as required
Key Qualifications:
Required Qualifications (Minimum Requirements):
Bachelor’s degree required
2+ years of relevant experience (agency operations experience a plus)
Resourceful self-starter and solution-seeker who demonstrates a high level of initiative and intellectual curiosity
Strong communication and interpersonal skills and the ability to build great working relationships with cross-functional teams and business partners
Proven ability to prioritize and deliver in a fast-paced and dynamic environment, managing multiple projects and responsibilities concurrently
Open-minded and fast learner who responds enthusiastically to change and opportunity, and can adapt quickly to shifting priorities and changing business needs
Owner-operator who takes full responsibility of projects and tasks and can be relied upon to meet deadlines
Team player who doesn’t mind rolling up their sleeves to ensure flawless execution
Exceptional organizational skills and excellent attention to detail
Solid understanding of customer needs and willingness to always place the customer first (both internal and external)

Familiarity with Adobe creative applications and Wrike is a plus
Familiarity with Adobe creative applications and Wrike is a plus
Familiarity with web technologies and content management systems
Knowledge of digital media project workflow, processes, and best practices
Proficient with Microsoft Office Suite, GSuite, collaboration tools, workflow management tools
Your Life and Career at Saks:
Exposure to rewarding career advancement opportunities
A culture that promotes a healthy, fulfilling work/life balance
Benefits package for all eligible full-time employees (including medical, vision and dental).
An amazing employee discount

description:
Overview
Silotech Group provides Advanced Cyber Solutions, Intelligence Solutions, Enterprise/Cloud IT Services and Products, and Managed IT/Security Services to Federal, State, and Commercial clients. We provide Federal Government and Commercial clients with customized, agile technical solutions focused on data, enterprise platforms, service engagement, and customer workforce development through trust-driven and collaborative relationships. Our vision is to help customers achieve their most challenging goals by unifying innovation, integrity, and exemplary services and products.
Silotech Group is seeking a project manager to join our team to lead a SAP Integration Project on site in San Antonio, TX. This project is directly supporting the city of San Antonio. The ideal candidate will have experience leading projects involving SAP systems, APIs, middleware, and integration platforms.
Location:
San Antonio, TX (On-Site.)
Clearance Requirements:
May be required to obtain a Public Trust Clearance or higher.
Essential Roles and Responsibilities:
Ensure compliance with the Implementation Proposal Strategy by overseeing adherence to established methodologies, standards, PMO processes, and tools to maintain project integrity.
Provide comprehensive guidance and strategic direction for the overall implementation process.
Maintain and monitor the project schedule to ensure the timely delivery of all project deliverables, including managing the client approval process.
Coordinate and manage all customer meetings and communications to ensure alignment and satisfaction.
Take ownership of identifying, tracking, and resolving issues, risks, and action items throughout the project lifecycle.
Provide precise and timely status reports, including updates to the Steering Committee.
Strategically plan and coordinate the work efforts of the project team to ensure efficiency and effectiveness.
Lead weekly status calls with external teams to review progress and address any concerns.
Conduct regular internal meetings with the project team to ensure ongoing communication and coordination.
Act as the main point of contact for all project-related matters, ensuring clear and consistent communication.
Perform monthly on-site visits to monitor progress, address issues, and maintain strong client relationships.

Education:
Bachelor's Degree in Business Administration, Management, Engineering, Information Technology or related field.
Experience:
4-6 years experience in project management.
Experience with Systems, Applications, and Products in Data Processing (SAP).
Experience with enterprise resource planning (ERP) software.
Knowledge of SAP products, like SAP HANA, SAP CRM, and SAP Cloud Platform.
Knowledge of SAP integration suite.
Experience in a supervisory role managing subordinates.

PMP Preferred

Job Description
About Wipro:
Wipro Limited (NYSE: WIT, BSE: 507685, NSE: WIPRO) is a leading technology services and consulting company focused on building innovative solutions that address clients’ most complex digital transformation needs. We leverage our holistic portfolio of capabilities in consulting, design, engineering, operations, and emerging technologies to help clients realize their boldest ambitions and build future-ready, sustainable businesses. A company recognized globally for its comprehensive portfolio of services, strong commitment to sustainability and good corporate citizenship, we have over 250,000 dedicated employees serving clients across 66 countries. We deliver on the promise of helping our customers, colleagues, and communities thrive in an ever-changing world.
A PROUD HISTORY OF OVER 75 YEARS
FY22 REVENUE 10.4 BN USD
WE’RE PRESENT IN 66 COUNTRIES
OVER 1,400 ACTIVE GLOBAL CLIENTS
Job Description for PMO supporting SAP Domain
As a Project Manager for our complex global SAP S/4HANA project, you will play a critical role in ensuring the successful execution of this transformational initiative. We are seeking a mature, self-disciplined, and highly organized professional with SAP S4 Global Transformation experience (preferred) who is driven to deliver results. Your responsibilities will encompass various aspects of project management, including planning, execution, internal operational task management, and stakeholder communication and be a sparring partner with the Business Process Owner (BPO) for your domain (R2R, O2C Commerce, O2C Operations).
This is a very complex global project with multiple consulting companies working together for the success of the client. This role will be more focused on the internal processes and activities to support the delivery and administrative activities to keep the project on track to the master plan.
This is a heavy administrative focused role and requires a detailed person to keep activities on track to the master plan.

Key Responsibilities:
Your main person you will be collaborating will be the Business Process Owner. You will be their “right-hand” person whereas you will act as their stand-in and manage requests.
Create and maintain a very detailed project plan for the workplan that encompasses all the Business Flow activities, incorporate the Data Migration milestones and activities needed to be executed by the Business Team, Test milestones and all relevant activities the Business Team needs to participate. Each activity should have assigned resources and defined timeline that is in alignment to the overall project plan.
Drive execution within the Business Team on all activities/Deliverables, with diligent communication and escalation as needed.
Take ownership by leading, guiding, and motivating the Domain team, driving results, providing appropriate support to the teams when needed, involving the BPOs, Leads and/or Program Directors.
Consult on detailed plans for each phase, including forward looking activities and milestones of the workstream as it relates to the overall project with the BPO and the domain resources to ensure they are aware of what is next and are planning for these upcoming activities.
Actively prepare executive summaries in PPT with fact driven content to support Domain status; performance tracking (Planned VS Actuals) against the established plans/milestones by using Power BI. (Ability to perform VLOOKUPs, and Pivot tables required.) Plan and schedule pre-meetings to ensure the messaging is in alignment with your BPO prior to presenting final version. Include talk track for the presentation.
Proactively escalate any potential delays to the BPO and Project Leadership team along with possible mitigation plans both verbally during internal meetings and in documented emails.
Propagating the Wipro/Rizing culture and the Values through actions and be a role model for the others in the project team to follow.

Desired Qualifications:
Excellent project planning skills at a high, medium, and very detailed level. (Appreciation of complex implementation of an integrated application).
SAP Functional or Technical background is beneficial in R2R, O2C Commerce, O2C Operations.
Exposure to the Fashion and Lifestyle Industry.
Must have led projects with 10+ team members.
Fluent in English with fluency in French being an added advantage.
Experience working with international clients / teams.
Excellent communication skills - verbal and written. Ability to articulate ideas and opinions to all stakeholders in an organized, concise and professional manner.
Excellent customer-facing skills, highly engaging and able to spar with the client to have lively conversations about what is best, having a recommendation ready to share.
Qualifications:
Bachelor’s degree in business management information technology, or related field.
Project Management certification (PMP) preferred.
At least 8+years’ experience with SAP and large project implementations, preferred.
4+ full life cycle SAP implementations, preferred.
Proven experience in agile project management and project leadership.
Excellent communication both verbal and written to all levels and stakeholder management skills.
Ability to work effectively in a fast-paced and dynamic environment with multicultural teams, on a global project with flexibility for work hours to support global meetings.
Strong business process acumen for retail, manufacturing, supply chain, Cost Center/ WBS and D2C business models.
Experience in Cutover, Testing and Data Migration a plus.
This is a very complex global project with multiple consultant companies working together for the success of the client. This role will be more focused on the internal processes and activities to support the delivery of the SAP S4 Domain.

Additional Skills:
Expert Microsoft Office, and general PC knowledge.
Expert level MS Excel, ability to perform VLOOKUP, Pivot Tables, produce executive summaries based on analysis of data to be able to tell the story in a concise manner of what the data is telling or the trends are showing.
Strong Power Point skills, including the ability to present to leadership.
Service Now experience.
Power BI reporting and navigating.
Internal travel is limited, yet possible, please share work travel restrictions/visa.

Requirements:
This is an on-site in Clark, NJ role, 3 days a week minimum.
Virtual meetings such as MS Team meetings are on-camera.
This is a global project; the candidate may need to be available in the early mornings (6am ET) to participate in meetings as needed.
All meetings must have meeting agenda/goals/decisions listed and meeting recaps to be issued within 24 hours of all meetings including actions, owners, and deadlines.
Fluent in English and local language (Spoken + written). French is very helpful.
Internation travel will be necessary thus the proper travel documentation such as a passport and work visa will be necessary.

Expected annual pay for this role ranges from $90,000 to $125000. Based on the position, the role is also eligible for Wipro’s standard benefits including a full range of medical and dental benefits options, disability insurance, paid time off (inclusive of sick leave), other paid and unpaid leave options.

The project manager is responsible for planning, overseeing, and leading projects to ensure they are completed within a timely manner, meet project objectives, and align with strategic objectives. Also supports the design, development, and delivery of training programs and communications related to their portfolio of projects.

description:
Scripps Health Administrative Services supports our five hospitals and 19 outpatient facilities, which treat half a million patients annually through 2,600 affiliated physicians.
This is a full time, salaried position. This is a work-from-home position, but requires residency within the San Diego area. On-site as needed, depending on the projects. Eligible to participate in the Management Incentive Compensation Plan.
Join the Scripps Health team and work alongside passionate caregivers and provide patient-centered healthcare. Receive endless appreciation while you build a rewarding career with one of the most respected healthcare organizations nationwide.
Why join Scripps Health?
AWARD-WINNING WORKPLACE:
Selected as one of the 100 Best Places to Work for 2024 by Fortune Magazine and the Great Place to Work Institute for the 16th time. A remarkable achievement as only five healthcare organizations nationwide made the list, and Scripps is the sole healthcare provider in California to be recognized.
Recognized by Newsweek as one of America’s Greatest Workplaces for Diversity in 2024.
Nearly a quarter of our employees have been with Scripps Health for over 10 years.
Ranked 78th in 2023 PEOPLE Companies that Care.
Ranked 95th in Fortune 100 Best Companies to Work for 2023
Why join this team?
The IS Project Manager is responsible for the completion and implementation of large, complex, multi-disciplinary, enterprise wide Scripps information technology (IT) projects. Projects span a wide range, and may include projects for facilities and construction, Epic applications, enterprise architecture and more. This position is ideal for the well-rounded Project Manager interested in leading a variety of projects.
Responsibilities include:
Provide a broad range of project management and analytical services for complex, strategically defined Scripps projects.
Management of the various teams, both internal and external to the I.S. organization, scope definition, schedule timeline, as well as ensuring implementation and completion of multi-disciplinary projects.
All project managers must support and comply with IS PMO policies, procedures, and methodology to deliver successful moderate and large, multi-million dollar projects.
Required Education/Experience/Specialized Skills:
Experience with information services or enterprise healthcare business practices.
Understanding of emerging technologies, resource allocation, capital and operating budget development and tracking, as well as thorough documentation is required.
Expert usage of Project Management tools such as Microsoft Project required.
Proficiency with Microsoft Office, including Project, PowerPoint, Word, Excel, SharePoint, and Visio.
Must possess strong communications skills, both written and verbal, as well as organizational skills.
Ability to manage stakeholder groups and balance diplomacy with assertiveness.
Ability to prioritize and display a customer center approach to meet deadlines while managing multiple high priority issues simultaneously.

Project Management Professional (PMP) Certification or other Project Management Certification/Educational equivalent.

Bachelor's degree.
Experience within a multi-facility health care system.
Experience in the management of moderate to complex projects.
Project Management methodologies, Systems Development Lifecycle (SDLC), Agile, Waterfall, and LEAN Six Sigma Certifications preferred.
ServiceNow experience.

title: Project Manager

benefits: 401(k) matching,Dental insurance,Health insurance,Paid holidays,Parental leave,Relocation assistance,Vision
description:
Why Patients Need You
At Pfizer, our mission is to inspire a best-in-class culture of continuous improvement and project management that empowers colleagues and enables simple, effective processes. Whether you are managing projects or liaising with others, your contribution in this team will help in making our work easier and faster so that we can deliver breakthroughs that change patients' lives.
What You Will Achieve
You will oversee and manage operational aspects of ongoing improvement projects, acting as a liaison between Project Team and Line Management. You will support our programs by managing the review of the status of the project, budget, schedules and preparing status reports. You will assess project issues and develop resolutions to meet productivity, quality and client satisfactions goals.
As a Manager, you provide guidance to operational teams for managing projects. Your planning skills will help in preparing forecasts for resource requirements, and providing areas of improvement for products, processes or services. Through your comprehensive knowledge of principles, concepts and theories of this discipline, you will work towards advancing new concepts and methodologies. You will be able to take a leadership role to facilitate agreements between different teams.
It is your hard work and focus that will make Pfizer ready to achieve new milestones and help patients across the globe.
How You Will Achieve It
Lead projects, provide guidance and manage own time to meet objectives.
Plan and schedule project timelines and milestones using appropriate tools.
Forecast and plan resource requirements (people, financial and technology) for projects across the department.
ROLE SUMMARY
This position will contribute to a top-tier Project Management team to execute and deliver assigned capital projects for a designated site. The role involves leading a cross-functional team, both internal and external, consisting of architects, engineers, consultants and internal stakeholders. Reporting to the Program Manager NE/MW, this role is responsible for ensuring the timely and cost-effective completion of individual assigned projects, aligned with Pfizer's strategic objectives.
ROLE RESPONSIBILITIES
Project Planning and Execution: Develop comprehensive project plans, including scope, budget and resource allocation. Coordinate project activities, ensuring alignment with organizational goals and compliance with regulatory requirements. Conduct project meetings, lead and facilitate stakeholder communications and moderate risk assessments. Monitor project progress, identify critical paths and bottlenecks and implement corrective actions to maintain project budget, schedule and quality. Inform Project Management Office of cost and schedule trending, forecasting and safety metrics for the assigned project/s.
Stakeholder Management: Establish and maintain effective communication with R&D scientists, engineers, facilities and procurement teams. Facilitate effective communication between stakeholders, ensuring project objectives are met. Resolve conflicts and prioritize competing demands to keep projects on track.
Budget & Resource Management: Manage project budgets, track expenses and provide regular financial updates. Allocate resources efficiently considering both internal and external resources. Identify cost-savings opportunities without compromising project quality.
Quality Assurance & Compliance: Ensure adherence to industry standards, safety policy and protocol, and regulatory requirements. Collaborate with quality assurance teams to maintain high-quality deliverables. Prepare documentation for audits and inspection.
Team Management: Manage design and construction teams and develop and maintain site/customer client relationships. Facilitate and inform stakeholders through regular project status reports and governance meetings.
Continuous Improvement: Conduct lessons learned on all project executions including stakeholders for feedback on project performance to inform improved project delivery.
Project Safety & Environmental Health: Manage project execution that implements Pfizer’s environmental, health &
safety standards and construction safety programs while adhering to agreed milestones and program KPIs.
Vendor Management: Source, procure, negotiate and execute project services and construction supplier agreements.
Invoice & Cost Tracking: With support from the project controls team and PMO, review all invoices for projects in program for accuracy and compliance to contractual commitments.
BASIC QUALIFICATIONS
Bachelor's degree in Project Management, Construction Management, Engineering or a related field
5+ years of experience in project management, preferably in pharmaceutical research and development facilities.
Project Management Professional certification (PMP) strongly preferred
Experience in managing mid to large-scale (up to $100M), complex programs with multiple projects and stakeholders.
Proficiency with Microsoft Project, Primavera P6, or other project management software
Strong leadership skills, with the ability to motivate and lead cross-functional teams.
Excellent problem-solving and decision-making skills, with the ability to analyze complex information and make sound decisions.
Strong financial acumen, with the ability to develop and manage program budgets.
Excellent interpersonal and communication skills, with the ability to build strong relationships with stakeholders at all levels
Ability to work with team members to develop a project execution plan
Facilitation, Negotiation & Problem Resolution Skills
Ability to build a strong network and relationships with external consultants and vendors
Demonstrate professional, high integrity, trustworthy and ethical behavior always
Advanced level of critical thinking, communication, presentation, and relationship management skills
Demonstrated sound judgment and ability to make effective decisions independently with minimal escalation to or supervision from manager
Strong knowledge of project management methodologies, tools, and software
Excellent negotiation, communication, presentation, and ability to handle ambiguity
Ability to manage multiple projects simultaneously
PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS
Master's degree in a related field or professional certifications (PMP, etc..)
Familiarity with real estate and construction software, such as Procore or CoStar
Previous experience in a leadership or supervisory role in project management
Experience with GxP and GMP environments preferred

PHYSICAL/MENTAL REQUIREMENTS
Ability to perform complex problem solving and analysis of financial, logistics and engineering issues
Knowledge of legal, regulatory, and safety standards in real estate and construction
NON-STANDARD WORK SCHEDULE, TRAVEL OR ENVIRONMENT REQUIREMENTS
Approximately 10% travel is expected
OTHER DETAILS
Work Location Assignment: on-site 2-3x/week or as needed by the business
Last date to apply for job: October 6, 2024

The annual base salary for this position ranges from $93,500.00 to $155,900.00. In addition, this position is eligible for participation in Pfizer’s Global Performance Plan with a bonus target of 12.5% of the base salary and eligibility to participate in our share based long term incentive program. We offer comprehensive and generous benefits and programs to help our colleagues lead healthy lives and to support each of life’s moments. Benefits offered include a 401(k) plan with Pfizer Matching Contributions and an additional Pfizer Retirement Savings Contribution, paid vacation, holiday and personal days, paid caregiver/parental and medical leave, and health benefits to include medical, prescription drug, dental and vision coverage. Learn more at Pfizer Candidate Site – U.S. Benefits | (uscandidates.mypfizerbenefits.com). Pfizer compensation structures and benefit packages are aligned based on the location of hire. The United States salary range provided does not apply to Tampa, FL or any location outside of the United States.
Relocation assistance may be available based on business needs and/or eligibility.
Sunshine Act
Pfizer reports payments and other transfers of value to health care providers as required by federal and state transparency laws and implementing regulations. These laws and regulations require Pfizer to provide government agencies with information such as a health care provider’s name, address and the type of payments or other value received, generally for public disclosure. Subject to further legal review and statutory or regulatory clarification, which Pfizer intends to pursue, reimbursement of recruiting expenses for licensed physicians may constitute a reportable transfer of value under the federal transparency law commonly known as the Sunshine Act. Therefore, if you are a licensed physician who incurs recruiting expenses as a result of interviewing with Pfizer that we pay or reimburse, your name, address and the amount of payments made currently will be reported to the government. If you have questions regarding this matter, please do not hesitate to contact your Talent Acquisition representative.
EEO & Employment Eligibility
Pfizer is committed to equal opportunity in the terms and conditions of employment for all employees and job applicants without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, age, gender identity or gender expression, national origin, disability or veteran status. Pfizer also complies with all applicable national, state and local laws governing nondiscrimination in employment as well as work authorization and employment eligibility verification requirements of the Immigration and Nationality Act and IRCA. Pfizer is an E-Verify employer. This position requires permanent work authorization in the United States.

title: Project Manager

job_title: Project Manager Operations- UNCH Operations Support
description:
Description
Become part of an inclusive organization with over 40,000 diverse employees, whose mission is to improve the health and well-being of the unique communities we serve.
Summary:
Direct and manage project development from beginning to end and seeing that it is completed successfully within the given deadline and budget. Define project scope, goals, and deliverables that support business goals in collaboration with senior management and stakeholders. Develop full-scale project plans, financial plans, quality audit follow ups, and associated communications documents. In general this person is responsible for the overall direction, coordination, implementation, execution, control and completion of multiple, simultaneous projects ensuring consistency with UNCHCS strategy, commitments and goals.

Responsibilities:
1. Develops project plans, goals, and budgets identifies resources needed, develops schedules and methods for measuring results while maintaining optimum working relationships with all departmental units.
2. Responsible for program and project assignments working independently or collaboratively as appropriate to accomplish the assigned work. Identify issues and assist in developing strategies to address them prior to issues becoming critical. Keep senior management informed of project(s) status and any potential problems or political concerns.
3. Organizes/manages all phases of the projects to achieve schedule, cost and performance objectives, while maintaining the scope of the projects..
4. Prepares requests for proposals and conducts all necessary meetings to facilitate selection of project services and products. Assembles project team members assigns individual responsibilities and monitors project performance.
5. Plans and oversees the preparation and dissemination of project communications. Communicates with top-level management, project sponsors, and functional area managers/directors regarding status of specific projects. Produces project reports for the project sponsors and senior management.
6. Performs strategic analysis for the projects and develops objective means or status reports for assessing the status of the projects that are consisent with standard skills of project managers.
7. Coordinates effort and manages relationships with vendors and contractors necessary for any projects

Other Information
Other information:
Education Requirements:
Bachelor’s degree in Business Administration, Health Administration or related field or equivalency.
Licensure/Certification Requirements:
No licensure or certification required.
Professional Experience Requirements:
If Master's degree, requires two (2) years of professional experience in project management related work.
If a Bachelor's degree, requires five (5) years of professional experience in project management related work.
If an Associate's degree, requires nine (9) years of professional experience in project management related work.
If a high school diploma, requires thirteen (13) years of professional experience in project management related work.
Knowledge/Skills/and Abilities Requirements:
Strong knowledge of project management techniques and tools required.

Job Details

Entity: UNC Medical Center

Organization Unit: UNCH Operations Support
Work Type: Full Time

Standard Hours Per Week: 40.00
Salary Range: $34.65 - $49.81 per hour (Hiring Range)

Pay offers are determined by experience and internal equity

Work Assignment Type: Hybrid
Work Schedule: Day Job
Location of Job: US:NC:Chapel Hill
Exempt From Overtime: Exempt: Yes

This is a State position employed by UNC Health Care System with UNC Health benefits. If, however, you are presently an employee of another North Carolina agency and currently participate in TSERS or the ORP, you will be eligible to continue participating in those plans at UNC Health.

Qualified applicants will be considered without regard to their race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or status as a protected veteran.

description:
Welcome to the intersection of energy and home services. At NRG, we’re all about propelling the next generation of leaders forward. We are driven by our passion to create a smarter, cleaner and more connected future. We deliver innovative solutions that make our customers’ lives easier—helping them power, protect, and intelligently manage their homes and businesses. To do this, we need creative and talented people to join our company.
We offer a dynamic work environment and a unified and inclusive culture. NRG fosters a strong sense of belonging that leads to better collaboration and business performance. Our company programs are designed to help employees develop the skills they need for success now and in the future. In everything we do, we aim to champion our employees and bring value to our customers, investors and society.
More information is available at www.nrg.com. Connect with NRG on Facebook, Instagram, LinkedIn and X.
Job Summary:
NRG Home Cross Functional Project Team is looking for a Senior Project Manager to support large scale projects and programs within NRG Home. This position will be responsible for working with senior-level business executives, IT personnel, and business program resources to execute project management requirements and manage stakeholder expectations. The role will be responsible for managing the successful implementation across all areas of the business (e.g., Marketing, Technology, Operations, Customer Service, Finance, etc.) The ideal candidate must be customer focused and possess strong strategic thinking, problem solving, communication and analytical skills. The candidate must also be able to work in a fast paced, collaborative environment. Additionally, the candidate must be results-oriented and able to demonstrate excellent project management with a focus on planning, execution, monitoring, controlling and risk management.

Essential Duties/Responsibilities:
Defines program charter and clearly defines the roles and responsibilities of individual projects across the program
Establishes controls, governance, and standards to monitor delivery and risks
Creates and executes the strategic roadmap across the planned work
Applies project management frameworks and methodologies to develop a cohesive program strategy, track execution and manage dependencies among projects in the program
Establishes overall schedule and budget for the program and tracks budgets, project plans scope, risks and risk mitigation plans and milestones for delivery
Monitors multiple projects through the program cycle and mentors project teams as needed
Manages and/or assists with the overall delivery of projects across all functions including requirements gathering and project approval, design, build/customization, integration, and testing
Manages and/or assists with requirements and project approval, including obtaining sign-off from all business lines and overseeing change management for tracking changes, once sign-off has been completed
Provides regular communications on project status to executive management and project teams
Builds strong relationships
Internal: Establish strong contact with all business functions and act as central hub
External: Coordinate, act as day-to-day project contact with partner teams
Perform other duties as assigned

Working Conditions:
Hybrid environment
Some overtime required as special projects arise
Minimal Travel

Minimum Requirements:
Bachelor’s degree
Minimum of 8 years project management experience managing complex enterprise level projects and multiple projects in dynamic and demanding environments with at least 3-5 managing large scale programs
Project/strategic planning and business background with understanding of assigned areas of responsibility
Demonstrated experience with waterfall project management
Strong communication skills
Ability to create and maintain executive level reporting and communications
Experience working on technology integration projects and data migration projects

Additional Knowledge, Skills and Abilities:
Ability to communicate effectively to a wide range of audiences in both written and oral form
Ability to develop recommendations/action plans and manage multiple projects simultaneously
Root cause analysis and problem-solving skills
Attention to detail
Ability to recognize the need to be hands-on and ready to roll up sleeves and dive deep when needed accordingly
Ability to prioritize both routine and unpredictable work activities and identify exceptions and recommend solutions to leadership
Excellent personal computer skills within a Windows environment, demonstrating advanced working knowledge of Microsoft Office applications
Ability to work effectively; both independently and with teams
Excellent problem-solving skills and ability to use good judgment to make recommendations and decisions
Comfortably handles risk and uncertainty
Ability to adapt to rapidly changing priorities
Ability to comfortably navigate difficult conversations

Why NRG is a great place to work:

Great company culture!! Voted as a BEST employer by Forbes
A competitive total compensation package, including annual incentive and/or commission
Stock Purchase Plan
Benefits on the first day of employment - Medical, Dental, Vision, Life Insurance, and Short Term Disability, Wellness program, etc.
Company-paid life insurance and disability insurance
401 (k) plan to help save for retirement
Flexible PTO plan
Numerous discounts, including electricity discounts on NRG brands
NRG Energy is committed to a drug and alcohol-free workplace. To the extent permitted by law and any applicable collective bargaining agreement, employees are subject to periodic random drug testing, and post-accident and reasonable suspicion drug and alcohol testing. EOE AA M/F/Protected Veteran Status/Disability. Level, Title and/or Salary may be adjusted based on the applicant's experience or skills.

description:
Project Hire/Internal Assignment Lead Technical Project Manager
Apply Now
Apply Later
Job ID
10089100
Location
Orlando, Florida, United States
Business
Disney Experiences
Date posted
Aug. 08, 2024
Job Summary:
“We Power the Magic!” That’s our motto at Disney Parks, Experiences and Products Technology & Digital. Our team creates world-class immersive digital experiences for the Company’s premier vacation brands including Disney’s Parks & Resorts worldwide, Disney Cruise Line, Aulani, A Disney Resort & Spa, and Disney Vacation Club.
The Technology & Digital team is responsible for the end-to-end digital and physical Guest experience for all technology & digital-led initiatives across the Attractions & Entertainment, Food & Beverage, Resorts & Transportation, and Merchandise lines of business as well as other initiatives including the MyDisneyExperience and Hey, Disney!

The Lead Technical Program/Project Manager will identify, plan and coordinate a set of related projects within a program, to manage their interdependencies in support of specific business strategies across the Commerce Technology Portfolio and Program. This role sits with the 3PO Team which is responsible for program/project technical project management, project financial management, and program strategy, partnering with Technology, Product, and Design to plan and deliver against our strategic objectives.
This is a 24 month Project Hire/Internal Assignment and is a hybrid role that sits in Orlando, FL.

Primary Responsibilities
Drives Program/Project deliverables
Develops strategic planning and prioritization for S/VP portfolios with their leader(s) and Finance; establishes and refines deliverables for key finance milestones (Long Term Plan, Annual Capital Plan, Annual Operating Plan)
Facilitates evaluation and alignment on the delivery of rationalized and prioritized S/VP program input to forecasts in alignment with key parameters (financial targets, ramp-up plans, project priorities etc.)
Identifies risks and opportunities, taking a proactive approach to problem solve; shares reporting & insights with a point of view to make actionable recommendations to Executives on behalf of the Portfolio & Program Strategy team.
Produces monthly expense and capital forecasts, roll-up each forecast by line of business for submission to Finance and/or other business leaders.
Researches and provides cause of change for variances; delivers monthly/quarterly financial & portfolio updates.
Maintains a continuous view of resource demand and capacity across the program; proactively partner with Tech & Digital leadership to plan for leveled resource allocation across development and sustainment activities.
Ability to liaison / translate financials and objectives for T&D leaders, business partners, Finance, Sourcing & Procurement, etc. to tell the ‘story’ behind the numbers.
Recommends prioritization and rationalization decision-making with leaders.
Fosters & evolves partnerships and communication with leaders, Finance, and other related teams to collaborate across the projects for deliverables.
Establishes & maintains an area’s Technology and Digital roadmap, partnering with the area leaders. Engages with a diverse set of team members and executive partners to gain an understanding of business strategies and align with Technology solutions.
Partners with Technology & Digital leaders on product capabilities, understanding uncommitted and/or committed value
Undertakes program/project planning
Identifies, plans, and coordinates a set of related projects within a program, to manage their interdependencies in support of specific business strategies
Develops and implements long-term goals and objectives to achieve the successful outcome of the program
Participates in the annual budgeting and operating plan to support the program
Build strong business relationships in order to define strategic plans and product roadmaps
Manages execution of program/project
Coordinates and facilitates delivery of program objectives
Ensures timely completion of tasks, maintaining program schedule and target dates
Leads and directs high-priority matrix projects, which often require considerable resources and high levels of functional integration and interaction with project sponsors and teams
Conducts program meetings at leadership and/or executive director levels
Develops and manages a project change control process as needed to ensure project team operates within the scope of change approval process
Provides input and feedback to program team members
Identifies and evaluates the risks associated with program activities and takes appropriate action to mitigate the risks
Continually reviews available resources to maintain first-hand knowledge of where resources can be best allocated; reevaluates current resources to determine project resource surplus and shortfalls
Prepares and executes program/project communication
Ensures all program/project stakeholders receive orientation and appropriate training in accordance with organizational standards
Communicates with clients and other stakeholders to gain support for the program or specific projects, and to solicit input to improve the program
Liaises with managers to ensure the effective and efficient program delivery
Conducts regular program/project status meetings with all stakeholders, keeping the stakeholder’s needs and requirements continuously in view
Works collaboratively with development staff and support staff to maintain thorough knowledge of capabilities, and to ensure precise communications between project teams and stakeholders
Creates program presentations and reports for executive leadership, program sponsors and stakeholders

Skills, Knowledge, Experience, Education, Licensure

Required Qualifications & Skills
7+ years of Program/Project management experience (such as: Project Lead, SCRUM Master, Agile Coach) working with technical teams developing enterprise class solutions
Technical project management expertise for a global or national brand(s), working closely with technology, creative and user experience teams
Hands-on experience with practices such as Agile, Lean, Kanban, Waterfall as well as extensive experience with pragmatic blending of styles to facilitate collaboration and delivery
Ability to understand architectural and technical aspects of projects
Excellent organizational, communication (written and verbal) and time management skills with attention to detail
Experience with Agile Application Lifecycle Management and development tools like JIRA, Confluence Wiki
Understanding of Agile technical practices, DevOps and testing concepts (CI/CD, TDD)
Experience in coaching and mentoring teams on project management practices including Agile, Lean, Kanban, Waterfall
Experience with budget tracking and complex cost-benefit analysis
Experience managing and prioritizing projects within the program and working seamlessly with various teams and stakeholders in a matrix organization
Experience working in a team-oriented, collaborative environment
Ability to influence negotiations to achieve a favor outcome for both parties.
Demonstrated analysis/assessment capabilities; Self-motivated and dedicated to performing above expectations.
Demonstrated ability to drive complex forecasts & capacity plans and to effectively communicate risks and dependencies to leaders and business partners.

Preferred Qualifications
Technical project management experience in software development
Project Management Professional (PMP) Certification
Agile Certifications (CSM; ACP; CSPO; SAFe; LeSS)
Education
Bachelor's degree in Information Technology, Business or related field and 7+ years of Program/Project management experience (such as: Project Lead, SCRUM Master, Agile Coach) working with technical teams developing enterprise class solutions
Or Master’s Degree in Information Technology, Business or related field. and 5+ years of Program/Project management experience (such as: Project Lead, SCRUM Master, Agile Coach) working with technical teams developing enterprise class solutions

title: Project Manager

description:
Interested in working in an innovative, collaborative environment with motivated, social people? At Arc Aspicio, you can join a leading consulting firm that specializes in human capital, data analytics, management, and strategy professional services to deliver compelling solutions. Consultants join our practice focused on mission-critical projects, and quickly learn to contribute to and grow our company across multiple projects. We invest in hiring, mentoring, and training smart, diverse, and self-driven professionals interested in all aspects of the company and our homeland security and government clients. We are looking for people who are willing to share ideas and work as part of an inclusive, innovative team.
The Project Manager, IT Programs supports clients in large, complex homeland security and emergency management federal programs. They have at least 10 years of experience in technology and consulting. They have experience using methods to conduct analysis and define solutions, leading technical teams in defining and executing workstreams, directly supporting clients, and understanding how to manage complex projects for the federal government. Ideal candidates have a PMP certification.
IT Project Managers are Project Leaders that have experience structuring workstreams, leading consultants and technologists, and providing consulting, strategy, and strategic communications for the federal government. Ideal candidates bring an innovative mindset, experience managing consulting projects, and a desire to provide trusted advice to clients and stakeholders. They have a strong track record of leading teams supporting complex projects by providing exceptional supervision and management of people, tasks, and deliverables. They understand the information technology lifecycle and have expertise in navigating change management related to technology programs.

Arc Aspicio is currently working in a hybrid work environment where work will be performed at client sites, the Arc Aspicio DC office, and, as approved, remotely on a part-time basis. All candidates must live in the Washington, DC area at the time of employment.

Responsibilities:
Manage complex, high-profile technical task areas for Government clients in consulting and information technology
Apply consulting and management methods to structure and deliver complex projects
Manage and control quality and administrative aspects of task areas to align with contract requirements
Deliver outstanding client service and act as a trusted adviser on organizational capability-building and change initiatives
Manage a technical team and provide mission and innovation-focused support on management consulting projects for the Federal Government with firm deliverables and deadlines
Lead initiatives to implement company strategy, grow new business, and develop our capabilities
Contribute to our company culture, which promotes client-focused teamwork, learning, and helping others to grow and develop

Required Qualifications:
10 years of experience in consulting related to large, complex programs with a focus on information technology
Management of information technology teams that support a range of software, engineering, and technical support activities
Strong understanding of Agile and incremental software development, with proven oversight, coordination, adherence to federal software development lifecycle methodology, and management of outputs
Knowledge and experience using Jira to manage software development, backlogs, workflows, and task tracking.
Oversight of test planning and execution on large software systems
Capability to review governmental policies and articulate and document engineering and information technology implications
Experience with data analytics and reporting software, such as Tableau and Power BI.
Experience gathering requirements, designing, and developing solutions for mission critical projects and activities
Direct experience on Federal government projects and in complex environments.
Experience managing all aspects of a consulting project – including client satisfaction, scope, budget, schedule, risk, quality, and stakeholder engagement – with formal project management processes, methods, and tools
Direct experience with client and stakeholder engagement in a dynamic and mission-critical environment and proven skills in developing strong client relationships
Ability to integrate efforts across projects and workstreams to achieve client goals in a dynamic environment with demanding stakeholders
Desire to work in a fast-paced entrepreneurial environment where candidates work directly with senior-level clients and contributing to company growth through new business and strategic initiatives
Ability to collaborate and work effectively remotely and in-person
Strong interest in homeland security missions (e.g., emergency management, cybersecurity, etc.) and a passion for excellent client satisfaction and collaborating and developing others
Ability to lead a team in a hybrid environment and work on site with the client
Clearance: US Citizenship required (no dual citizenship) / ability to obtain and maintain a security clearance
Education: Bachelor's degree in technology or consulting or a related field
Critical Skills: Entrepreneurial spirit, strong work ethic, excellent problem-solving skills, resilience, flexibility, and learning-oriented
Preferred Qualifications:
PMP certification
Applying to Arc Aspicio: Our recruiting process is very competitive. Therefore, we ask that you submit a brief, tailored cover letter to tell us what you are looking for in a company and why you would be a great fit for a consulting firm in this role. Cover letters are essential so we can understand your interest and experience relevant to consulting.
Total Rewards: Salary is just one element of our Total Rewards which includes compensation, benefits, bonuses, professional development, and other career opportunities. The projected salary range for this position is $100,000 - $130,000. This range takes into account the wide variety of factors that are considered in making compensation decisions, including but not limited to: skill sets and expertise, experience, education, training, certifications, contract and client requirements (if applicable), and other business and organizational needs. At Arc Aspicio, it is not typical for an individual to be hired at or near the top of the range for their role, and compensation decisions are dependent on the facts and circumstances of each case.
About Arc Aspicio: Arc Aspicio enhances the future of our nation by creating bold ideas and bringing them to life. A consulting and solutions company, Arc Aspicio solves problems by applying our integrated capabilities in strategy, design, data, human capital, behavioral science, and technology. The company passionately pursues our vision to be the hub of creativity where people take action to change the world. Employees collaborate with clients and partners to create solutions using a human-centered approach.
Our goal is to attract people who love to collaborate and work in a team-oriented environment. Our culture empowers our employees to learn, share knowledge, be leaders in everything they do, and develop strong relationships with their clients and colleagues.
Our positions are based in the DC metro area and require employees to live in DC, VA, and MD within commuting distance of our client sites and DC office.
Commitment to Diversity, Equity, Inclusion, and Innovation: Arc Aspicio is committed to creating a diverse, inclusive, equitable, and safe workplace and we are proud to be an equal opportunity employer. As a growing consulting and solutions firm focused on innovation, we welcome applications from candidates with diverse backgrounds. All employment is decided on the basis of qualifications, merit, and business need. Equal Opportunity Employer/M/F/D/V
