description:
Collider Lab is a tight-knit group of brand strategists, data strategists and marketers that work entirely on the creation of high profile, business-changing strategies in dozens of countries around the world. We leverage the power of culture to position brands, and modern marketing science to make them grow faster. We are entirely owned by Yum! Brands—the largest restaurant company in the world (owners of Taco Bell, Pizza Hut, KFC and The Habit), so we are on the brand side. At the same time, however, we are free to work on a few exciting projects and brands in other categories if they pique our interest.
We are looking to hire an awesome project coordinator to assist our strategy and data science teams.
Salary Range: $ 67,700 to $ 79,700 annually + bonus eligibility (if applicable). This is the expected salary range for this position. Ultimately, in determining pay, we'll consider the successful candidate’s location, experience, and other job-related factors.
Responsibilities of a Project Coordinator:
Develop and coordinate project proposals in partnership with strategists
Seniors Strategists and Directors will brief the coordinator on the scope of the project, and the coordinator will be responsible for gathering estimate costs (i.e. research estimates for qual and quant), developing a timeline for the project, and creating a client-facing proposal leveraging past projects for reference.
Develop and coordinate client and vendor contracts
Shepherd the day-to-day execution of Statements of Work and Master Service Agreements from start to finish, collaborating closely with the Yum! Legal Team as they draft agreements, review changes, and gain alignment from key parties.
Develop and coordinate all contractor agreements with experts and qualitative and quantitative vendors using a standardized template
Facilitate administrative coordination for teams
Work with teams to schedule large client meetings on an as-needed basis, coordinating internal and external calendars
Logistics coordination for on-site work sessions, such as meals, transportation, etc.
What We Look for in a Project Coordinator:
3-4 years of proven experience in project coordination or similar roles (i.e. account manager or project coordinator in an agency setting, administrative or executive assistant, etc)
Proactive spirit, always looking for opportunities to assist teams
Strong organizational abilities, able to juggle and prioritize multiple tasks or projects in parallel
Excellent communication and interpersonal skills as you will be dealing with multiple teams (i.e. internal Collider teams, legal, clients, etc).
Bonus: experience scoping or managing contracts for qualitative and quantitative market research vendors
Preference toward someone who lives in Southern California and is able to come into our office (Santa Ana, CA) at least once a week or on an as-needed basis for larger client events at our office

Yum! Brands, Inc., based in Louisville, Kentucky, and its subsidiaries franchise or operate a system of over 55,000 restaurants in more than 155 countries and territories under the company’s concepts – KFC, Taco Bell, Pizza Hut and the Habit Burger Grill. The Company's KFC, Taco Bell and Pizza Hut brands are global leaders of the chicken, Mexican-style food, and pizza categories, respectively. The Habit Burger Grill is a fast casual restaurant concept specializing in made-to-order chargrilled burgers, sandwiches and more. In 2023, the KFC, Taco Bell and Pizza Hut brands were ranked in the top five of Entrepreneur’s Top Global Franchises Ranking. In addition, in 2023 Yum! Brands was included on the Bloomberg Gender Equality Index; Forbes’ list of America’s Best Employers for Diversity; and Newsweek’s lists recognizing America’s Most Responsible Companies, America’s Greatest Workplaces for Diversity and America’s Greatest Workplaces for Women. In 2022, the Company was named to the Dow Jones Sustainability Index North America.
As the world's largest restaurant company, we have a clear and compelling mission: to build the world's most loved, trusted, and fastest-growing restaurant brands. The key and not-so-secret ingredient in our recipe for growth is our unrivaled culture and talent, which fuels our results. To that end, we're looking for talented, motivated, team-oriented individuals to join us and have the opportunity be your best, have fun, make friends, and make a positive impact.
We are excited about the future growth of our brands. In fact, as a company we are opening an average of 8 restaurants a day worldwide! This growth creates endless opportunities for professional, as well as personal growth. Customer sentiment and love for our brands is the fuel for our excitement! Taco Bell has been named one of the 10 Most Innovative Companies in the World by Fast Company. Pizza Hut delivers more pizzas than any other pizza company in the world, KFC's still uses its 75-year-old finger-lickin' good recipe, including secret herbs and spices to hand-bread its chicken every day, and the Habit Burger Grill is looking to expand its regional footprint across the country.
Check Out Some Of Our Great Benefits (Some available at HQ locations only)
Recognition based culture and unique, fun events year round
401(k) with a 6% matching contribution from Yum! Brands with immediate vesting
4 weeks of vacation per year plus holidays
Onsite childcare through Bright Horizons
Onsite dining center (yes, you can eat KFC, Taco Bell or Pizza hut every day!)
2 paid days off per year to volunteer
Tuition reimbursement, education benefits and scholarship opportunities
Healthcare and dependent care flexible spending accounts
Company paid life insurance
Generous parental leave for all new parents and adoption assistance program
Onsite dry cleaning, laundry services, concierge
Onsite gym with fitness classes and personal trainer sessions
Discounts for life’s adventures (ex: theme parks, wireless plans, etc.)
Comprehensive medical, vision and dental including prescription drug benefits and 100% preventive care
Grow Yourself Week which is devoted to your personal development
title: Project Manager

location: 11456 South Temple Drive, South Jordan, UT 84095
description:
We are seeking a dynamic and versatile Project Manager to oversee and drive multiple facets of early-stage startup projects, with a strong focus on marketing, underwriting, funding, software implementation, vendor selection, policy creation, and operational setup. The ideal candidate will have broad experience in project management, a solid understanding of startup environments, and the ability to lead cross-functional teams to ensure the successful launch and growth of new initiatives.
This role is ideal for a strategic thinker and doer, capable of managing complex projects across diverse domains within the high-energy environment of startup projects. If you have a passion for innovation and a knack for delivering results, we’d love to hear from you!
What you will be doing:
Project Management:
Lead End-to-End Project Lifecycle: Manage the planning, execution, and delivery of multiple early-stage startup projects from concept to completion, ensuring that they meet timeline, budget, and scope requirements.
Early Start-Up Functions: Primary focus during the start-up of the company will include marketing, underwriting, funding, software selection, and creation of policy, underwriting and funding guidelines to align project goals and ensure seamless execution across all departments.
Resource Allocation: Determine and allocate necessary resources, including personnel, budgets, and tools, for the successful completion of each project phase.
Develop Marketing Plans: Work with leadership team to create and implement go-to-market strategies, branding, promotional campaigns, and digital marketing efforts to support product or service launches.
Market Research: Analyze target markets, competitors, and customer feedback to refine marketing strategies and product positioning.
Support Underwriting Processes: Collaborate with leadership team to establish and refine underwriting and funding guidelines, policies, procedures and strategy tailored to the project’s unique needs.
Software Review & Implementation: Lead the selection and integration of software tools necessary for project management, underwriting, marketing, and operations, ensuring they align with company needs.
Vendor Selection and Management: Identify and negotiate contracts with key vendors for software, services, and technology infrastructure. Manage ongoing relationships and ensure timely delivery and quality.
Operations and Policy Development:
Develop Operational Policies: Establish policies, guidelines, and procedures to support operational efficiency, compliance, and scalability for new projects.
Operational Setup: Oversee the setup of physical and digital operations, including office space, software platforms, and workflows necessary for the launch of the project.
Startup Ecosystem Expertise:
Early-Stage Project Guidance: Provide leadership on all aspects of early-stage projects, focusing on lean startup methodologies, iterative development, and rapid testing of ideas.
Problem Solving: Proactively address challenges and obstacles that arise in fast-moving environments, ensuring projects remain on track.
What you’ll need to have:
Education: Bachelor’s degree in Business, Marketing, Finance, Project Management, or a related field (MBA or relevant advanced degree preferred).
Experience: 5+ years of project management experience in a startup, insurance, financial services, technology, or related industries.
Cross-Functional Expertise: Demonstrated ability to manage projects across multiple domains (e.g., marketing, underwriting, software, funding, etc.).
Project Management Skills: Strong knowledge of project management methodologies with a track record of successful project delivery.
Marketing & Underwriting Acumen: Understanding of marketing strategy development and underwriting processes.
Tech-Savvy: Proficient in project management software (e.g., Asana, Trello, JIRA) and experience with selecting and implementing other business-critical software.
Financial Acumen: Familiarity with budgeting, forecasting, and financial planning for early-stage companies.
Leadership: Strong leadership and team management skills, capable of motivating cross-functional teams.
Communication: Excellent verbal and written communication skills with the ability to present ideas clearly to stakeholders.
Analytical Thinking: Strong problem-solving and analytical skills to assess project performance and make data-driven decisions.
Adaptability: Ability to thrive in a fast-paced, dynamic startup environment with a hands-on approach to problem-solving.
Attention to Detail: Ability to manage multiple tasks while maintaining a high level of attention to detail and accuracy.
Project Management Professional (PMP) or other relevant certifications preferred.
title: Project Manager

benefits: Flexible spending account,Health insurance,Retirement plan,Tuition reim
description:
Project Manager
The Opportunity:
An effective project requires a manager who is passionate about guiding it through the complexities of its lifecycle. It requires someone who is dedicated to identifying challenges, mitigating risks, and supporting a team with vision and focus. That’s why we need you, a seasoned project manager who can ensure our health program achieves success.
As a lead project manager on our team, you’ll design, implement, and maintain impactful programs by guiding team. Our client will trust you to organize and coordinate program objectives, while your team will look to you for direction as they navigate requirements, budget constraints, and staffing challenges. As an authority in the health account, you’ll identify opportunities to grow the business by supporting your client’s mission. You’ll also broaden your expertise in problem management, strategic planning, reviewing contracts, and more. This is your chance to impact the government while sharing your knowledge and expertise of program management methodologies.
Work with us as we help advance the health mission.
Join us. The world can’t wait.
You Have:
8+ years of experience with working as a project manager
Experience with managing healthcare projects in the federal domain, developing and maintaining project schedules, ensuring the quality of deliverables, managing staff and client communications, providing analysis of project budgets and forecasts, and communicating with firm leadership to bring new knowledge to the project and perform regular reviews
Experience with working on a variety of projects or workstreams concurrently and working and leading cross-disciplinary teams towards common solutions or goals
Experience with working on cloud projects and programs from National Institutes of Health (NIH)
Experience with supporting federal government RFIs, RFPs, and client presentations
Knowledge of the project management life cycle
Ability to advocate for staff and be supportive of their development needs
Ability to obtain and maintain a Public Trust or Suitability/Fitness determination based on client requirements
Bachelor's degree
Nice If You Have:
10+ years of experience with managing federal technical and health research projects
10+ years of experience with leading cross-functional teams
Experience with communicating the value of biomedical research data and explaining complex analyses and themes to technical and non-technical audiences
Ability to show a track record of solving large, complex problems
Possession of excellent leadership skills
Possession of excellent verbal and written client communication skills
Master's degree
PMP Certification
Vetting:
Applicants selected will be subject to a government investigation and may need to meet eligibility requirements of the U.S. government client.
Compensation
At Booz Allen, we celebrate your contributions, provide you with opportunities and choices, and support your total well-being. Our offerings include health, life, disability, financial, and retirement benefits, as well as paid leave, professional development, tuition assistance, work-life programs, and dependent care. Our recognition awards program acknowledges employees for exceptional performance and superior demonstration of our values. Full-time and part-time employees working at least 20 hours a week on a regular basis are eligible to participate in Booz Allen’s benefit programs. Individuals that do not meet the threshold are only eligible for select offerings, not inclusive of health benefits. We encourage you to learn more about our total benefits by visiting the Resource page on our Careers site and reviewing Our Employee Benefits page.
Salary at Booz Allen is determined by various factors, including but not limited to location, the individual’s particular combination of education, knowledge, skills, competencies, and experience, as well as contract-specific affordability and organizational requirements. The projected compensation range for this position is $84,600.00 to $193,000.00 (annualized USD). The estimate displayed represents the typical salary range for this position and is just one component of Booz Allen’s total compensation package for employees. This posting will close within 90 days from the Posting Date.
Work Model
Our people-first culture prioritizes the benefits of flexibility and collaboration, whether that happens in person or remotely.
If this position is listed as remote or hybrid, you’ll periodically work from a Booz Allen or client site facility.
If this position is listed as onsite, you’ll work with colleagues and clients in person, as needed for the specific role.
EEO Commitment
We’re an equal employment opportunity/affirmative action employer that empowers our people to fearlessly drive change – no matter their race, color, ethnicity, religion, sex (including pregnancy, childbirth, lactation, or related medical conditions), national origin, ancestry, age, marital status, sexual orientation, gender identity and expression, disability, veteran status, military or uniformed service member status, genetic information, or any other status protected by applicable federal, state, local, or international law.
title: Project Manager

benefits: 403(b),403(b) matching,Paid
description:
SENIOR PROJECT MANAGER (2 OPENINGS)


Req #:
236586

Department:
UW MEDICINE IT SERVICES

Appointing Department Web Address:
http://uwmits_hires.uwmedicine.org/

Job Location:
Remote/Hybrid, Seattle - Downtown

Job Location Detail:
Primary work location may be fully remote within AZ, CA, ID, NV, OR, WA or at the Safeco Plaza Building on the corner of 4th and Madison in downtown Seattle.

Posting Date:
09/20/2024

Closing Info:
Open Until Filled

Salary:
$8,970 - $11,292 per month

Other Compensation:

Shift:
First Shift

Benefits:
As a UW employee, you will enjoy generous benefits and work/life programs.


UW MEDICINE IT SERVICES has an outstanding job opportunity for a Senior Project Manager position.


PLEASE NOTE: AT THIS TIME, WE ARE ONLY CONSIDERING CANDIDATES LOCAL TO: AZ, CA, ID, NV, OR, WA, or those that would be willing to relocate to the Seattle, area.


WORK SCHEDULE
100% FTE – 40 hours per week
Day Shift – UW MEDICINE ITS SERVICES CORE HOURS ARE 07:00 – 16:00 (PST), Monday-Friday


DEPARTMENT DESCRIPTION
UW Medicine IT Services (ITS) is a shared services organization that supports all of UW Medicine. UW Medicine is comprised of Harborview Medical Center (HMC), UW Medical Center-Montlake Campus (UWMC-Montlake), UW Medical Center-Northwest Campus (UWMC-NW), Valley Medical Center (VMC), UW Medicine Primary Care (UWMPC), UW Physicians (UWP), UW School of Medicine (SOM), and Airlift Northwest (ALNW). ITS is responsible for the ongoing support and maintenance of the infrastructure and applications which support all these institutions, along with the implementation of new services and applications that are used to support and further the UW Medicine mission.


POSITION HIGHLIGHTS
100% remote opportunity
Values-based work environment
Active departmental Equity, Diversity, and Inclusion Committee
15 days of vacation your first year – Also, 12 days of sick time, 1 personal holiday, and 11 paid holidays each year
100% matching, 100% immediately vesting 403(b)


PRIMARY JOB RESPONSIBILITIES
You manage a portfolio of complex initiatives that span one or multiple lines of business.
You handle full project life cycle ownership: successful project delivery will include full implementation from initiation to deployment for one major or several minor initiatives simultaneously.
You manage all aspects of multiple related projects to ensure the overall program is aligned to and directly supports the achievement of strategic objectives.
You report on project success criteria results, metrics, test, and deployment management activities.
You prepare estimates and detailed project plan for all phases of the project.
You procure adequate resources to achieve project objectives in planned timeframes.
You manage the day-to-day project activities and resources and chairs the project management team meetings.
You develop with stakeholders KPIs for projects, programs, and/or portfolios.
You understand interdependencies between technology, operations, and business needs in order to help team(s) achieve organizational goals/objectives.
You provide onsite leadership for project team by building and motivating team members to meet project goals, adhering to their responsibilities and project milestones.


REQUIREMENTS
Bachelor’s degree in a healthcare oriented profession, a technology field, a business-related field, or other discipline that demonstrates analytical or communications abilities, or related field or equivalent education and/or experience.
5+ years of overall experience to include the below.
5+ years of experience serving in a project leadership role with responsibility for managing progressively more complicated vendor-packaged system deployment and/or process improvement projects.
3+ years of recent experience utilizing MS Project to manage projects.
Demonstrated experience leading, motivating, and managing various project and program team sizes, including internal and external resources, while holding all teams accountable for performance.
Demonstrated leadership, diplomatic, and motivational skills including the ability to lead up, across, and down multiple business and technology organizations/business units.
Demonstrated experience effectively working with multiple, diverse stakeholders in a complex project environment within a cross-functional matrix environment.
Demonstrated experience managing project work and/or work of others within an established standard project lifecycle framework.
Strong experience presenting to executive sponsors and demonstrated communication skills; both written and oral with technical and non-technical staff, all levels of management.
Strong experience in successfully leading projects and programs to on-time, on-schedule and within budget close.
Strong experience in SDLC, Waterfall, and Agile Project Methodologies.
Experience negotiating vendor contracts.
Experience drafting and submitting budget proposals and recommending subsequent budget changes where necessary.
Experience maintaining relationships by engaging business leaders to establish credibility, solve problems, build consensus, and achieve objectives.
Experience influencing and gaining buy-in from executives sponsors, team members, stakeholders and peers.
Experience researching best practices within and outside the organization to establish benchmark data and using continuous process improvement disciplines to achieve results.


ABOUT UW MEDICINE – WHERE YOUR IMPACT GOES FURTHER
UW Medicine is Washington’s only health system that includes a top-rated medical school and an internationally recognized research center. UW Medicine’s mission is to improve the health of the public by advancing medical knowledge, providing outstanding primary and specialty care to the people of the region, and preparing tomorrow’s physicians, scientists and other health professionals.


All across UW Medicine, our employees collaborate to perform the highest quality work with integrity and compassion and to create a respectful, welcoming environment where every patient, family, student and colleague is valued and honored. Nearly 29,000 healthcare professionals, researchers, and educators work in the UW Medicine family of organizations that includes: Harborview Medical Center, UW Medical Center - Montlake, UW Medical Center - Northwest, Valley Medical Center, UW Medicine Primary Care, UW Physicians, UW School of Medicine, and Airlift Northwest.


Become part of our team. Join our mission to make life healthier for everyone in our community.

Committed to attracting and retaining a diverse staff, the University of Washington will honor your experiences, perspectives and unique identity. Together, our community strives to create and maintain working and learning environments that are inclusive, equitable and welcoming.
The University of Washington is an affirmative action and equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, national origin, age, protected veteran or disabled status, or genetic information.
To request disability accommodation in the application process, contact the Disability Services Office at 206-543-6450 or dso@uw.edu.
Applicants considered for this position will be required to disclose if they are the subject of any substantiated findings or current investigations related to sexual misconduct at their current employment and past employment. Disclosure is required under Washington state law.

description:
Job Description Summary
As related customer equipment, faciliaties or infrastructure projects: responsible for project delivery, profit & loss accountability, and customer satisfaction through management of project related activities and resources. Responsible for departmental operations planning/execution or is focused on execution of professional activities within a technical discipline. Functions with some autonomy but guided by established policies or review of end results.
The job allows modification of procedures and practices covering work as long as the end results meet standards of acceptability (quality, volume, timeliness etc.).
Job Description
Roles and Responsibilities
Non-Turnkey Projects or Product/Equipment-Only Projects. Responsible for overseeing the project and direct or indirect leadership and/or management of project resources for small-medium sized projects (size in relation to GE company) that may include equipment-only, suites of products or non-turnkey projects.
A job at this level requires a people leader with ability to hire and develop talent. Includes direct people management responsibility including staffing and performance development. Utilizes in-depth knowledge of a technical discipline and analytical thinking and technical experience to execute policy/strategy.
Has knowledge of best practices and how own area integrates with others; is aware of the competition and the factors that differentiate them in the market
Uses some judgment and has some ability to propose different solutions outside of set parameters to address more complicated manufacturing processes with technical variety and/or interdependent production cycles. Uses technical experience and analytical thinking. Uses multiple internal and limited external sources outside of own teams to arrive at decisions.
Acts as a resource for colleagues with less experience. May lead small projects with low risks and resource requirements. Explains information; developing skills to bring team members to consensus around topics within field. Conveys performance expectations and may handle sensitive issues.
Required Qualifications
Bachelor's degree from an accredited university or college (or a high school diploma / GED with at least 6 years of experience in Job Family Group(s)/Function(s)).
Desired Characteristics
Strong oral and written communication skills. Demonstrated ability to analyze and resolve problems. Ability to document, plan, market, and execute programs. Established project management skills.
About Us
Inclusion & Diversity At GE, we believe in the value of your unique identity, background, and experiences. We are committed to fostering an inclusive culture, where everyone feels empowered to do their best work because they feel accepted, respected and that they belong.
Click here to learn more: Inclusion, Diversity & Equality | GE Vernova (gecareers.com)
For U.S. based candidates only, for purposes of complying with U.S. pay transparency requirements, the base pay range for this position is $100,100-$133,400 USD Annual.
The specific pay offered may be influenced by a variety of factors, including the candidate’s experience, education, and skill set. This position is also eligible for a Variable Incentive (VIC PW ) Bonus of 10%.
The Company pays a geographic differential of 110%, 120% or 130% of salary in certain areas.
This position will stay open on the career website until at least May 12, 2024
Benefits Available to You:
GE employees rise to the challenge of building a world that works. In order to meet this mission, we provide varied, competitive benefits to help support our workforce: https://jobs.gecareers.com/global/en/ge-career-benefits
Our compensation & benefits are designed to help you manage your personal and family needs, while rewarding high performers. We offer a robust benefits package depending on your employment status and your national requirements.
A healthy, balanced lifestyle can mean different things to different people. We've created programs that support the way you live and work today.
GE invests to provide opportunities to grow your career by providing a path for continued on-the-job learning and development.
Healthcare benefits include medical, dental, vision, and prescription drug coverage; access to a Health Coach, a 24/7 nurse-based resource; and access to the Employee Assistance Program, providing 24/7 confidential assessment, counseling, and referral services.
Retirement benefits include the GE Retirement Savings Plan, a tax-advantaged 401(k) savings opportunity with company matching contributions and company retirement contributions, as well as access to Fidelity resources and planning consultants.
Other benefits include tuition assistance, adoption assistance, paid parental leave, disability insurance, life insurance, and paid time-off for vacation or illness.
General Electric Company, Ropcor, Inc., their successors, and in some cases their affiliates, each sponsor certain employee benefit plans or programs (i.e., is a “Sponsor”). No individual has a vested right to any benefit under a Sponsor’s welfare benefit plan or program. This document does not create a contract of employment with any individual.

title: Project Manager

description:
Lead the planning, deployment, and lifecycle management of technology products to align with business goals and ensure customer satisfaction. Collaborate with stakeholders, developers, and team members to drive technology solutions, with a focus on data center infrastructure, client technology projects, and IT service management.

Key Responsibilities:
Manage projects related to data center infrastructure (servers, storage, network, cloud) and client technologies (desktop/laptop replacements, managed print services, IT Service Management solutions like Jira or ServiceNow).
Perform research, analysis, and stakeholder coordination to develop and manage technology solutions.
Oversee project management, process improvement, and solution design to meet business and operational goals.
Utilize Agile/SAFe methodologies to deliver technology solutions and ensure business value.
Supervise, train, and develop employees; maintain accurate reports and records.

Qualifications:
Knowledge: Advanced understanding of Agile/SAFe methodologies, business management, software/hardware solutions, and software development lifecycle.
Skills: Proficiency in modern computers, software, and IT service management tools.
Abilities: Develop technology strategies, lead cross-functional teams, manage multiple initiatives, and communicate effectively.

Education & Experience:
Bachelor’s degree in computer science, engineering, business management, or related field, plus three years of experience in business systems analysis, product management, or related areas.

Desirable Qualifications:
Certifications like PMP, Scrum Master, Agile project management, Lean Six Sigma Green Belt, or a master’s degree in a related field.

What to Expect
The Project Manager will support the Sr Staff Project Manager and Litigation team by managing cost control, tracking, and reporting along with other tasks related to legal project management.

Work closely with the attorneys on developing budgets, cost saving methodologies and staffing strategies

Identify opportunities for process improvement initiatives and knowledge management projects; and, where appropriate, develop and promote best practices - ability to interpret data effectively and present findings to management and attorneys using data visualization tools (e.g., PowerBI) is a plus

Ability to communicate effectively and efficiently and exceptional communication and interpersonal skills capable of maintaining strong relationships
Highly effective creating business process and procedures; financial modeling experience and ability to maintain complex spreadsheets (use of formulas, sophisticated data presentation, pivot tables, dashboards, etc.)

title: IT Project Manager

description:
Discover Your Career at Emory University:
Emory University is a leading research university that fosters excellence and attracts world-class talent to innovate today and prepare leaders for the future. We welcome candidates who can contribute to the diversity and excellence of our academic community.
Description:
KEY RESPONSIBILITIES:
Coordinates, plans, supports, and executes enterprise-wide IT projects.
Provides strategic input for project plan development, budget, and scope.
Manages the Project Management Life Cycle from beginning to end and establishes cohesion for achieving multi-disciplinary stakeholder and project team buy-in.
Applies industry-accepted methodologies (i.e., Project Management Institute [PMI] with a focus on Agile/Scrum delivery) to ensure adherence to project management standards and requirements and to provide stakeholders with continual reports on project progress and performance.
Assists and supports Project Management Office (PMO) employees.
Performs project management research to improve and refine skills and to identify trends and best practices for improving PMO performance.
Meets with stakeholders to validate business cases and to gather facts for establishing and gaining agreement on project charters.
Creates project charters and analyzes business cases to validate and clarify issues, justify use of project resources and to anticipate risks.
Consults with project sponsors to clarify project directives, scopes, deliverables, and timelines and to analyze risk.
Conducts bid sessions and/or vendor RFP efforts to select and manage suppliers and supplier payments.
Applies PM tools and methodologies to ensure project milestones are achieved and scope is maintained.
Observes project team dynamics to ensure effective team member synergies and to resolve issues.
Creates progressive project milestones for facilitating smaller-scale achievements and to motivate the project team.
Gathers and analyzes project metrics to evaluate project performance and to manage issues, risk and changes of scope.
Communicates with stakeholders, senior management, and project leaders to review project progress, discuss issues and resolutions and to authorize scope changes.
Utilizes PM tools to manage project timelines and accuracy, ensure project resource commitments are met, and to track activities and variances.
Performs assessments throughout projects to identify risks and potential impact and to develop response strategies for managing and mitigating risk factors.
Closes project contracts to validate supplier statements of work (SOWs) and verify deliverables.
Conducts project management research and studies trends and developments under the direction of the PMO Director to support PMO team members and industry colleagues.
Assists the School of Medicine IT Director in prioritizing project work.
Performs related responsibilities as required.
MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS:
A bachelor's degree in a related field and three years of Project Management experience, OR an equivalent combination of education, training, and/or experience.
Project Management Professional (PMP) certification.

NOTE: Tasks related to this position can be performed remotely with only occasional visits to an Emory University location. Eastern (EST) time zone business hours may apply. Emory reserves the right to change this status with notice to employee. Emory does not approve as a primary work location in the following states; NJ, AK, and HI, any U.S. Territories or outside of the United States.
Emory Supports a Diverse and Inclusive Culture: Emory University is dedicated to providing equal opportunities and equal access to all individuals regardless of race, color, religion, ethnic or national origin, gender, genetic information, age, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, and veteran's status. Emory University does not discriminate in admissions, educational programs, or employment on the basis of any factor stated above or prohibited under applicable law. Students, faculty, and staff are assured of participation in University programs and in the use of facilities without such discrimination. Emory University complies with Executive Order 11246, as amended, Section 503 of the Rehabilitation Act of 1973, the Vietnam Era Veteran's Readjustment Assistance Act, and applicable executive orders, federal and state regulations regarding nondiscrimination, equal opportunity and affirmative action. Emory University is committed to achieving a diverse workforce through application of its affirmative action, equal opportunity and nondiscrimination policy in all aspects of employment including recruitment, hiring, promotions, transfers, discipline, terminations, wage and salary administration, benefits, and training. Inquiries regarding this policy should be directed to the Emory University Department of Equity and Inclusion, 201 Dowman Drive, Administration Building, Atlanta, GA 30322.
Emory University is committed to providing reasonable accommodations to qualified individuals with disabilities upon request. title: IT Project Manager

location: 430 South Capitol Street Southeast, Washington, DC 20003
description:
The ASDC Project Manager will take over key logistical and operational support pieces for both the Best Practices Institute and the broader ASDC, reporting to the ASDC Deputy Executive Director with duties additionally assigned by ASDC Executive Director and BPI Training Director.
While job duties will not be limited to purely administrative functions – political, communications, and operations expertise are very much needed to succeed in this role – ensuring the ASDC team has the bandwidth to support all 57 State Democratic Parties through this historic election cycle is the most crucial metric of success for this position.
Responsibilities:
Operations Support - Internal
Creating and monitoring the completion of lists, documents, and trackers – including following up with staff as needed
Attend and provide written report-outs on Department Coordinators meetings
Preparing meeting agenda and other documents
Managing meeting notes, including assigning rotating note-takers
Staff and run all Zoom meetings
Operations Support - External
Own and manage calendar invitations and zoom / google meet links
Lead certain external meetings e.g. one-off briefings with issue partners
Provide logistical support for ASDC’s December meeting, including tracking hotel space changes, F+B, meeting materials, etc.

Training Support
Update the BPI Victory Vault – including pulling lists, vetting, working with Help Desk on approvals, sending welcome emails to new members, and updating / organizing both new and existing content
Updating the BPI Newsletter list
Writing email communications for State Party staff and members, activists, and external partners
Updating the State Party Jobs section of the DNC website
Updating the Training Calendar

Communications
Pull and compile clips and relevant political updates from each State Party on a daily basis; take charge of finalizing and submitting weekly reports
Keep track of items for and provide drafting support with leadership scripts, future external meeting topics, etc.
Regularly update ASDC new member information across all platforms
Draft and send email blasts to the membership
Support ASDC ED + Deputy ED in managing and tracking correspondence

Finance
Assist with creating dues invoices, tracking payments received, outstanding invoice chase, and regular dues reports
Processing checks, invoices, and reimbursement requests for leadership review
Support the creation of regular budget and finance reports for leadership
Support the creation of more defined finance and accounting procedures to help organize and optimize workflows in this area, including organizing both digital and hard-copy financial records
Code American Express statements and other finance data entry as needed

Other Projects
Lead updates to the ASDC page of the DNC website
Work with BPI on building out the program for ASDC’s fall intern
Create a social media plan for ASDC that can be executed at a high level during the election season and has a ramp-down plan for periods with fewer staff

Qualifications:
At least 3 cycles of experience with State Parties, campaigns, or political / partner / consulting organizations.
Experience with Zoom, the full suite of Google tools, and ideally other specialized tools like VAN, MailChimp, etc.
A strong command of social media and news sources.
Exceptional verbal + written communication, organization, and interpersonal skills.
The ability to simultaneously manage multiple deadlines in a forward-thinking, solutions-oriented manner.

The ASDC Project Manager position will require travel, which could be up to 15% of the time. The starting salary for the is $78,500 salary, on an annualized basis, commensurate with experience and qualifications. This is a full-time, exempt position that may require work on weekends, and has an end date of December 15, 2024.
title: Project Manager

benefits: Disability insurance,Flexible schedule,Health insurance,Paid parental leave,Paid time off,Paren
description:
Job Description
What You'll Do

Avalara is seeking a Senior Project Manager for the newly created Business Transformation PMO, who will ensure a high degree of integrity and lead project execution and alignment with functional teams. Reporting to the Director of Business Transformation PMO, the Senior Project Manager will be responsible for a broad range of activities including project management of cross-functional initiatives, establishing process and rigor with our partners, and integrating best practices.

The Senior Project Manager will need to possess outstanding thought leadership, strategic thinking, analytical and organizational skills, and will have a proven record of excellence, operating independently and thriving within a high performing team environment. Highly motivated self-starter who can lead projects with limited guidance. Ability to proactively anticipate needs and take action to support what is in the best interest of the business.

A successful candidate will be detail oriented, collaborative, and possess the ability to articulate a process and structure that will allow multiple teams to achieve their goals across the organization. Strong candidates will have operational experience a proven track record in taking on end-to-end ownership and successfully delivering results in a fast-paced and dynamic business environment.

This role will report directly to the Director, Business Transformation PMO
We will consider fully remote candidates
#LI-Remote


Job Duties
Drive cross-functional decision making
Create & manage project plans to deliver on company priorities
Operationalize and build scalable processes
Define business metrics to track operational effectiveness and performance of projects and identify opportunities for improvement
Facilitate the creation of key initiative project plans, scope and objectives
Identify required resources needed to reach objectives and manage resources in an effective and efficient manner
Provide project updates on a consistent basis to various stakeholders about strategy, adjustments, and progress
Utilize industry best practices, techniques, and standards throughout entire project execution
Provide executive readout summaries, as required, on specific key projects

What You'll Need to be Successful
5+ years of Project Management experience
Project Management Professional (PMP) certification strongly preferred
Highly proficient in Microsoft Office, with an emphasis on PowerPoint presentations
Proficient in the use of Jira (Confluence proficiency a plus)
Proven ability to coordinate teams, align goals, and drive execution
Able to gain support by influencing peers and senior leadership
Proven ability to solve problems creatively
Demonstrated leadership, versatility, and integrity
Lean Six Sigma Black Belt certification a plus

About the Team

The Business Transformation PMO drives program delivery across multiple lines of business.

Pay Range Details
The base pay range(s) below are provided in compliance with state specific laws. Pay ranges may be different in other locations.

Colorado $105,900 - $169,500 (annually)
Washington $105,900 - $152,100 (annually)
California $105,900 - $187,200 (annually)
New York $117,000 - $187,200 (annually)

The pay range above is the general base pay range for you in the state listed. Your actual salary/wage may be based on multiple factors, such as geographic location, candidate experience and qualifications, and market and business considerations. This role is eligible for an annual bonus based on personal and company performance, depending on the terms of the applicable plan and your role.


How We'll Take Care of You

Total Rewards
In addition to a great compensation package, paid time off, and paid parental leave, many Avalara employees are eligible for bonuses.

Health & Wellness
Benefits vary by location but generally include private medical, life, and disability insurance.

Inclusive culture and diversity
Avalara strongly supports diversity, equity, and inclusion, and is committed to integrating them into our business practices and our organizational culture. We also have a total of 8 employee-run resource groups, each with senior leadership and exec sponsorship.

Flexible hybrid working
We support hybrid work and flexible schedules for our employees.

Learn more about our benefits by region here: https://careers.avalara.com/


About Avalara

We’re Avalara. We’re defining the relationship between tax and tech.

We’ve already built an industry-leading cloud compliance platform, processing nearly 40 billion customer API calls and over 5 million tax returns a year.

Last year, we became a billion-dollar business, and our tribe expanded by a cool thousand people - there’s nearly 5,000 of us now. Our growth is real, and we’re not slowing down - not until we’ve achieved our mission - to be part of every transaction in the world.

We’re bright, innovative and disruptive, like the orange we love to wear. It captures our quirky spirit and optimistic mindset. It shows off the culture we’ve designed, that empowers our people to win. Ownership and achievement go hand in hand here. We instill passion in our people through the trust we place in them.

We’ve been different from day one. Join us, and your career will be too.

EEO Statement
We’re an Equal Opportunity Employer. Supporting diversity and inclusion is a cornerstone of our company — we don’t want people to fit into our culture, but to enrich it. All qualified candidates will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, creed, religion, age, gender, national orientation, disability, sexual orientation, US Veteran status, or any other factor protected by law. If you require any reasonable adjustments during the recruitment process, please let us know.

description:
Risepoint assists primarily regional universities in increasing their access and impact by making their academic programs available to students online. Founded in 2007, Risepoint's mission is to expand access to high-quality, affordable, and workforce-relevant education, especially for working and adult students. Risepoint brings single-minded dedication to student success, an integrated set of services, and data-driven performance to our collaboration with university partners.
The Senior Project Manager provides leadership and oversight to a team of project managers while also managing strategic projects and initiatives directly. As the key liaison between business stakeholders, teams and resources, the Senior Project Manager will ensure effective backlog management, define and execute upon key priorities and continuously improve upon processes and methodologies.
A Day in the Life:
The essential functions of this role are as follows:
Exhibits leadership and helps build high-performing teams.
Work with Project Sponsor and stakeholders to complete project charter, technical requirements, and business requirements to outline the project’s scope, goals, deliverables, required resources, budget, and timing
Facilitates stand-up and status meetings/ceremonies and monitors progress against commitments.
Leads project prioritization, capacity planning and risk identification/escalation.
Coaches team members and ensures understanding and adherence to processes with quality.
Facilitates the removal of impediments and roadblocks, addresses issues/blockages, and helps minimize disruptions for team members.
Seeks regular input from team members and implements changes to improve efficiency and increase productivity.
Reports the progress and highlights any risks/issues to leadership.
Facilitates large, cross-functional group meetings and planning sessions.
Manage project development from initiation to closure.
Complete work breakdown structure to estimate effort required for tasks.
Effectively manage project scope by ensuring any changes to scope are documented and approved with project change request process.
Track and report project milestones and provide status reports to sponsor(s).
Lead, coach, and motivate project team members on a proactive basis.
Determine how results will be measured and complete a post-project retrospective to determine how well results were achieved.
Develop tools and best practices to management and execution of projects.
What You’ll Need for Success:
You must meet the following requirements to be considered for employment:
Bachelor’s degree in Business, Marketing or related field is required
PMP Certification is preferred
7+ years project management experience; preferably in online degree program management
Experience working in Higher Education and/or agency is desired
Proven ability to lead multiple projects and project teams simultaneously with a history of delivering on schedule and within budget
Proven ability to collaborate effectively on multiple large scale projects with staff at all levels
Flexible, self-starter who is willing to take initiative in a fast-paced and dynamic business culture
Strong organizational skills
Proven track record of strong presentation and communication skills
Ability to communicate with a cross functional team that is geographically dispersed and of different professional backgrounds (i.e. Technology teams, Creative groups, Agents, etc.)
Advanced knowledge of Project Management tools and PowerPoint required, Visio preferred
Risepoint is an equal opportunity employer and supports a diverse and inclusive workforce.
Risepoint offers the following comprehensive benefits:
18 days PTO + Winter Shutdown
12 designated holidays + 1 floating holiday
Medical – four options
Dental
Vision
Life & Disability (company paid)
Flexible Spending Account & Health Savings Account
Retirement plan with company match
Maternity / Paternity / Parental Leave (company paid)
Volunteer Time Off
Supplemental Benefits:
Wellness program
Alternative medicine options
Pet discounts
Accident, Critical Illness and Hospital Indemnity
Personal and Professional Development:
Continuous Professional and Leadership Development Programs
Tuition Reimbursement for employees and their dependents
Rewards & Recognition programs
Risepoint is an equal-opportunity employer and supports a diverse and inclusive workforce.

title: Project Manager

description:
About Lumen
Lumen connects the world. We are igniting business growth by connecting people, data and applications – quickly, securely, and effortlessly. Together, we are building a culture and company from the people up – committed to teamwork, trust and transparency. People power progress.
Lumen’s commitment to workplace inclusion and employee support shines bright. We’ve made the Newsweek 2024 Greatest Workplaces for Diversity list and achieved a perfect score of 100 on the Human Rights Campaign Corporate Equality Index (CEI) for the fifth consecutive year. Plus, we’re the top employer in the communications and telecom industry, ranking 12th overall across all industries in The American Opportunity Index.
We’re looking for top-tier talent and offer the flexibility you need to thrive and deliver lasting impact. Join us as we digitally connect the world and shape the future.
The Role
The Project Manager is the primary single point of contact for large-scale projects with significant complexity, unique requirements or that qualify as “Special Projects” within the Mass Markets Planning team. Responsible for planning, organizing, and managing implementation to meet scope, timing, and overall project outcomes. This role participates in and leads the completion of complex solutions.
Location
This role has been designated as fully remote, US but the preference is for the Denver metro in area.
The Main Responsibilities
Develop, plan, and manage implementation of activities throughout their lifecycle initially driving increased Planner yield, Planner efficiency and Unit recovery initiatives.
Acts as project team leader & accountable for successful overall project completion making necessary adjustments as needed.
Set program objectives, schedule, and establish clear measures to successfully define and meet project deliverables and timelines.
Provide project status updates on a consistent basis to various stakeholders about strategy, adjustments, and progress including executive status updates.
Assess/Manage risk, impacts and potential alternatives and escalate as required to the appropriate level of management.
Through partnership with other staff organizations, identify areas for improvements, define Key Performance Indicators (KPI) & update training, process standards, policies, and procedures.
What We Look For in a Candidate
Required
Bachelor’s Degree in computer science, business, engineering, or a related field and/or 5+ years of related experience
Implementation experience in technology-based environments

Preferred
Experience leading multiple complex projects in the technology industry.
Project Management Professional Certification
6+ years in project management experience
Compensation
The starting salary for this role differs based on the employee's primary work location. Employees typically do not start at the top of the range, though compensation depends on each individual's qualifications.

Location Based Pay Ranges
$80,510 - $107,340 in these states: AR ID KY LA ME MS NE SC SD
$84,740 - $112,980 in these states: AL AZ FL GA IA IN KS MO MT ND NM OH OK PA TN UT VT WI WV WY
$88,980 - $118,630 in these states: CO HI MI MN NC NH NV OR RI
$93,210 - $124,280 in these states: AK CA CT DC DE IL MA MD NJ NY TX VA WA

As with the pay range variety that's based on the region of a country, specific offers are determined by various factors such as experience, education, skills, certifications and other business needs.

What to Expect Next
Based on your job application information you may be given the opportunity to complete a video interview immediately after applying. This will include a set of questions for you to record a response to in addition to Game Challenges. Completion of this video interview is a requirement in order to be considered for our open position. Now not a good time? No worries, we will also send you an email with a link to complete the video interview. We strongly recommend that you complete this within 5 days of yours application date.
Requisition #: 335009
Background Screening
If you are selected for a position, there will be a background screen, which may include checks for criminal records and/or motor vehicle reports and/or drug screening, depending on the position requirements. For more information on these checks, please refer to the Post Offer section of our FAQ page. Job-related concerns identified during the background screening may disqualify you from the new position or your current role. Background results will be evaluated on a case-by-case basis.
Pursuant to the San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance, we will consider for employment qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records.
Equal Employment Opportunities
We are committed to providing equal employment opportunities to all persons regardless of race, color, ancestry, citizenship, national origin, religion, veteran status, disability, genetic characteristic or information, age, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, marital status, family status, pregnancy, or other legally protected status (collectively, “protected statuses”). We do not tolerate unlawful discrimination in any employment decisions, including recruiting, hiring, compensation, promotion, benefits, discipline, termination, job assignments or training.
Disclaimer
The job responsibilities described above indicate the general nature and level of work performed by employees within this classification. It is not intended to include a comprehensive inventory of all duties and responsibilities for this job. Job duties and responsibilities are subject to change based on evolving business needs and conditions.
Salary Range
Salary Min :
80510
Salary Max :
124280
This information reflects the anticipated base salary range for this position based on current national data. Minimums and maximums may vary based on location. Individual pay is based on skills, experience and other relevant factors.
This position is eligible for either short-term incentives or sales compensation. Director and VP positions also are eligible for long-term incentive. To learn more about our bonus structure, you can view additional information here. We're able to answer any additional questions you may have as you move through the selection process.
As part of our comprehensive benefits package, Lumen offers a broad range of Health, Life, Voluntary Lifestyle and other benefits and perks that enhance your physical, mental, emotional and financial wellbeing. You can learn more by clicking here.
Please be advised that Lumen does not require any form of payment from job applicants during the recruitment process. All legitimate job openings will be posted on our official website or communicated through official company email addresses. If you encounter any job offers that request payment in exchange for employment at Lumen, they are not for employment with us, but may relate to another company with a similar name.
Note: For union-represented postings, wage rates and ranges are governed by applicable collective bargaining agreement provisions.

title: Project Manager

description:
Computer World Services is seeking a Project Manager to support the U.S. Customs and Border Protection (CBP), Passenger Systems Program Directorate (PSPD), Systems and Technology Support Branch (SysTech) with and array of core capabilities, solutions and processes to enable CBP enterprise-wide PSPD specific application support and continued operations of PSPD systems. PSPD Systems are structured in the TECS (not an acronym) system framework, a law enforcement tool. TECS is the principal law enforcement system used by CBP Officers at the border to assist with screening and determinations regarding admissibility of arriving persons at ports of entry. The CBP/PSPD/SysTech support effort requires successful delivery of engineering, enhancements, and O&M support providing enterprise-wide, non-disruptive O&M services while realizing efficiencies where possible.
The Project Manager will oversee all aspects of the project and management of task order, leading a team on moderate to complex projects tasks. Analyze new and complex project-related problems and create innovative solutions that normally involve the schedule, technology, methodology, tools, solution components, and financial management of the project. Provide application and system analysis and long and short-range plans for deployment, enhancement, maintenance, and production support for necessary support resources. The successful candidate will be able to: 1) Manage the day-to-day activities of project staff and ensure supported customer IT programs and projects meet organizational goals and requirements in an Agile Environment; 2) Serve as the point of contact with COR and interface with Government to support project activities and also facilitate obtaining timely security clearances for employees; 3.) Implement and provide guidance to staff related to company processes and policies; 4.) Plan, direct, control, measure, and monitor all employee activities; 5.) Oversee the work of project staff; 6.) Work with other department leaders to define, prioritize, and develop project internal and external deliverables.
Key Tasks and Responsibilities
Observe and assess the U.S. Customs and Border Protection (CBP) methodologies and provide recommendations for improvement, both in processes and the use of new tools
Organize, direct, and manage all aspects of contract operational support functions involving multiple complex and inter-related project tasks that often require managing teams of contractor personnel at multiple locations
Develop Project Management Plan deliverable for project
Perform the Scrum Master role or like duty if requested, to include but not limited to standardized Release Planning, Scrum and reporting processes.
Provide daily updates to agile stories and report progress in Kanban charts
Plan, participate and facilitate Design Reviews.
Provide management information on key O&M statistics, to include SLA metrics, as applicable, as well as customer feedback.
Discuss work progress, exchange information and resolve emergent technical problems and issues.
Provide overall direction of project activities
Manage and maintain contractor interface with the senior levels of the customer’s organization
Consult with customer and contractor personnel to formulate and review task plans and deliverables
Ensure conformance with program and project task schedules and cost and contractual obligations
Establish and maintain technical and financial reports to show progress of projects to management and customers
Organize and assign responsibilities to subordinates
Oversee the successful completion of all assigned tasks
Manage/supervise subordinate staff in the day-to-day performance of their duties
Ensures that project/department milestones/goals are met and adhering to approved budgets
Maintain full authority for personnel actions
Plan, direct, control, measure, and monitor all employee activities
Ensure processes are in place for supervision of and interfacing with the Government
Serve as the point of contact for the COR and as the primary interface between the Government and the Contractors
Maintain extensive knowledge of department processes
Provide centralized administration of all work performed under the contract
Responsible for the overall management of the specific task order(s)
Ensure technical solutions and schedules in the task order are implemented in a timely manner
Coordinate with Government personnel in the assignment and prioritization of requested work
Provide individual Program Office Directorate level status reports
Create and submit Weekly & Monthly Status Report
Assure all other deliverables are submitted as required
Maintain a process to control physical access to CBP IT assets
Comply with the Privacy Act, CBP, and DHS privacy policies and procedures when handling PII
Job Requirements:
Education & Experience
Requires a BS/BA degree (or equivalent)
Requires 10 years of related experience, 5 of which must be in a supervisory role
Certifications
One or more of the following is desired:
PMI Program Management Professional (PgMP)
PMI Project Management Professional (PMP)
PMI Portfolio Management Professional (PfMP)
PMI Agile Certified Practitioner (PMI-ACP)
Projects in Controlled Environments - PRINCE2 Practitioner
Scrum Alliance Certified Scrum Professional - ScrumMaster (CSP-SM)
Security Clearance
Candidate must be a US Citizen
Must undergo Minimum CBP Background Investigation check
Other (Travel, Work Environment, DoD 8570 Requirements, Administrative Notes, etc.)
Work will be performed primarily at DHS offices in DC Metro Area / Ashburn, VA
Some local travel to various sites in the Washington, DC metropolitan area for meetings and briefings will be required
Computer World Services is an affirmative action and equal employment opportunity employer. Current employees and/or qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, disability, age, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, protected veteran status, genetic information or any other characteristic protected by local, state, or federal laws, rules, or regulations.
Computer World Services is committed to the full inclusion of all qualified individuals. As part of this commitment, Computer World Services will ensure that individuals with disabilities (IWD) are provided reasonable accommodations. If reasonable accommodation is needed to participate in the job application or interview process, to perform essential job functions, and/or to receive other benefits and privileges of employment, please contact Aaron McClellan in Human Resources at
314.952.5138 or [email protected].

title: Project Manager

location: 500 N Lake Parker Avenue, Lakeland, FL 33801
description:
GENERAL DESCRIPTION OF CLASS
This project management position is responsible for the City's computer resources and technology development and deployment activities. Generally, the Project Manager I is a project management team member and assists in mentoring technical and functional project team members, guiding them through the industry-adopted best practices in IT Project Definition, Management, and Delivery. Further, the position can be called upon to manage simple to moderately complex technology projects fully.

Please note this posting is "Continuous" and can close at ANY TIME WITHOUT NOTICE.
Annual Pay Range: $70,618.86 - $88,273.58

ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS
Assists in developing IT business cases, including ROI, project definitions, objectives, schedules, budget development, resource utilization, project delivery and risk mitigation techniques.
Plans, schedules, manages, and controls simple to moderately complex projects that affect the City's computer operations, applications, and processes.
Assists in coordinating change schedules with the City's various technical and functional organizations, developing standards for the classification and documentation of changes, providing a forum for identifying and resolving conflicting schedules, and acting as a central repository for cataloging changes to the IT environment.
Assists in training and mentoring future potential project management resources.
Administers certain department-specific project plans involving or pertaining to developing and implementing approved technology projects.
Reviews and reports on compliance with adopted IT policies, processes, and procedures through periodic field visitation, analysis of project documents, and personal conferences with supervisory personnel.
Assists with mentoring technical and functional project teams based on compliance review results and other evaluative techniques.
Reviews and reports on the status of projects, the impact of delays on other projects, and the current and projected utilization of resources such as facilities, personnel, and equipment.
Promotes industry-standard approaches to IT development and deployment.
Promotes the project prioritization process.
Promotes continued IT process improvement through standardized industry models and competencies.
May be required to work alternate hours as necessary for the efficient operation of the department.
Position designated as Mission Critical by Department Director.
ADDITIONAL FUNCTIONS:
Development of bid documents.
May administer the IT Change Control Board process.
Performs related work as required.
QUALIFICATIONS (EDUCATION, TRAINING AND EXPERIENCE)
Bachelor's degree from an accredited four (4) year college or university in Project Management, Business Administration, Accounting, Information Systems, Computer Science, or a related field.
One (1) year of experience working with projects in information technology activities.

SPECIAL REQUIREMENTS:
Must possess a valid driver's license.
Must maintain a valid telephone number.
Specialized formal education in project management knowledge areas is preferred.
KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS, ABILITIES
Knowledge of the principles, practices, and techniques of project management.
Knowledge of industry standards for IT development and deployment.
Knowledge of the core business function of all City departments and any interdepartmental relationships that exist for shared technology.
Familiarity with accounting and budgetary cost controls.
Ability to use personal computers and PC-based spreadsheets, databases, project management, and presentation graphics software.
Ability to research topics using the Internet.
Ability to coordinate technology-related projects.
Ability to coordinate projects involving other City of Lakeland departments and private contractors,
Ability to read and understand complex documents and to ensure compliance with their terms and conditions.
Ability to establish and maintain effective working relationships with other employees and the general public.
Ability to communicate effectively both orally and in writing.
WORKING ENVIRONMENT/PHYSICAL REQUIREMENTS:
Requires sedentary work that involves walking or standing some of the time, exerting up to 10 pounds of force regularly, and routine keyboard operations.
The job risks exposure to no significant environmental hazards.
The job requires normal visual acuity, field of vision, hearing, speaking, color perception, sense of smell, depth perception, and texture perception.

All City of Lakeland positions are subject to testing (e.g. written, oral, performance, computerized, interview, and/or any combination). Candidates selected for testing will be notified via email or telephone. Please check your e-mail and telephone messages regularly, including “junk” folders. Test times and locations to be announced.
