title: Project Manager

description:
What You'll Do:
Do you love making connections and solving problems? We have an exciting opportunity to work as a project manager on the Marketing Operations and Technology team, focused on email marketing. This is a highly collaborative and extremely detail-oriented role!

Here's how you will spend your day:
Evaluate project requests and for completeness and clarity, working to identify and close gaps so the email operations team has what they need to successfully execute in support of business objectives.
Consult and collaborate with internal partners to understand needs and identify solutions to accomplish business objectives.
Establish an environment for great creative work to thrive. Help evolve our processes with an eye toward optimization, collaboration, efficiency, and efficacy.
Assist in planning marketing campaigns with available technology and supporting marketing business processes.
Keep teammates and business partners aligned through the duration of each project with clear, ongoing communication.
Educate business partners and manage their needs and expectations, serving as point of contact for email activity.
Manage interdependencies among projects, shifting and balancing workloads across the team.
Uphold project management collaboration tool standards and best practices.
Share lessons learned from past projects to help inform future work.
Operating at the intersection of financial services and technology, Principal builds financial tools that help our customers live better lives. We take pride in being a purpose-led firm, motivated by our mission to make financial security accessible to all. Our mission, integrity, and customer focus have made us a trusted leader for more than 140 years!
Who You Are:
Bachelor’s degree, or equivalent experience, in marketing, communications, advertising, or related field

Proven work experience as a project manager or relevant role.
Must be able to juggle multiple projects at a time while maintaining sharp attention to detail.
Demonstrable ability to communicate, present and influence key stakeholders.
Must have strong interpersonal leadership, and decision-making skills.
Need strong sales and customer service skills as well as the ability to connect and interact with a wide variety of people.
Must stay knowledgeable of the latest marketing trends and maintain proficiency with budget and time management.
Ability to present ideas, negotiate and problem solve.
Great listening, written and verbal communication skills.
Experience using workflow management software, such as Wrike, JIRA or other system.

Experience with Salesforce Marketing Cloud or another email service provider preferred.

Experience working with a marketing communications team preferred

Agency experience a plus

Experience Principal
At Principal, we value connecting on both a personal and professional level. Together, we’re imagining a more purpose-led future for financial services – and that starts with you. Our success depends on the unique experiences, backgrounds, and talents of our employees. And we support our employees the same way we support our customers: with comprehensive, competitive benefit offerings crafted to protect their physical, financial, and social well-being. benefits: Dental insurance,Employee stock purchase plan,Health insurance,RSU,Retire
description:
Summary

Posted: Sep 13, 2024

Role Number:200567868

Apple is where individual imaginations gather together, committing to the values that lead to great work. Every new product we build, service we create, or Apple Store experience we deliver is the result of us making each other’s ideas stronger. That happens because every one of us shares a belief that we can make something wonderful and share it with the world, changing lives for the better. It’s the diversity of our people and their thinking that inspires the innovation that runs through everything we do. When we bring everybody in, we can do the best work of our lives. Here, you’ll do more than join something - you’ll add something. Do you have a passion for creating ground-breaking, impactful features that surprise and delight millions of users? Do you enjoy solving challenging problems in a fast-paced, dynamic environment where you’ll work with many different teams across Apple? If so, we are looking for a Software Engineering Project Manager to join our team and help us innovate and take the most advanced operating systems to the next level!

Description

In this role you will partner with software engineers and managers from our Software Engineering team to define, plan, schedule, and track the work for many cross-functional initiatives. You will be the central hub bringing together different individuals from Software, Hardware and Design, Marketing, and more, to deliver groundbreaking technology across all of our operating systems. For this role, the components and features you will work on involve improvements to our customer support experience and better international adoption of key operating system features and services.
3-5 years experience with 2+ years as a Project or Program Manager
BS in Computer Science or related field

Preferred Qualifications
Strong technical understanding of operating systems and how the various layers of a software stack fit together
Specific project management experience in managing complex, multi-functional software projects
Intellectually curious mindset
Well-developed professional & communication skills, for example: Meticulous attention to detail, highly organized, experience in tailoring written & spoken communications to multiple audiences, proficient in build effective relationships, resolving conflict, and influencing others.

Pay & Benefits
At Apple, base pay is one part of our total compensation package and is determined within a range. This provides the opportunity to progress as you grow and develop within a role. The base pay range for this role is between $136,300 and $248,700, and your base pay will depend on your skills, qualifications, experience, and location. Apple employees also have the opportunity to become an Apple shareholder through participation in Apple’s discretionary employee stock programs. Apple employees are eligible for discretionary restricted stock unit awards, and can purchase Apple stock at a discount if voluntarily participating in Apple’s Employee Stock Purchase Plan. You’ll also receive benefits including: Comprehensive medical and dental coverage, retirement benefits, a range of discounted products and free services, and for formal education related to advancing your career at Apple, reimbursement for certain educational expenses - including tuition. Additionally, this role might be eligible for discretionary bonuses or commission payments as well as relocation. Learn more about Apple Benefits. Note: Apple benefit, compensation and employee stock programs are subject to eligibility requirements and other terms of the applicable plan or program.

More
Apple is an equal opportunity employer that is committed to inclusion and diversity. We take affirmative action to ensure equal opportunity for all applicants without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, Veteran status, or other legally protected characteristics. Learn more about your EEO rights as an applicant.
title: Project Manager

description:
Job Description
BAE Systems, a top-ten prime contractor to the U.S. Department of Defense, enables the U.S. government to transform data into intelligence and provides engineering, integration and sustainment support for critical military platforms and systems. Intelligence & Security provides services and products to the Department of Defense, the government, federal law enforcement officials, and troops deployed around the world.

At BAE Systems, we promote a strong, collaborative culture and provide our employees with the tools, skills and training they need to succeed. We are all about trust, camaraderie, and a shared ambition to lead the world in defense technologies and national security services. We offer flexible work environment to support the balance in your life and keep you performing at your best. Be a part of a company that is part of the community; driven to improve our future and protect our freedom.

We are looking for Program Managers to manage IT projects ranging from simple to complex engineering solutions using Project Management Framework and Agile methodologies while collaborating with mission partners.

ABC

Required Education, Experience, & Skills
We are actively seeking a candidate that has a minimum of 5 years' experience. Bachelor's or Master’s Degree are preferred in one or more of the disciplines described below where specific skills may include the following…
Use PMF and Agile methodologies to manage projects leveraging project tracking applications, JIRA, and other enterprise tools product
Oversee project planning and execution activities to include control gates
Maintain individual project schedules and schedule forecasts
Must possess strong interpersonal skills with tact as they collaborate with technical resources, engineering, developers, mission partners and senior officers
Manage and ensure all project issues are resolved promptly to avoid negative impact to the quality or schedule
Autonomous approach that provides guidance and leadership to the sponsor and their management stakeholders
Provide communication that leads to the understanding of deadlines, assignments and objectives across all enterprise stakeholders
Identify risks and documents program progress including implementation, time lines, issues, risks, quality and successes measures to meet contractual requirements
Develop, maintain, and implement a Program Management Plan that supports a Work Breakdown Structure (WBS) and guides the performance of functional activities performed on the Program

Preferred Education, Experience, & Skills
PMP, Agile, ITIL or other related Certifications
Quality processes including ISO, Six Sigma, CMMi
Expertise and knowledge in the entire development system life cycle
Strong track record of understanding and interest in current and emerging technologies
Creating and managing a shared pool of internal and subcontract resources
Experience working with the government


Pay Information
Full-Time Salary Range: $140690 - $239140

Please note: This range is based on our market pay structures. However, individual salaries are determined by a variety of factors including, but not limited to: business considerations, local market conditions, and internal equity, as well as candidate qualifications, such as skills, education, and experience.

Employee Benefits: At BAE Systems, we support our employees in all aspects of their life, including their health and financial well-being. Regular employees scheduled to work 20+ hours per week are offered: health, dental, and vision insurance; health savings accounts; a 401(k) savings plan; disability coverage; and life and accident insurance. We also have an employee assistance program, a legal plan, and other perks including discounts on things like home, auto, and pet insurance. Our leave programs include paid time off, paid holidays, as well as other types of leave, including paid parental, military, bereavement, and any applicable federal and state sick leave. Employees may participate in the company recognition program to receive monetary or non-monetary recognition awards. Other incentives may be available based on position level and/or job specifics.

About BAE Systems Intelligence & Security
BAE Systems, Inc. is the U.S. subsidiary of BAE Systems plc, an international defense, aerospace and security company which delivers a full range of products and services for air, land and naval forces, as well as advanced electronics, security, information technology solutions and customer support services. Improving the future and protecting lives is an ambitious mission, but it’s what we do at BAE Systems. Working here means using your passion and ingenuity where it counts – defending national security with breakthrough technology, superior products, and intelligence solutions. As you develop the latest technology and defend national security, you will continually hone your skills on a team—making a big impact on a global scale. At BAE Systems, you’ll find a rewarding career that truly makes a difference.

Intelligence & Security (I&S), based in McLean, Virginia, designs and delivers advanced defense, intelligence, and security solutions that support the important missions of our customers. Our pride and dedication shows in everything we do—from intelligence analysis, cyber operations and IT expertise to systems development, systems integration, and operations and maintenance services. Knowing that our work enables the U.S. military and government to recognize, manage and defeat threats inspires us to push ourselves and our technologies to new levels.

Our Commitment to Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion:
At BAE Systems, we work hard every day to nurture an inclusive culture where employees are valued and feel like they belong. We are conscious of the need for all employees to see themselves reflected at every level of the company and know that in order to unlock the full potential of our workforce, everyone must feel confident being their best, most sincere self and be equipped to thrive. We provide impactful professional development experiences to our employees and invest in social impact partnerships to uplift communities and drive purposeful change. Here you will find significant opportunities to do meaningful work in an environment intentionally designed to be one where you will learn, grow and belong.
title: IT Project Manager

description:
Overview:
Project Manager, Business Operations
Onsite - Alpharetta, GA

Aptean is changing. Our ERP solutions are transforming a huge range of global businesses, from food producers to manufacturers. In a world of generic enterprise software, we provide targeted solutions that bring together the very best technology and drive greater results. With over 3000 employees, 50 different products and a global client base, there’s no better time to advance your career at Aptean.

Are you ready for what’s next, now? We are! If being part of a dynamic, high growth organization excites you and you are Strategic Project Manager, and eager to learn and grow, then this opportunity is for you! Our fast-paced environment and dynamic global Strategic Operations department is eager for a mover and shaker to step into this role and become an integral part of our team.

What You'll Do:
Lead cross-functional project management teams to support Food & Beverage (F&B) and high-impact 10X projects.
Oversee 1-5 projects simultaneously, varying in scope and size.
Facilitate process improvements including mapping, reporting, and planning.
Conduct and manage team meetings, company-wide kickoffs, and project coordination.
Streamline project consolidation efforts as necessary across various departments.
What Experience You'll Need:
Minimum of 5 years of experience in strategic operations and project management.
Proven expertise in handling multiple projects with varying complexities.
Strong capability in supporting process improvements and project planning activities.
Experience in coordinating cross-functional teams and managing stakeholder communications.
Project Management Professional (PMP) certification is preferred but not mandatory.
Demonstrated ability to work effectively without setting strategic direction.

If you share our mindset, you can share in our success. To find out more about joining Aptean, get in touch today.
Learn from our differences. Celebrate our diversity. Grow and succeed together.

Aptean pledges to promote a company culture where diversity, equity and inclusion are central. We are committed to applying this principle as we interact with our customers, build our teams, cultivate our leaders and shape a company in which any employee can succeed, regardless of race, color, sex, national origin, sexuality and gender identity, religion, disability, age, status as a protected veteran or any other group status protected by law. Celebrating our diverse experiences, opinions and beliefs allows us to embrace what makes us unique and to use this as an asset in bringing innovative solutions to our customer base.

“At Aptean, our global and diverse employee base is our greatest asset. It is through embracing and understanding our differences that we are able to harness our individual power to maximize the success of our customers, our employees and our company.” – TVN Reddy

description:
A great experience starts with you!
Join our team to help create and develop the future of live entertainment and sports in Orange County!
Once you've had a chance to explore our current open positions, apply to the ones you feel best suit you, as an applicant, you can always see your application status in your profile.
Mission: To enrich the lives in our community through shared experiences, welcoming spaces, and responsible actions.

Values: Be Safe | Do the Right Thing | Be Generous | Include Everyone | Make it Easy | Be Bold
Job Title:
Creative Project Manager
Pay Details:
The annual base salary range for this position in California is $104,000 to $130,000 per year. The starting pay for the successful candidate depends on various job-related factors, including but not limited to the candidate’s geographic location, job-related knowledge, skills, experience, education/training, internal value, peer equity, external market demands, and organizational considerations.
Reporting directly to the Director of Creative Operations and working closely with the Marketing team and cross-functional leaders throughout the organization, the Creative Project Manager will oversee project resourcing and prioritization for the Honda Center and OCVIBE creative teams and manage creative deliverables from start to finish for key programs.
Responsibilities
Collaborate with Marketing and other stakeholders to define project objectives, scope, and creative requirements
Develop project plans, timelines, and budgets, ensuring alignment with overall marketing goals
Identify potential risks and challenges and proactively develop and communicate mitigation strategies
Work with internal stakeholders to prioritize and re-prioritize projects, constantly weighing business needs against bandwidth
Allocate and manage resources effectively to meet project milestones and deadlines
Coordinate with external vendors, agencies, and freelancers when necessary
Monitor time-tracking and project budgets/expenses to ensure cost-effectiveness
Lead, defend, and inspire the creative team, including designers, copywriters, and other creative professionals
Assign tasks, set priorities, and ensure clear communication and collaboration among team members
Foster a creative and innovative work environment, encouraging team members to excel in their roles
Maintain high standards of creative quality and brand consistency across all projects
Ensure that deliverables meet project objectives and stakeholder expectations
Act as the primary point of contact for project updates and status reports
Communicate project progress, milestones, and potential issues to stakeholders and leadership
Schedule and lead regular team meetings, including project briefs, creative reviews, and executive presentations
Prepare and present project summaries and post-project evaluations
Continuously evaluate and improve project management processes and workflows
Implement best practices and tools to enhance project efficiency and productivity
Seek opportunities to innovate and streamline creative project management across the organization as a whole
Skills
5-7 years of experience as a Project Manager or Producer within a creative agency or technology company
Experience building and training team members on new processes and/or tools
Problem-solving abilities in a creative capacity
Flexible and efficient
Can adapt to a fast-paced environment with a bias towards finding solutions to challenging problems
Attention to detail, organization, and proactiveness
Able to self-manage while finding opportunities to collaborate with other department leads
Able to successfully manage multiple complex and high-profile, high-budget projects simultaneously
Able to think big picture and distill it down into actionable pieces
Able to communicate clearly, both written and orally
Knowledge, Skills, and Experience
Education - Bachelor's Degree
Experience Required – 5+ Years
This position is on-site.
Company:
OC Sports & Entertainment, LLC
Our Commitment:
We are committed to providing an environment of mutual respect where equal employment opportunities are available to all applicants and team members without regard to race, color, religion, sex (including pregnancy and gender identity), national origin, political affiliation, sexual orientation, marital status, disability, genetic information, age, membership in an employee organization, parental status, military service, medical condition or any protected category prohibited by local, state or federal laws. We are firm believers that diversity and inclusion among our team members are critical to our success, and we seek to recruit, develop, and retain the most talented people from a diverse candidate pool.
Thanks for your interest in becoming part of ocV!BE!

description:
This position assists CONMED business leaders, IT leaders, and project teams to define, scope, prioritize, approve, execute, and close IT-related projects.
The Project Manager will partner with one or more IT Business Partners who support a set of business areas and will also support internal PMO operations.
This is accomplished by maintaining the “IT Project Playbook”, providing training and coaching to Playbook users, compiling and analyzing data related to projects and portfolios, facilitating meetings and events, and providing expert project & portfolio advice to business leaders, IT leaders, and project team members. Project managers may also, at the discretion of the PMO Director, oversee or manage strategic programs.
Key Duties and Responsibilities:
Enhance and document CONMED’s End-to-End project execution process (IT Project Playbook), including process descriptions, stages and key decision points, roles & responsibilities, templates & tools, metrics, and other job aids as required
Oversee the execution of their assigned portfolio to ensure well defined projects, positioned for success with proactive risk management throughout their life cycle
Support adoption of the Playbook by providing facilitation, coaching, and training to process participants using the Playbook to
Define and propose new projects
Conduct portfolio planning, prioritization and new project launch approval
Provide execution oversight and governance of in-flight projects
Perform project closeout activities, including value realization and lessons learned
Collect and analyze data, and compile material, to support portfolio status tracking and oversight by
Project governance bodies / Steering Committees
IT Leadership Team (ITLT)
Conduct periodic assessments of the effectiveness of CONMED’s End-to-End project execution process and recommend improvements.
Support CONMED IT Leadership Team (ITLT) operations by preparing agendas, coordinating ITLT meeting prework, capturing action items & decisions, maintaining ITLT repository, etc.
Minimum Requirements:
Associate degree in computer science, engineering, medical technology, or related field of study
4-6 years’ experience in IT project management, program management or portfolio management roles
Hands-on experience with one or more portfolio and project management applications such as MS Project, Jira, Planview, etc.
2-4 years’ experience in Agile project methodologies
Knowledge Qualifications:
Basic familiarity with several of the business functions typically found in a medical device company, i.e., R&D, Regulatory, Marketing, Sales, Operations, Quality, Procurement, Finance, and Human Resources.
Understanding and familiarity with Computer Systems Validation (CSV)
Effective written and oral communications in English
Ability to create PowerPoint presentations
Ability to build models and analyze costs, risks, timelines, metrics, etc. using Excel
Ability to coach and train others in 1-1 and small group settings (face-to-face or virtual)
Project management certification such as PMP or similar designation highly desired
Preferred Requirements:
Bachelor’s degree (BA or BS) in computer science, engineering, medical technology, or related field of study
Project Management Professional (PMP) or equivalent certification.
This position is not eligible for employer based sponsorship. Disclosure as required by applicable law, the annual salary range is 80,000-125,000. The actual compensation may vary based on geographic location, work experience, education and skill level. The salary range is CONMED's good faith belief at the time of this posting.
Benefits:
CONMED offers a wide array of benefits to fit your unique needs. Visit our Benefits Page for more information.
Competitive compensation
Excellent healthcare including medical, dental, vision and prescription coverage
Short & long term disability plus life insurance
- cost paid fully by CONMED
Retirement Savings Plan (401K)
- CONMED matches your contributions dollar for dollar, with the potential for up to 7% per pay period
Employee Stock Purchase Plan
- allows stock purchases at discounted price
Tuition assistance for undergraduate and graduate level courses
Know someone at CONMED?
Have them submit you as a referral before applying for this position to be eligible for our Employee Referral Program incentives!
CONMED is an Equal Opportunity Employer & an Affirmative Action Employer. CONMED is a strong advocate of workforce diversity. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, ethnicity, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, citizenship status, or veteran status. The Know Your Rights: Workplace Discrimination is Illegal Poster and Pay Transparency Nondiscrimination Provision reaffirm this commitment.

If you feel you need a reasonable accommodation pursuant to the ADA, you are encouraged to contact us at 800-929-7176 option #5.
title: IT Project Manager

benefits: 401(k) matching,AD&D insurance,Dental insurance,Disability insurance,Flexible spending account,Health insurance,Health savings account
description:
Company Overview:
Aireon deployed the world’s first global space-based air traffic surveillance system, providing real-time aircraft monitoring capabilities around the world, including over the poles, over the oceans and in remote areas.
Aireon data enables safer, more efficient and more environmentally friendly aviation travel, resulting in significant CO2 emission reductions. More than 20 Air Navigation Service Providers representing more than 40 countries – including NAV CANADA, NATS (UK), Air Traffic and Navigation Services (South Africa), Airports Authority of India (AAI), and ASECNA (Africa) - rely on Aireon data to navigate aircraft in their airspaces.
We are committed to offering an employment experience and benefits package that enables you and your family to grow with us and to share in our success.
Position Summary, Job Requirements & Responsibilities:
The Project Manager will have an important role in supporting the management, scheduling, coordination, and organization of projects and programs for Aireon’s space-based ADS-B surveillance system. Reporting to the Director, Program Management, the Project Manager will be involved with all phases of the project and program life cycle: Concept, Planning, Execution, and Transfer. Communication and adeptness at working with a variety of personalities and skillsets across multiple organizations and locations will also be a key part of this role.

What You'll Do
Develop and maintain integrated plans to ensure timely monitoring of program and project activities on a regular basis and recommend changes to enhance the program, as appropriate
Work closely with Aireon implementation engineering, system engineering, and operations teams to develop and execute multi-year projects and programs
Work with various stakeholders and functional leads to timely identify dependencies, issues, and risks across projects
Coordinate and schedule project meetings including taking notes, actions and following up with participants
Support engineering and operations management in the development of processes and procedures for the team to ensure completion of milestones within specific budgets and schedules
Monitor project progress continuously and develop reports on measurable items, such as milestones and deliverables
Assist in the identification, assessment, and mitigation of risks/issues to support safety, security, technical, and program objectives
Liaise with other project managers and partners to ensure the effective and efficient program delivery
Experience & Education Requirements / EEO:
Required Qualifications
Working experience with project management and product management tools (Jira, Azure DevOps, MS Project, Confluence, etc.)
Experience with the development and management of project, program, and Integrated Master Schedules
Experience with Agile and traditional project scheduling and tracking processes
Excellent communications and interpersonal skills with ability to proactively build rapport among stakeholders
Able to succeed in high-pressure, fast-paced, entrepreneurial, and competitive environment
Strong organizational and project management skills
Working experience in Aviation or Aerospace industry a plus
Minimum of 8 years of experience in project management support role
Minimum of a bachelor’s degree
U.S. Citizenship Required
Desired Qualifications
Project management certification
About You

You are a self-starter. Sitting and waiting isn’t an option. You take the initiative to make things happen.
You are collaborative. You're a team player who puts the interest of the team above your own. You display a positive attitude, are open and enjoy contributing.
You are a natural leader. No matter where you find yourself, others tend to gather around you, leading to encouragement and mentoring.
You thrive in fast paced environments. While there is a sense of urgency to achieve a goal, you are already preparing for the next thing and find creative ways to increase productivity.
Technology is your passion. It doesn’t just provide a paycheck, you are genuinely interested in what you do and the impact that it has on others.
1-3-6-12 Month Plan

In the first month we’ll expect you to…
Get onboarded and train with your manager
Get acclimated into the role and its matrix function
Understand the tools, different stakeholders and customers, and engineering organization
Develop working rapport with engineering and operations management
At 3 months we’ll expect you to…
Establish initial performance goals
Be knowledgeable of the system architecture, data delivery methods, and customer base
Begin learning engineering and operations processes and timelines
Collate presentation materials for senior leadership meetings and assist with capturing and tracking meeting actions
At 6 months we’ll expect you to…
Assume responsibility for tracking team actions and deliverables
Develop and maintain project schedules
Develop collaborative relationships with relevant internal and external teams
Assist in team resource planning activities
Coordinate project risk management activities with the risk manager
At 12 months we’ll expect you to…
Facilitate collaboration among engineers and other team members
Coordinate internal and external resources to ensure that projects adhere to scope, schedule, and budget
Integrate schedules for test, developments, operations and/or customer implementation activities
Monitor resources to ensure project efficiency and maximize deliverables
Monitor the progress of multiple projects and identify areas in which the team could be more productive or produce higher quality products or services
Work collaboratively with the risk manager to identify, assess and, where required, develop mitigations of risks
Assist the teams in meeting deadlines and constantly strive for improvement
About the Team
This position is within the Aireon Engineering and Operations Department, which consists of more than 85 employees
The position will reside within the Program Management Office (PMO) directorate, which currently has four team members
The PMO team members operate out of Aireon headquarters in McLean, VA and rely on a flexible, hybrid work model
Teams stay connected through recurring team meetings, one-on-one meetings, company all-hands meetings, and corporate events.
Perks and Benefits
Premium medical, dental and vision plan
Life Insurance and AD&D
Short Term and Long Term Disability
Health Savings Account (HSA)
Flexible Spending Accounts (FSA)
Retirement 401K plan with Employer Matching
Education Assistance and Tuition Reimbursement
Paid Time Off, Sick Leave, Floating Holidays
Paid Parental Leave
Company Sponsored Events
Employee Referral Program

Aireon is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity or status as a protected veteran. EOE of Minorities/Females/Vets/Disability and other protected categories.

title: Project Manager

description:
Center 3 (19075), United States of America, McLean, Virginia
Senior Manager, HR Project Management
Capital One, a Fortune 500 company and one of the nation’s top 10 banks, offers a broad spectrum of financial products and services to consumers, small businesses and commercial clients. Our goal is to create one of the nation’s great banks, and we have the necessary ingredients: a strong balance sheet, resilient businesses, a massive customer franchise, strong analytical capabilities, and great people. We nurture a work environment where people with a variety of thoughts, ideas and backgrounds, guided by our shared Values, come together to make Capital One a great company – and a great place to work.
As a Senior Manager Project Manager at Capital One, you will drive strategy and innovative customer experiences alongside key product, Tech, and design leadership. You will take on important and exciting responsibility from day one, and be challenged to excel alongside the brightest talent in the industry.
As part of the Product Strategy and Operations team, you will lead across three key areas:
Product strategy
Drive creation of longer-term integrated OneTeam strategy and roadmap, in partnership with product, design, and engineering leaders, ensuring we maintain a broader enterprise and external market lens
Lead regular cadence of strategic planning and leadership alignment (e.g., monthly business reviews, quarterly syncs, annual planning sessions), being sure to interpret data/trends and continually orient team towards highest leverage opportunities
Drive continued development of OneTeam associate engagement strategy (with help from existing Culture and Community pod) to help deliver on our talent imperatives
Product operations
Drive continued excellence for the product management function and implement key initiatives to continually raise bar on what great looks like, including product discovery, goaling, roadmap planning, prioritization, budgeting, and reviews (leveraging Elevate Product processes where possible)
Drive OneTeam operating model, in partnership with operations leads across design and engineering organizations, including PI planning, retrospectives, demo days, and business reviews
Drive a culture of excellence by establishing and monitoring key performance indicators (KPIs) and reporting out to broader set of stakeholders
Draft decks, communications, newsletter inputs, and other HR Product related assets to showcase impact and drive continued stakeholder engagement
Cross-functional delivery
Partner horizontally with other operations leads/chiefs of staff to support events/meetings/initiatives, gather inputs and feedback, and participate in recognition ceremonies
Represent HR OneTeam in enterprise-wide forums and coordinate relevant cross-team initiatives and interdependencies
As needed, offer other ad-hoc consulting or operational support to major chief of staff projects or organizational needs/opportunities
We want you if you are:
Intellectually Curious. You ask why, you explore, you're not afraid to blurt out your crazy idea or follow an email chain for weeks to find someone with an answer. Comfortable with ambiguity, a hunger to learn and a seeker of new challenges.
Communicator & Influencer. You can communicate complex ideas clearly regardless of your audience. Our team knows their priorities and why they’re doing what they’re doing. You can rally associates to work with you.
Do-er. You’re biased toward action, you try things and sometimes you fail. You can get around roadblocks and stay focused on your goals.
Passionate about the Customer. You care about growing others and bringing them together around what’s possible. You get a thrill from the journey of building and shipping products, and you have a desire and ability to connect with our customers to fully understand their needs.
Team Player. You enjoy working with diverse people and driving the team toward a common goal. You have the ability to put the team before yourself and establish long-lasting relationships.
Basic Qualifications:
Bachelor’s Degree or Military experience
At least 8 Years of Project Management experience
Preferred Qualifications:
Masters Degree
5+ years of digital product management experience
At least 3 years of experience in Agile product management
At least 10 years of Project Management experience
At this time, Capital One will not sponsor a new applicant for employment authorization for this position.
Capital One offers a comprehensive, competitive, and inclusive set of health, financial and other benefits that support your total well-being. Learn more at the Capital One Careers website. Eligibility varies based on full or part-time status, exempt or non-exempt status, and management level.
This role is expected to accept applications for a minimum of 5 business days.
No agencies please. Capital One is an equal opportunity employer committed to diversity and inclusion in the workplace. If you have visited our website in search of information on employment opportunities or to apply for a position, and you require an accommodation, please contact Capital One Recruiting at 1-800-304-9102 or via email at RecruitingAccommodation@capitalone.com. All information you provide will be kept confidential and will be used only to the extent required to provide needed reasonable accommodations.

title: Project Manager

description:
Richard Design Services (RDS) is currently seeking an experienced Senior Project Manager.

Position Summary:
We are seeking a highly skilled and experienced Senior Project Manager to join our team. The ideal candidate will have proven expertise in successfully managing and delivering complex projects within the specified timeframes and budgets. As a Senior Project Manager, you will be responsible for overseeing all aspects of the project life cycle, including planning, executing, controlling, and closing, while ensuring effective collaboration with all stakeholders.

Responsibilities:
Develop and maintain detailed project plans, including timelines, budgets, and resources allocation.
Coordinate with cross-functional teams to define project scope, objectives, and deliverables.
Conduct extensive risk management analysis and proactively address potential issues and bottlenecks.
Monitor project progress regularly and provide timely status updates to stakeholders.
Ensure project compliance with relevant quality standards and key performance indicators (KPIs).
Lead and motivate project teams, providing guidance and support throughout the project life cycle.
Oversee the procurement process, including sourcing external vendors and managing contracts.
Drive continuous improvement initiatives to optimize project delivery processes and methodologies.
Conduct comprehensive project evaluations to identify lessons learned and best practices.
Stay updated with industry trends and best project management practices.

JOB REQUIREMENTS
Minimum 10 years of Project Management experience.
Experience leading complex projects from start to finish.
Exceptional knowledge of project management methodologies and tools.
Strong leadership, communication, and interpersonal skills.
Excellent problem-solving and decision-making abilities.
Ability to navigate conflicting priorities and meet tight deadlines.
Strong analytical and financial management skills.
Professional certifications such as PMP (Project Management Professional) are highly desirable.
Experience in managing projects in Refining and Petrochemicals is a plus

Work Environment:
This position primarily is performed from Richard's home office located in Beaumont, TX, but may be posted temporarily on project sites, when required. Field site visits may be required regularly.

RDS is dedicated to providing a SAFE and Drug Free environment.

RDS is an Equal Opportunity Employer (EEO).
title: Project Manager

job_title: Commercial Project Manager - New Product Launches: US Pharmaceuticals
description:
This is where you save and sustain lives
At Baxter, we are deeply connected by our mission. No matter your role at Baxter, your work makes a positive impact on people around the world. You’ll feel a sense of purpose throughout the organization, as we know our work improves outcomes for millions of patients.
Baxter’s products and therapies are found in almost every hospital worldwide, in clinics and in the home. For over 85 years, we have pioneered significant medical innovations that transform healthcare.
Together, we create a place where we are happy, successful and inspire each other. This is where you can do your best work.
Join us at the intersection of saving and sustaining lives— where your purpose accelerates our mission.
Your Role at Baxter
This is where your ideas lead to success!
As a Commercial Project Manager, you have lots of ideas grounded in research and knowledge of the marketplace. Your skills in planning and implementing these ideas are what make you an outstanding business partner and marketer. You critically think through problems and communicate your ideas in a way that helps us compete. Your curiosity, love of learning, and active listening give you a significant understanding of healthcare and business.
And while you are an excellent teammate, you are also competitive—determined to achieve results and get things done.
At Baxter, we're not just promoting the latest life-saving products; we're thinking strategically about getting products to those who need them by understanding the value they provide, the market where they are needed, and the approach to reach the right individuals.
Your Team
We develop quality products with the patient in mind, so our efforts are also patient-centric. That means you can be proud of our work and the value we provide to people every day.
As a large, multinational organization, you have the opportunity to expand your knowledge through collaboration with a variety of individuals, exposure to different facets of our portfolio, and a supportive leadership team that encourages ongoing development.
From your leaders to your peers, we operate as a team. We are focused on delivering for our patients and the business. We continue developing digital tools to enable efficiency and support a variety of learning and development opportunities.
What you'll be doing
This role is responsible for project management and execution of launch activities to ensure product launches are completed on time and in line with commercial plans. The ideal candidate is an authority at all the components required for generic and differentiated pharma product launches.
Lead pharmaceutical launch process for all assigned generic and differentiated products including new approvals, line extensions and private labels that may be internally developed or in-licensed.
Partner with cross functional teams including Marketing, Strategic Contracting, Market Access, R&D, Medical Affairs, Supply Chain, IP, Regulatory, etc. to develop a commercial launch plan. Define clear project scopes, goals and deliverables that support business objectives
Identify risks to projects and work with cross functional teams to build mitigation plans and guide the team through launch plan execution for all North America products.
For risks identified, facilitate decision-making by North America Pharmaceutical leadership. Raise issues as needed with Global Pharmaceutical leadership.
Continuously improve processes to build an outstanding launch process that accelerates organizational launch success and enhances revenues.
Act as internal authority on commercial launch management activities and execution related topics.
Lead project tracker(s) or dashboard(s) and communicate status of the project and program portfolio to all key collaborators and the North America Pharma Leadership Team as the need arises.
Ability to work with external vendors such as CMOs, consultants and other vendors.
What you'll bring
Bachelor’s degree in business (BA/BS) or Life Sciences, MBA preferred
3+ years’ experience in Commercial Operations and Launch Project Management preferred
Knowledge of generic product launch management, Commercial Operations or Supply Chain Management preferable.
Strong experience in project management, project planning/execution, and risk management.
Familiar with multiple areas of pharmaceutical commercial management including IP, regulatory, supply chain, quality, technical operations, compliance, commercial operations, market access, pricing and contracting, and medical.
Ability to understand sophisticated issues and their implications even if limited information is available.
Experience in working with cross-functional teams.
Baxter is committed to supporting the needs for flexibility in the workplace. We do so through our flexible workplace policy which includes a minimum of 3 days a week onsite. This policy provides the benefits of connecting and collaborating in-person in support of our Mission
We understand compensation is an important factor as you consider the next step in your career.
At Baxter, we are committed to equitable pay for all employees, and we strive to be more transparent with our pay practices. The estimated base salary for this position is $104,000 to $143,000 annually. The estimated range is meant to reflect an anticipated salary range for the position. We may pay more or less than of the anticipated range based upon market data and other factors, all of which are subject to change. Individual pay is based on upon location, skills and expertise, experience, and other relevant factors. This position may also be eligible for discretionary bonuses. For questions about this, our pay philosophy, and available benefits, please speak to the recruiter if you decide to apply and are selected for an interview.
Equal Employment Opportunity
Baxter is an equal opportunity employer. Baxter evaluates qualified applicants without regard to race, color, religion, gender, national origin, age, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, protected veteran status, disability/handicap status or any other legally protected characteristic.

EEO is the Law
EEO is the law - Poster Supplement
Pay Transparency Policy
Reasonable Accommodations

Baxter is committed to working with and providing reasonable accommodations to individuals with disabilities globally. If, because of a medical condition or disability, you need a reasonable accommodation for any part of the application or interview process, please click on the link here and let us know the nature of your request along with your contact information.
Recruitment Fraud Notice

Baxter has discovered incidents of employment scams, where fraudulent parties pose as Baxter employees, recruiters, or other agents, and engage with online job seekers in an attempt to steal personal and/or financial information. To learn how you can protect yourself, review our Recruitment Fraud Notice.

description:
Why work for us?

A career at Janus Henderson is more than a job, it’s about investing in a brighter future together.

Our Mission at Janus Henderson is to help clients define and achieve superior financial outcomes through differentiated insights, disciplined investments, and world-class service. We will do this by protecting and growing our core business, amplifying our strengths and diversifying where we have the right.

Our Values are key to driving our success, and are at the heart of everything we do:
Clients Come First - Always | Execution Supersedes Intention | Together We Win | Diversity Improves Results | Truth Builds Trust
If our mission, values, and purpose align with your own, we would love to hear from you!

Your Opportunity

This role involves managing projects throughout the organization, encompassing both domestic and international activities. The nature of these projects will vary over time and is likely to be diverse, but generally focused on the Investments and Operational functions of our business such as transformational activity across our Back, Middle and Front Office operating model, with specific focus on Fund Accounting and Custody services. The role holder will need to work across different parts of the business to deliver such changes.

This role will be accountable to the Operational Transformation Program Manager for the US based in Denver, CO.

Develop, execute, and manage global-scale project plans, ensuring optimal resource allocation and budget management across different regions and time zones.
Control the scope of projects, managing dependencies including assessing regulatory requirements and ensuring that these are met by maintaining the critical path
Experience in overseeing Back-Office and Middle-Office project transitions, specifically in migrating business processes and technologies from legacy to new Third Party Administrators.
Adhere to the change and transformation project lifecycle, including maintenance of plans, briefs, risks and issues, dependency tracking and other relevant reporting artifacts (including the preparation of key project documentation/templates such as RAID Log, Dashboard)
Create project organization/structure, including roles, responsibilities, and governance
Drive stakeholder engagement across projects, and develop and deliver an effective communication plan both externally and internally for regional and global activities throughout the project
Chair Working Group(s) as required, present progress, highlight issues, challenge and drive decisions - ensure relevant content is brought to the groups for discussion
Ensure any resources including external vendors are managed and resourced to be able to deliver successfully; drive prioritization as appropriate
Serve as a catalyst for change during service transitions by promoting the advantages, guiding the organization through the transition, and reducing resistance.
Monitor transition progress, identifying and mitigating risks to ensure project objectives are met within scope and timeline
Develop, track and manage project costs
Represent the firm on industry forums where appropriate

What to expect when you join our firm

Hybrid working and reasonable accommodations
Generous Holiday policies
Excellent Health and Wellbeing benefits including corporate membership to ClassPass
Paid volunteer time to step away from your desk and into the community
Support to grow through professional development courses, tuition/qualification reimbursement and more
All-inclusive approach to Diversity, Equity and Inclusion
Maternal/paternal leave benefits and family services
Complimentary subscription to Headspace – the mindfulness app
All employee events including networking opportunities and social activities

Must have skills

Demonstrated success in managing global projects with a keen ability to coordinate across multiple regions and time zones
Robust and proven track record as a Project Manager
Strong leader, equally comfortable facing off to Working and Steering Groups, challenging stakeholders, directing and motivating a cross-business team
Strong Microsoft office skills including Teams, Project, Excel, Word and PowerPoint
Formal certifications are requested, except where equivalent project management experience can be demonstrated
Highly organised with executive-level communication skills
Excellent stakeholder management skills – the ability to work across all levels of the organization
A rolled-up sleeve positive and delivery focused approach

Nice to have skills
Candidates with specialized experience in managing Back-Office and Middle-Office projects, particularly those involving collaboration with Third Party Administrators.
A strong emphasis on Fund Administration and Custody projects is highly desirable.

Potential for growth

Mentoring
Regular training
Career development services
Continuing education courses

You will be expected to understand the regulatory obligations of the firm and abide by the regulated entity requirements and JHI policies applicable for your role.

At Janus Henderson Investors we’re committed to an inclusive and supportive environment. We believe diversity improves results and we welcome applications from all backgrounds. Don’t worry if you don’t think you tick every box, we still want to hear from you! We understand everyone has different commitments and while we can’t accommodate every flexible working request, we’re happy to be asked about work flexibility and our hybrid working environment. If you need any reasonable accommodations during our recruitment process, please get in touch and let us know at recruiter@janushenderson.com

Compensation information

The base salary range for this position is $120,000-$130,000. This range is estimated for this role. Actual pay may be different. This role will remain open through September 30, 2024.
#LI-SW1, #LI-Hybrid

Annual Bonus Opportunity: Position is eligible to receive an annual discretionary bonus award from the profit pool. The profit pool is funded based on Company profits. Individual bonuses are determined based on Company, department, team and individual performance.

Benefits: Janus Henderson is committed to offering a comprehensive total rewards package to eligible employees that includes; competitive compensation, pension/retirement plans, and various health, wellbeing and lifestyle benefits. To learn more about our offerings please visit the Why Join Us section on the career page here.

Janus Henderson Investors is an equal opportunity / Affirmative Action employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability or veteran status.

Janus Henderson (including its subsidiaries) will not maintain existing or sponsor new industry registrations or licenses where not supported by an employee’s job functions (as determined by Janus Henderson at its sole discretion).

You should be willing to adhere to the provisions of our Investment Advisory Code of Ethics related to personal securities activities and other disclosure and certification requirements, including past political contributions and political activities. Applicants’ past political contributions or activity may impact applicants’ eligibility for this position.

You will be expected to understand the regulatory obligations of the firm, and abide by the regulated entity requirements and JHI policies applicable for your role.
title: Project Manager

description:
About Us
McLaren Health Care is a fully integrated health network committed to quality, evidence-based patient care with locations in Michigan and Indiana. The McLaren system includes 13 hospitals in Michigan, ambulatory surgery centers, imaging centers, a primary and specialty care physician network, commercial and Medicaid HMOs, home health, infusion and hospice providers, pharmacy services, a clinical laboratory network and a wholly owned medical malpractice insurance company. McLaren operates Michigan’s largest network of cancer centers and providers, anchored by the Karmanos Cancer Institute, one of only 53 National Cancer Institute-designated comprehensive cancer centers in the U.S.
Information Technology Project Manager
Michigan, Grand Blanc
Non-Health Professional
McLaren Health Care Corp
24004895

Initiates, plans, executes, monitors and controls, and closes projects according to the project requirements and timeline, all while keeping the project within scope and budget. Assists with scoping and requirement gathering, creates and execute project schedules and oversee quality control throughout the entire project. Also, works with other business units and stakeholders to obtain appropriate resources and manages a team and third-party contractors and/or consultants. Finally, assess project issues and risks, and work with the project team to address these items through to successful project completion.
Essential Functions and Responsibilities:
Achieves operational objectives by contributing information and recommendations to strategic plans and reviews; preparing and completing action plans; implementing production, productivity, quality, and customer-service standards; resolving problems; completing audits; identifying trends; determining system improvements; implementing change.
Works with appropriate customers to identify and coordinate new system developments and/or enhancements.
Works with appropriate customers to develop project scope of work documents and project plans that include an analysis of benefit, cost, work schedule and any related risks.
Assigns, schedules, reviews, and monitors and controls project work to ensure that progress is within expected guidelines and is completed on time and within budget. Mentors and provides expertise to other project team members.
Works with appropriate customers to identify the roles of management, departments, project team members, project reporting structures and frequency of interaction and any training requirements that may be needed for a team member to complete a project.
Develops project management artifacts, such as RACIs and Project Plans/Task Lists
Qualifications
Required:
High school diploma or GED.
Six (6) years of experience in a project management role.
OR
Bachelor’s degree from an accredited college or university, preferably in computer science, information systems, business administration or another related field.
Four (4) years of experience in a project management role
Preferred:
3 year’s experience in healthcare/patient care environment
Project Management Certification (PMP)
Additional Information
Schedule: Full-time
Requisition ID: 24004895
Daily Work Times: Standard Business Hours
Hours Per Pay Period: 80
On Call: No
Weekends: No
McLaren Health Care is an Equal Opportunity Employer. Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sexual orientation, gender identification, age, sex, marital status, national origin, disability, genetic information, height or weight, protected veteran or other classification protected by law.

description:
Job Description

BAE Systems, a top-ten prime contractor to the U.S. Department of Defense, enables the U.S. government to transform data into intelligence and provides engineering, integration and sustainment support for critical military platforms and systems. Intelligence & Security provides services and products to the Department of Defense, the government, federal law enforcement officials, and troops deployed around the world.

At BAE Systems, we promote a strong, collaborative culture and provide our employees with the tools, skills and training they need to succeed. We are all about trust, camaraderie and a shared ambition to lead the world in defense technologies and national security services. We offer flexible work environment to support the balance in your life and keep you performing at your best. Be a part of a company that is part of the community; driven to improve our future and protect our freedom.

We are actively looking for an experience Program Manager to join our IT team. This Program Manager needs to be able to understand and execute the basic traditional principals of IT program management such as managing requirements, costs, schedules, quality, etc., they must also understand the technical engineering to deliver this capability. This program manager should understand the enterprise collaboration baseline and an understanding of the future strategic vision of the enterprise collaboration. This requires that the IT Program Manager have strong background and perhaps even in the past functioned as an engineer himself earlier in his career. A key aspect of the Program Manager’s job is to ensure that the solution is secure in accordance with the mission A&A processes. This IT Program Manager utilizes existing collaboration baselined information found in sponsor’s tools and documents requirements appropriately.

ABC

Required Education, Experience, & Skills

The right candidate will have a minimum of sixteen (16) years' of work experience. A Bachelor's or Master’s Degree are preferred in one or more of the disciplines described below where specific skills and responsibilities may include the following...

Responsibilities:
Provide communication that leads to the understanding of deadlines, assignments and objectives across all enterprise stakeholders and ensure all project issues are resolved promptly to avoid negative impact to the budget or schedule
Resolving cross-program issues and strategic issues with senior IT stakeholders
Work with the technical teams to ensure understanding of the projects/programs
Work with stakeholders to remove project blockers to ensure timely delivery
Track progress and project metrics
Report & Brief senior leadership on project status, metrics, risks, issues, etc.
Ensure all systems within purview are security compliant
Demonstrating “visible” support to the program and its technical team
Ability to handle various responsibilities such as planning, scheduling and coordinating all areas of a project
“Leading by example” the transformational change brought about by the program
Confirming successful delivery and signs-of at the program closure
Resolve issues that arise
Serve as part coach, part facilitator
Create, analyze, and brief out the board’s reports and dashboards
Capture, document and track new requirements
Promote the empowerment of the team by ensuring team members are fully engaged
Required Skills and Abilities:
Excellent Leadership skills
Ability to accurately capture, document and track new IT requirements in an agile environment
Ability to handle various responsibilities such as planning, scheduling and coordinating all areas of IT projects
Experience resolving cross-program issues and strategic issues with senior IT stakeholders
Excellent written and verbal communication skills
Experience working on fast paced, high visibility IT projects/programs
Ability to pivot as priorities dictate
Familiarity with IT project collaboration tools (e.g., Jira, ServiceNow)

Preferred Education, Experience, & Skills
PMP Certification
Experience creating, analyzing, and briefing out the board’s reports and dashboards.
Experience managing large enterprise projects in an Agile environment
Knowledge & experience with customers’ A&A process

Pay Information
Full-Time Salary Range: $140690 - $239140

Please note: This range is based on our market pay structures. However, individual salaries are determined by a variety of factors including, but not limited to: business considerations, local market conditions, and internal equity, as well as candidate qualifications, such as skills, education, and experience.

Employee Benefits: At BAE Systems, we support our employees in all aspects of their life, including their health and financial well-being. Regular employees scheduled to work 20+ hours per week are offered: health, dental, and vision insurance; health savings accounts; a 401(k) savings plan; disability coverage; and life and accident insurance. We also have an employee assistance program, a legal plan, and other perks including discounts on things like home, auto, and pet insurance. Our leave programs include paid time off, paid holidays, as well as other types of leave, including paid parental, military, bereavement, and any applicable federal and state sick leave. Employees may participate in the company recognition program to receive monetary or non-monetary recognition awards. Other incentives may be available based on position level and/or job specifics.

About BAE Systems Intelligence & Security
BAE Systems, Inc. is the U.S. subsidiary of BAE Systems plc, an international defense, aerospace and security company which delivers a full range of products and services for air, land and naval forces, as well as advanced electronics, security, information technology solutions and customer support services. Improving the future and protecting lives is an ambitious mission, but it’s what we do at BAE Systems. Working here means using your passion and ingenuity where it counts – defending national security with breakthrough technology, superior products, and intelligence solutions. As you develop the latest technology and defend national security, you will continually hone your skills on a team—making a big impact on a global scale. At BAE Systems, you’ll find a rewarding career that truly makes a difference.

Intelligence & Security (I&S), based in McLean, Virginia, designs and delivers advanced defense, intelligence, and security solutions that support the important missions of our customers. Our pride and dedication shows in everything we do—from intelligence analysis, cyber operations and IT expertise to systems development, systems integration, and operations and maintenance services. Knowing that our work enables the U.S. military and government to recognize, manage and defeat threats inspires us to push ourselves and our technologies to new levels.

Our Commitment to Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion:
At BAE Systems, we work hard every day to nurture an inclusive culture where employees are valued and feel like they belong. We are conscious of the need for all employees to see themselves reflected at every level of the company and know that in order to unlock the full potential of our workforce, everyone must feel confident being their best, most sincere self and be equipped to thrive. We provide impactful professional development experiences to our employees and invest in social impact partnerships to uplift communities and drive purposeful change. Here you will find significant opportunities to do meaningful work in an environment intentionally designed to be one where you will learn, grow and belong.

title: Project Manager

description:
Jobs Description
We are seeking a Sr. PMO Manager (IT Infrastructure) to manage a portfolio of complex infrastructure projects for IT services overseeing the development, implementation, and management of various projects in the PMO. The PM will be responsible for the analysis, study, planning, design, implementation of cutting-edge technologies (Digital Twin, AI, IoT) and service delivery; planning, facilitating meetings, setting deadlines, assigning responsibilities, and monitoring, summarizing, and communicating progress of the projects; and directing cross-functional teams and vendors to ensure all deliverables, programs/ projects/campaigns objectives, process milestones and quality measures are completed on-time and on-budget.
Responsibilities
Project Planning: Developing project plans, including scope, schedule, budget, and resource allocation, and ensuring that the goals and objectives of a portfolio of projects are clearly defined and aligned with the overall business strategy.
Monitoring and Optimization: Monitor the performance of projects and optimize them as necessary to ensure it continues to provide value to the organization.
Risk Management: Identifying potential project risks and developing risk mitigation plans to minimize the impact of these risks on the project's timeline, budget, and scope.
Stakeholder Management: Communicating effectively with stakeholders and managing their expectations throughout the project lifecycle.
Resource Management: Allocating project resources, including personnel, equipment, and materials, to ensure that the project is completed on time, within budget, and to the required quality standards.
Data Management: Oversee the collection, processing, and integration of data required to develop and maintain projects. This may include data related to infrastructure design, operations, maintenance, and environmental factors.
Quality Assurance: Ensuring that the project meets all relevant quality standards and that all deliverables meet the expectations of stakeholders.
Budget Management: Developing and managing project budgets, tracking expenses, and ensuring that the project stays within budgetary constraints.
Schedule Management: Developing and managing project schedules, tracking progress, and ensuring that the project stays on schedule.
Change Management: Managing project changes and ensuring that all changes are documented and approved by relevant stakeholders.
Reporting and Documentation: Provide regular updates on the progress of the project to all stakeholders and document all aspects of the project for future reference and knowledge sharing.
Close-out and Handover: Ensuring that the project is properly closed out and handed over to the relevant stakeholders, including conducting post-project reviews to identify areas for improvement and lessons learned.
Qualifications
Experience managing a portfolio of IT Infrastructure projects.
Experience with the analysis, study, planning, design, and implementation of cutting-edge technologies (Digital Twin, AI, IoT).
Experience leading project managers to contribute to the evolution of deliverables and project artifacts.
Experience leading development of deliverables and tracking to integrated project plans.
Experience developing project deliverables to meet project objectives.
Experience actively monitoring leadership reporting to ensure your teams’ portfolio of projects are against schedule, budget and phase objectives, reporting status to internal and client leadership on a regular basis.
Experience developing and implementing risk mitigation plans for off-schedule and unanticipated eventualities.
Experience providing SME level consulting guidance and communication strategies.
Experience with Waterfall and Agile project management methodologies.
Experience with SDLC methodologies.
Experience with project estimation modeling: cost and budget estimates.
Experience providing project status and performance reports (Weekly, Monthly and Quarterly) along with schedules with milestone deliverables.
Experience with reporting risks events, change request w/impact analysis, and issues to C-Level Executives.

description:
Company Summary:
DISH, an EchoStar company, has been reimagining the future of connectivity for more than 40 years. Our business reach spans satellite television service, live-streaming and on-demand programming, smart home installation services, mobile plans and products and now we are building America’s First Smart Network™.

Today, our brands include EchoStar, Hughes, DISH TV, Sling TV, Boost Mobile and Gen Mobile.
Department Summary:
Our Retail Wireless team, serving our Boost Mobile and Gen Mobile brands, is redefining consumer expectations through new platforms, new business models and new ways of thinking. Equipped with a first-of-its-kind 5G network, a passion for change and the power to drive it, we’ll emerge as the nation’s fourth facilities-based wireless carrier and a disruptive force in the market at large.
Job Duties and Responsibilities:
We are seeking a skilled and organized Digital Marketing Project Manager to lead and manage multiple projects within our Retail Wireless team. The ideal candidate will have experience in Marketing Technology (MarTech) and will be responsible for ensuring the successful planning, execution, and delivery of projects that enhance our MarTech stack and improve our marketing capabilities. This role requires strong leadership, excellent communication skills, and the ability to manage multiple stakeholders across different business units.

Key Responsibilities:
Define project scope, objectives, and deliverables in collaboration with senior management and stakeholders; develop detailed project plans, timelines, and resource allocation to ensure projects are completed on time and within budget
Lead the execution of projects, ensuring that all tasks are completed as per the project plan; monitor project progress, identify potential risks and implement mitigation strategies to ensure successful project outcomes
Serve as the primary point of contact for all project-related communications; engage with internal teams, including marketing, IT, and business units, as well as external vendors, to ensure alignment and clear communication throughout the project lifecycle
Identify, assess, and manage project risks and issues. Develop contingency plans and take corrective actions as needed to keep projects on track
Coordinate with cross-functional teams to allocate resources effectively, ensuring that project tasks are completed by the right people and that the workload is balanced
Ensure that all project deliverables meet the required quality standards; oversee testing and validation processes, especially in relation to MarTech tools and their integration with other systems
Prepare and present regular project status updates to stakeholders and senior leadership; provide insights on project performance, milestones achieved, and any deviations from the plan
Conduct post-project evaluations to assess the success of the project, gather lessons learned, and identify areas for improvement in future projects
Continuously review and improve project management processes to increase efficiency and effectiveness; introduce best practices and methodologies to enhance project delivery
Skills, Experience and Requirements:
Education and Experience:
Bachelor’s degree or equivalent experience in Project Management, Business Administration, Information Technology, or a related field preferred
Passion for project management, with a focus on technology or marketing-related projects.
Familiarity with Marketing Technology (MarTech) tools and platforms, such as Invoca, LiveRamp, Google Analytics, and Adobe Experience Cloud, is an advantage
Experience managing projects involving cross-functional teams, vendors, and senior stakeholders
Skills and Qualifications:
Strong project management skills, including proficiency with project management software (e.g., Microsoft Project, Jira, Trello)
Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to manage relationships, facilitate discussions, and resolve conflicts
Solid understanding of risk management, budgeting, and resource allocation
Ability to analyze data and project performance metrics to drive informed decision-making
Strong organizational skills, with the ability to manage multiple projects simultaneously and prioritize tasks effectively
High degree of initiative and the ability to work independently while ensuring alignment with overall project goals
Knowledge of the retail wireless industry is a plus
Benefits:
We offer versatile health perks, including flexible spending accounts, HSA, a 401(k) Plan with company match, ESPP, career opportunities, and a flexible time away plan; all benefits can be viewed here: DISH Benefits.

The base pay range shown is a guideline. Individual total compensation will vary based on factors such as qualifications, skill level, and competencies; compensation is based on the role's location and is subject to change based on work location.

We are dedicated to providing individuals with criminal or arrest records a fair chance of employment in accordance with local, state, and federal laws.
