description:
Overview:
Trissential is a trusted partner for end-to-end quality services and management consulting. As a part of our parent company Expleo, we have a footprint in 30+ countries. Our Mission is to have a positive impact on every person who interacts with Trissential. Clients love us because we are service focused. Employees love us because they are valued and cared for.

Trissential is seeking a Senior Project Manager to join our client team onsite in Northern Minnesota. In this role, you will lead the end-to-end implementation of a Labor Management System (LMS) across a large-scale distribution center, impacting over 2,000 employees. You will be responsible for driving project success by managing vendor relationships, overseeing the RFP selection process, developing engineering standards, and optimizing processes to ensure efficient operations. The ideal candidate has a strong background in project management within distribution centers or labor management environments, with a proven track record of delivering complex projects on time, within budget, and to the highest quality standards. You thrive in fast-paced settings, excel at coordinating cross-functional teams, and have exceptional skills in managing project risks, maintaining comprehensive documentation, and ensuring financial accountability. This role is open only to candidates authorized to work and reside in the US.
Responsibilities:
Lead the successful implementation of a Labor Management System (LMS) across the distribution center, ensuring minimal disruption to operations and achieving project goals
Oversee vendor management and guide the RFP selection process for choosing a labor management product
Develop and establish engineering standards for various roles within the distribution center, including Pick/Pack rates, Receiving rates, and other operational benchmarks
Create and maintain detailed project plans using tools like MS Project, covering schedules, budgets, resource allocation, and risk management
Coordinate with stakeholders, including clients, vendors, and internal teams, to ensure all project requirements and milestones are met
Provide technical and operational guidance to project teams, promoting a collaborative and results-driven work environment
Monitor project progress, identify potential risks, and implement mitigation strategies to ensure successful outcomes
Ensure compliance with industry standards and best practices throughout the project lifecycle
Prepare comprehensive project documentation, including status reports, financial records, and project plans, and provide regular updates to senior management
Manage project budgets, ensuring cost-effective use of resources and financial accountability
Drive continuous process optimization and support training initiatives for supervisors and staff
Qualifications:
Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, Project Management, Business, Engineering, Supply Chain Management, or a related field
PMP or equivalent project management certification is preferred
Extensive experience in project management, particularly in labor management or distribution center operations
Strong understanding of financial management, with proven experience managing project budgets
In-depth knowledge of project management best practices and standards
Essential skills:
Expertise in implementing Labor Management Systems (LMS) and managing projects within distribution centers
Strong proficiency in project management tools, such as MS Project
Excellent risk management, resource planning, and stakeholder engagement abilities
Superior communication, interpersonal, and documentation skills with keen attention to detail
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, with the ability to make informed decisions under pressure
Ability to effectively manage multiple stakeholders and navigate complex project dynamics
Desired skills:
Experience in the logistics or distribution industry
Familiarity with data analytics and reporting tools
Experience in training and development, particularly for supervisory roles
Experience:
5-7 years of experience managing complex projects, preferably within labor management or distribution center environments
Demonstrated success in overseeing large-scale projects and driving them to completion in fast-paced settings
Proven track record in financial management and budget oversight
Benefits:
Trissential offers a competitive compensation package for full time roles. The hourly pay range for this role is $85 to $95 depending on candidate's qualifications and experience. This role is eligible for benefits and includes options for medical, dental, vision, and tele-health benefits; Health Savings Account with company contribution; up to 48 hours of accrued paid safe and sick time, and 401k retirement savings.

description:
Bring your heart to CVS Health. Every one of us at CVS Health shares a single, clear purpose: Bringing our heart to every moment of your health. This purpose guides our commitment to deliver enhanced human-centric health care for a rapidly changing world. Anchored in our brand — with heart at its center — our purpose sends a personal message that how we deliver our services is just as important as what we deliver.

Our Heart At Work Behaviors™ support this purpose. We want everyone who works at CVS Health to feel empowered by the role they play in transforming our culture and accelerating our ability to innovate and deliver solutions to make health care more personal, convenient and affordable.
Position Summary
The CVS Health APMO team is looking for an innovative thought partner who has a strong analytic and IT project management skill set to serve as a key contributor on critical business and technical programs. This role will require an out-of-the-box problem solver who is intellectually curious with a demonstrated interest in learning, self-motivated, results-oriented, and high-energy who can easily function in a high demand, performance driven environment. This position will be responsible for independently driving planning and day-to-day management across the full project lifecycle on complex IT initiatives and programs, working closely with project teams to achieve expected results. The Manager, Agile Delivery, will manage all aspects of technology initiatives to successful completion, providing day-to-day leadership, management, and coordination of all activities related to direction, goal setting, planning, estimating, resource allocation and assignments, initiative health and reporting, problem resolution, and collaboration with key stakeholders to ensure goals are met.
Areas of responsibility include:
Project manage the delivery of technology projects or initiatives and ensuring they are delivered on time, on budget and deliver the value expected by the organization.
Oversee detailed project plan development, following iterative development guidelines, and tracking of timelines and milestone with key internal and external partners to address project objectives.
Champion leadership in partnering with other Project Leads and owners to coordinate day-to-day initiative progress, identify risks/barriers and work with project leaders to address challenges.
Interface with other projects to modify plans when necessary to ensure cross-functional dependencies and inter-dependent projects stay coordinated.
Work with all stakeholders to define and acquire all necessary resources and to ensure their continual support for project goals.
Conduct regular project reviews and communicate status of projects in both formal and informal settings to track and drive overall team progress.
Forecast Resources allocations on a weekly basis while maintaining project budget.
Oversee other Agile Management resources and contractors as well as matrixed members of a project team.
Required Qualifications
Background in IT Program management, budget management and execution
Understanding of software development methodologies including agile methodologies.
4+ years overall technology delivery management experience with cross-functional teams of large complex IT product/software
SCRUM Certified
Proficient in Project Management tracking tools, (Project, Rally, Jira) as well as Word, Excel, PowerPoint and Visio.
Understanding of Portfolio Financials and Financial Models (Costs and Savings)
Strong communicator both verbal and written with the ability to influence across all functions and at all levels of the organization.
Preferred Qualifications
Understanding of software development methodologies
Project Management experience in the Healthcare industry
Project Management experience delivering IT projects that have scope requiring deployment of IT Infrastructure solutions, including cloud technology.
PMP and SAFe Agile certification
Education
Bachelor’s Degree or Equivalent experience
Pay Range
The typical pay range for this role is:
$92,700.00 - $203,940.00
This pay range represents the base hourly rate or base annual full-time salary for all positions in the job grade within which this position falls. The actual base salary offer will depend on a variety of factors including experience, education, geography and other relevant factors. This position is eligible for a CVS Health bonus, commission or short-term incentive program in addition to the base pay range listed above.

In addition to your compensation, enjoy the rewards of an organization that puts our heart into caring for our colleagues and our communities. The Company offers a full range of medical, dental, and vision benefits. Eligible employees may enroll in the Company’s 401(k) retirement savings plan, and an Employee Stock Purchase Plan is also available for eligible employees. The Company provides a fully-paid term life insurance plan to eligible employees, and short-term and long term disability benefits. CVS Health also offers numerous well-being programs, education assistance, free development courses, a CVS store discount, and discount programs with participating partners. As for time off, Company employees enjoy Paid Time Off (“PTO”) or vacation pay, as well as paid holidays throughout the calendar year. Number of paid holidays, sick time and other time off are provided consistent with relevant state law and Company policies.

For more detailed information on available benefits, please visit Benefits | CVS Health
We anticipate the application window for this opening will close on: 12/06/2024
Qualified applicants with arrest or conviction records will be considered for employment in accordance with all federal, state and local laws.

Assurety Consulting has the Sr. Project Manager responsible for leading, directing, developing, executing, measuring, and improving accounting, process, people, and software implementation KPIs and workstreams. Assurety is looking for a technically savvy and operationally disciplined senior project manager to help lead efforts in helping our customers manage and enhance mission systems.
The successful candidate is a technical project manager with a track record of successfully developing strong relationships and successfully managing complex, cross-discipline projects must be able to demonstrate a history of successful development of relationships, processes, metrics, project management, collaborations, and operational support. As a leader within this team, we would look for a candidate to bring discipline to the planning and deliverables process and improve the quality of our deliverables. Must be a self-starter, a self-managed person who can coach and mentor Project Leads and lead Project activities. Experience in working with supply chain, eCommerce, marketing, mail, and parcel systems is a plus.
Assurety Consulting genuinely cares about its employees. We bring together the best people and the best careers. Our family of talented and focused professionals enjoy Assurety Consulting’s generous PTO and Holidays, great benefits, and great pay.
All employees of Assurety share one job description which is to keep its customers and help grow the company.
GENERAL FUNCTION:
Lead and manage testing on on-premises software systems as well as Google and AWS Clouds.
Manage requirements gathering and processing, both technical and functional.
You will be responsible for assuring the quality of software before deployment for mission-critical systems that generate billions of dollars in yearly revenues.
Your efforts will minimize stoppage of revenue as well as irate customer calls to the management of your client and you will be able to directly impact the customer experience in a positive way.
You will be able to lead and mentor junior resources and help them grow professionally.
Your efforts will make sure that the products and services envisioned by the VPS and directors are implemented to cut costs, sustain revenues, and improve customer experience.
Your efforts will build trust between the testing and development teams and your goal will be to gain the trust of all stakeholders.
Works as a risk manager and proactively communicates risks and develops solutions to mitigate the risks.
Manages tasks, resources, schedules, and plans for multiple releases per year.
Develops requirements/Test Case plans and matrix.
Must be able to lead and direct the activities of the QA/SOFTWARE TESTING team.
Works with customers and provides QA/Software Testing, process and task management guidance, and status.
Supervises the timely preparation of QA/SOFTWARE TESTING plans and scripts and execution.
Leads and manages QA/SOFTWARE TESTING activities, and mentors other QA/SOFTWARE TESTING resources.
Conducts data analysis and writes QA/SOFTWARE TESTING plans and scripts focused on data and functional testing.
Authoring test cases and performing smoke, functional, negative, regression, and cross-browser testing of our signature product and our core products.
Interpreting, analyzing, and understanding of Requirement/Specification documentation provided for new and existing functionality.
Writing and executing test plans, test scenarios, and test cases
Assisting Development with the research of reported issues
Maintaining records of test progress and documenting test results
Managing Requirement Traceability Matrices
Must be able to manage the activities of multiple QA/SOFTWARE TESTING teams.
You should have strong leadership, written, and verbal communication skills.
Experience with software engineering or requirements management is a plus.
Expertise with testing tools is a must.
Must understand data modeling data entities and data communication and processing related QA/SOFTWARE TESTING activities.
Knowledge of and experience with B2B systems is a plus.
Good interpersonal skills are also required.
QUALIFICATIONS:
Must have 10+ years of progressive Quality Assurance, leadership, and management experience.
Must be able to manage processes and both functional and technical requirements.
Must have past B2B data communication, compliance, processing, and reporting experience.
MUST be able to understand testing driven by data and management-driven driven test scenarios.
Must have practical experience with all stages of the software development life cycle (SDLC) as well as the software testing life cycle (STLC).
8+ years of experience in web-based applications.
Must have communication skills to lead activities and deliver quality deliverables.
Bachelor’s degree in computer science or information Technology related field or comparative experience
Must be a U.S. citizen and/or authorized to work in the United States on a full-time basis for any employer.
Must be able to obtain a Public Trust US government clearance.
Collaborative & Inclusive Culture: Our colleagues work in small, self-organized and cross-functional teams that determine the best tactics to support the vision and strategy set by leadership. We encourage and welcome all ideas, taking an agile approach to creating an amazing product
Design Thinking for Innovation: With focus on our colleague’s growth within Assurety we have developed a Learning Management System (LMS) that trains all colleagues on Design Thinking for Innovation, Security, BI & Analytics, and the business they are about to support. More trainings are added every year.
Recognition & Awards: Our Colleagues are recognized for their innovative problem solving, goodwill, candor with respect and excellence. We also give out spot bonuses besides the yearly performance bonus.
Workplace: While our headquarters is in Sterling, Virginia, and our largest client in Washington DC (on-site), our team lives across the globe. We partner with our team to help them achieve personal and professional alignment, helping our colleagues to define their own blend of work-life balance.
Office Perks: Colleagues that work out of one of our main offices enjoy beverages, snacks, lunches, and happy hour benefits.
Vacation & Holiday Schedule: We believe this is a partnership and we trust our colleagues to build their own time-off schedule and encourage our teams to take time for their well-being while minimizing impacts to Client’s deliverables.
Growth Opportunity: Through hands-on learning and development, the opportunities are endless.
Focus on Well-Being: We pride ourselves on offering numerous benefit options to best fit the needs of our colleagues and their families, including domestic partners. Benefits include medical (PPO & HDHP-HSA), dental, vision, flexible spending account, commuter benefit, discount programs, life & disability insurance, and accident insurance. We also offer a 401k program with company match and paid parental leave.
Live your Passion: Assurety encourages and promotes monetary and personnel involvement in the causes around the globe. We believe in our Value of Goodwill, and work to find new ways to give back to our communities and make a positive impact. We focus on initiatives in the following areas – technology, charity, volunteerism and honorary contributions.
title: Project Manager

description:
GP Strategies Corporation is one of the world's leading talent transformation providers. By delivering award-winning learning and development solutions, we help organizations transform through their people and achieve meaningful change. GP Strategies has delivered our innovative consulting, learning services, and talent technology solutions to over 6,000 organizations globally.
From our global experience working across thousands of projects and initiatives over the past 55 years, we've learned that relationships, business, work, innovation, strategy, and transformation are all about people. And, to put it simply, GP Strategies is about our people - an extensive global network of learning experts. Additional information can be found at www.gpstrategies.com.
PM Communications Role:
Develop & document monthly editorial plan across owned and earned communication channels.
Assist with operational needs, such as AKA development and document management.
Execution of editorial plan across owned/earned channels (Viva Engage, Team SharePoint, Team Newsletter, guest submission to partner newsletters, etc.)
Coordinate quarterly Marketing Learning Team newsletter, utilize existing process (or develop their own process) for content submissions, manage delivery cadence.
Manage Marketing Learning alias and inbox for communications related activities.
Document overall communication strategy updates (archive old).
Conduct monthly measurement audits to ensure communications are reaching marketers across the company.
Skills needed:
Degree or background in Journalism, English, Marketing or Communications
Highly organized with a keen attention to detail
Scrappy – ability to deliver on asks with speed and accuracy.
Technically savvy – power user of M365 apps (namely PowerPoint, Excel, and SharePoint)
Creative skills– can create and manipulate images (PowerPoint, Illustrator, etc)
With more than 4000 employees in over 30 countries, diversity at GP Strategies is second nature! Beyond our locations, our culture focuses on performance and revolves around respect, fairness, and working collaboratively to achieve our goals. We support our People, no matter who they are or where they are from, because we all have valuable and unique perspectives and approaches. That's how great ideas are born, which enable us to work smarter.
GP Strategies is committed and proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex (including pregnancy, childbirth and related conditions, sexual orientation, and gender identity), national origin, age, veteran status, disability, or any other federally protected class.

description:
Job Function: CEO Office The role:
The Partner Investment Project Manager will play a pivotal role in coordinating stakeholders and subject matter experts within SoftwareOne to develop and execute go-to-market (GTM) plans that align with the strategic priorities of Microsoft investment programs and incentives. This role is responsible for ensuring timely project execution, overseeing project budgets, and tracking return on investment (ROI) to ensure alignment with business goals.

Roles and Responsibilities:
Project Management: Lead and manage partner investment projects from initiation through completion, ensuring alignment with project scope, timelines, and budgets.
Stakeholder Collaboration: Work closely with internal teams such as marketing, finance, and product development, as well as external partners, to ensure alignment of project goals and deliverables.
GTM Plan Development: Collaborate with stakeholders and experts to create GTM plans that align with key priorities.
Risk Management: Identify potential risks early on and develop mitigation strategies to ensure project success.
Performance Monitoring: Use appropriate tools to track and monitor project progress and report regularly to senior management.
Budget Management: Manage project budgets, ensuring efficient allocation of resources and adherence to financial guidelines.
ROI Tracking: Monitor and track ROI to ensure alignment with strategic investment objectives.
Documentation: Maintain detailed project documentation, including plans, status reports, and evaluations.
Success Criteria:
Timely Execution: Projects are delivered on time and meet all key milestones.
Stakeholder Satisfaction: Positive feedback from both internal and external stakeholders on project outcomes.
ROI Achievement: Demonstrated achievement of ROI in line with strategic goals.
Risk Mitigation: Successful identification and mitigation of project risks with minimal disruption.
Budget Compliance: Projects are completed within the designated budget with efficient use of resources.
What we need to see from you:
What we need to see from you:
Bachelor’s degree in business administration, Project Management, or a related field.
Minimum of 5 years of experience in project management, ideally within the technology sector.
Over 2 years of experience in technical strategic planning and support.
Experience with partner investment projects is a strong plus.
Expertise with Microsoft cloud products and a solid understanding of the Microsoft Partner ecosystem (Cloud, products, and Offerings).
Knowledge of investment management principles and practices.
Strong project management skills and experience managing complex projects.
Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to collaborate across diverse teams.
Proficiency in project management software and tools.
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
PMP or PRINCE2 certification preferred.
We value individuals who are proactive, collaborative, and results-oriented, with a passion for driving success through strategic project management. If this sounds like you, we encourage you to apply.
What we have to offer

Here at SoftwareOne we encourage autonomy and thinking outside the box - and we can’t wait to hear your new ideas! Our people are our greatest asset, and we’ll go the extra mile to ensure you’re happy here.

Our company benefits vary based on your location, but always include:

Global company culture: We defined our 7 core values through our company culture (https://www.softwareone.com/en/our-story/our-values)
A mentor who supports your successful start and is at your side with advice and action
President’s Club: Recognition awarded by leadership and your peers.
Flexible work: Do great work from anywhere, deliver excellence everywhere.
Incentive programs: Swomies award bonuses to colleagues who go above and beyond.
Lifelong education: A variety of training and development opportunities.
Employee stock option programs (SIX: SWON): Be an owner. All employees can be shareholders.
Hire to Grow: We optimize our internal structures and feedback culture constantly to be your Employer of Choice, today and in future.

You need some more information? https://swo.co/quick-links

You know someone who could be interested in working with us as well?
Share this job (or another) with your network and get the chance of our referral bonus for external referrers. https://www.softwareone.com/en/careers/external-referral-program

title: Project Manager

description:
Description:
Gateway Rehab Center (GRC) has an outstanding opportunity for a Telehealth Project Manager who will support the Director of Telehealth and GRC’s providers and stakeholders to understand the current telemedicine context and align the overall executive strategy with the telemedicine strategy, as well as align the organization towards a common vision and brand for telemedicine services. This is a Hybrid position!
If you are dedicated to service excellence, We invite you to consider joining GRC’s Telehealth team as a Project Manager. GRC encourages its employees to expand their knowledge and develop their careers through growth opportunities and continuing education.
Responsibilities
Supports the Director of Telehealth and current services for inpatient and outpatient programs focusing on the clinical workflows.
Oversees the integration of telehealth technologies with existing healthcare systems, ensuring compliance with industry regulations and standards.
Establishes telemedicine protocols and guidelines on topics such as patient selection, consultation process, documentation and referral pathways developed and implemented to ensure consistency and quality in telehealth service delivery.
Addresses the identified gaps in knowledge and skills, draft comprehensive curriculums, in line with the specific needs of the providers, services and all GRC stakeholders, considering their different roles and responsibilities.
Assumes ownership of Telehealth project life cycles, orchestrating successful project delivery from initiation to deployment, concurrently managing GRC’s Telehealth initiatives.
Maintains robust documentation to ensure compliance with regulatory audit requirements and industry best practices in a dynamic regulatory landscape.
Prepares project plans for all project phases, procuring necessary resources to achieve objectives within planned timelines.
Manages project scope and changes.
Coaches, mentors, motivates, and supervises telehealth providers and GRC stakeholders.
Identifies the current knowledge and skill level of the providers and GRC stakeholders in telemedicine, helping to identify gaps and areas that require further development.
Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities
Has the ability to lead the planning, execution, and delivery of telehealth projects, to ensure projects are completed on time, within scope, and within budget.
Able to collaborate with cross-functional teams, including IT, clinical staff, and external vendors, to develop and implement telehealth solutions.
Proven ability to monitor project progress, identify potential risks, and implement mitigation strategies to ensure successful project outcomes.
Skilled at facilitating communication and coordination between stakeholders to ensure alignment with project goals and objectives.
Knowledgeable with industry regulations and standards.
Requirements:
Bachelor's Degree in appropriate field of study or equivalent work experience.
5 years’ experience in Behavioral Health and SUD treatment and recovery.
2 years of evaluation management in behavior health and SUD treatment and recovery.
2 years of experience working within a cross functional Behavioral Health and SUD matrix environment.
Other Requirements
Pass PA Criminal Background Check
Obtain PA Child Abuse and FBI Fingerprinting Clearances
Pass Drug Screen
TB Test
Work Conditions
Hybrid Position
Drug and Alcohol Center
GRC IS AN EQUAL OPPORTUNITY EMPLOYER M/F/D/V
title: Project Manager

description:
General Summary of Position
Oversees all project management aspects of interactive marketing initiatives to ensure on-time completion with high quality delivery. Leads team members through the details of project/campaign initiating, planning, executing, monitoring, and closing. Responsible for the development of appropriate project management related documentation (scope, schedule, cost, quality, issues and risks, etc.),. Supports RFP process for digital initiatives.

Primary Duties and Responsibilities
Develops and contributes to the achievement of established department goals and objectives and adheres to department policies, procedures, quality standards and safety standards. Ensures compliance with hospital/facility policies and procedures and governmental/accreditation regulations.
Communicates and distributes information to project stakeholders. Manages project stakeholder expectations with support from MedStar subject matter experts, as needed. Reports accurate project information. Creates project management documents and presentations.
Creates and presents best practices, standards and training materials related to project management. Stays up-to-date with the latest trends project management.
Defines project teams, roles and responsibilities, and reporting relationships on projects. Coordinates and facilitates project team sessions. Resolves project level issues, escalating those to the appropriate level that cannot be resolved at the project manager level.
Develops and uses project management processes, procedures, practices, templates, and tools. Accurately reflects project scope and works into a scheduling tool. Accurately reflects small and medium project health, progress, and status in a project portfolio management tool. Utilizes a document management system to collaborate on project documentation.
Develops cost estimates and budgets for projects. Baselines, manages, and controls project costs.
Develops requirements for projects. Manages contracts and vendors on projects.
Develops schedules for projects. Able to identify the type, quantities, and level of effort for resources required, and estimate the duration of schedule tasks. Baselines, manages, and controls project schedules.
Facilitates and coordinates stakeholder analyses to identify expectations and requirements on projects. Able to breakdown project into deliverables and associated work. Able to manage project scope through a change control process.
Identifies customer quality standards. Able to implement quality activities.
Identifies documents, prioritizes, and manages risks according to potential impact on projects. Creates, manages, and executes risk mitigation and response plans on projects.
Leverages discovery driven planning methods to select new initiatives and continuously validate their efficacy.
Manages project assignments and monitors performances of all project participants, including staff, consultants, vendors, etc.
Participates in multidisciplinary quality and service improvement teams as appropriate. Participates in meetings, serves on committees and represents the department and hospital/facility in community outreach efforts as appropriate.

Minimum Qualifications
Education
Bachelor's degree in Business, Computer Science/Information Systems, Health Administration, Project Management; preferred or
a combination of equivalent technical experience and education in a relevant field preferred
Experience
3-4 years Relevant experience in project management. required
Licenses and Certifications
Certified Project Management Professional (PMP)-PMI PMP preferred or
equivalent project management credential, certification, education, preferred or
training preferred
Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities
Ability to multi-task.
Thorough and meticulous attention to minute details.
Ability to work independently with direction;
develops own plan for how to accomplish tasks and follows through to completion.
Superior communication and interpersonal skills with the ability to facilitate meetings and working sessions to meet agenda goals, and to establish long-term professional working relationships with audiences from analysts to senior management.
Superior written and presentation skills.
Thorough understanding of exceptional project management and verbal and written communication skills with the ability to effectively prioritize and execute tasks in a fast-paced environment.
Ability to learn new concepts and apply them to new situations.
Versatile computing skills.
Intermediate skills using Microsoft Project or other Project management tool.

title: Project Manager

description:
Overview:
The Senior Project Manager is a mid-level role requiring basic skills with moderate level of proficiency, has a general understanding of principles in project management, and knowledge of at least one systems development life cycle (SDLC) model.

As a Trustmark Senior Project Manager, you will generally lead small projects (i.e., approximately 1,000 to 3,000 project hours with a team of 5 to 25 team members, an internal cost of $100,000 to $300,000, and a project duration of 3 to 6 months) of medium risk and complexity. You will work under close to moderate supervision of the Program Manager or Manager, Transformational Services / PMO, with limited latitude for independent judgment. The Project Manager I will also collaborate with senior peers on non-complex projects to learn through experience.
Responsibilities:
Plans and coordinates all aspects of small technical projects from initiation through delivery
Ensures requirements for internal technology projects align to operational standards. Develop alternate requirements or document exceptions as appropriate
With management guidance develops, defines and executes project plans, project scope, activities, schedules, budgets and results
Identifies needed resources for projects, defines major project roles. Assigns and supervises work of project team, providing technical and analytical support and direction
Coordinates activities and tasks among project team members, other internal departments and client or vendor/subcontractor organizations as needed to meet project goals and ensure project completion is on schedule, within budget constraints, and of the appropriate quality standards for the project scope
Serves as liaison between technical and non-technical teams, in internal organizations as well as in vendor/subcontractor organizations, to ensure all project targets and requirements are met
Conducts project closure activities to formalize and communicate the project acceptance, handover documentation and ongoing activities to accountable teams and complete a post-implementation review to identify areas of improvement
Identifies Trustmark Transformational Services / PMO process gaps or areas for improvement, recommends and implements standard methodologies and solutions
Perform additional duties as assigned.
Qualifications:
A Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science, MIS, Business Administration or the equivalent combination of education, training, or work experience. Must be in active pursuit of Project Management Professional (PMP) certification or have the equivalent level of education and experience for the job level.
Minimum of five (5) years of work experience handling technical projects in financial services or a related industry OR in a related technical field (e.g., application development, technology integration, business analysis, client technology consulting).
Experience compiling and maintaining extensive project documentation, such as project plans, proposals and information papers, RFPs, project budgets, and issues lists
Experience leading technology and infrastructure projects
PMP, Lean, Agile or Six Sigma certification
Banking/Financial Services industry knowledgeable.
Small to medium size team resource management – on-site and remote.
Communication proficiency.
Project management.
Process improvement.
Software Development Life Cycle (SDLC).
Organizational Change Management (OCM).
Risk identification and management.
Basic understanding of project management standards, processes, procedures and guidelines.
Moderate knowledge of the industry project management standard methodologies (i.e., Project Management Body of Knowledge - PMBOK).
Knowledge of various types of IT project methodologies and life cycles (e.g., conversions, incremental, rapid delivery, classic or traditional waterfall phases of analysis, design, development, testing, and implementation) and the accurate project application.
Understanding of standards relevant to the software industry (e.g., ISO, CMM, Six Sigma).
Knowledge of Trustmark’s products and services.
Basic skill in managing project budgets and time lines.
Skill in the use of negotiation techniques to reach agreement when there are widely differing viewpoints.
Excellent analysis, problem-solving, team, conflict management and time management skills.
Strong verbal and written communication skills.
Ability to interact effectively with senior level executives.
Ability to set clear expectations, manage team performance and build high morale among team members.
Ability to maintain confidentiality and carry out assignments that are critical in nature.
Masters / MBA degree Preferred
Prior Project Governance Experience preferred.
Prior Experience with ServiceNow Portfolio Project Management (or equivalent) preferred
Prior Banking Experience preferred

description:
At Tetra Pak we commit to making food safe and available, everywhere; and we protect what's good – protecting food, protecting people, and protecting the planet. By doing so we touch millions of people's lives every day.
And we need people like you to make it happen.
We empower you to reach your potential with opportunities to make an impact to be proud of – for food, people and the planet.

Job Summary
Join our Talent Community!
We are looking for a professional, who will be part of a highly skilled team of project managers and engineers who strongly contributes to the overall successful management of multidiscipline teams to assure each project phase is completed on time, within budget, and to the customers’ satisfaction. You will manage all aspects of system quotations and projects and have overall responsibility and accountability both internally and externally for project success, contributing to the overall sales result and customer satisfaction in the US & Canada.
You might be travelling up to 30% to 50% of your time on average.
The US/CA Project Centre will prioritize local candidates (Internal or External), who will not require international relocation to the United States, due our urgency to place the talents in the market.
What you will do
As a Project Manager you will:
Overall responsibility for project execution and provide project leadership to deliver project result.
Secure project deliverables according to project agreement (the contract) and act according to responsibilities in the project charter
Breakdown and plan the project into phases and fulfill the plan and project milestones in time and in full according to budget.
Drive productivity in project through utilization of global re-useable solutions, processes and tools including quality, project governance, and risk management.
Manage scope changes and issue variation orders.
Secure project communication and documentation according to project communication plan
Provide lesson learned and providing input to improvement or development of processes and tools.
Conduct and manage quotation development in conjunction with account managers for systems/modules
Provide sales support by giving technical and/or commercial presentation.
Conduct and manage project implementation of sold systems/modules. Provide issue management related to projects.
Manage project team and provide feedback to Senior Management on team member performance. Participate in project review board meetings.
Continuous education in the area of Project Management with the expectation to obtain or maintain PMP certification.
Execute according to Tetra Pak strategy and its elements.
We believe you have
Bachelor’s degree in Mechanical, Electrical, Industrial or Chemical Engineer, Food Science or similar discipline; or equivalent skills and experience
PMI certification, or the motivation to attain the PMI certification is required.
Minimum 5-10 years Project Management experience.
Demonstrable leadership skills and communication skills.
Negotiations skills and capability to maneuver through political and cultural situations effectively.
Industry Related Regulatory Knowledge (PMO, 3A, OSHA, CFR-113, etc.).
Microsoft Offi ce; Microsoft Project; SAP; Basic AutoCAD Skills.
Experience with budgeting, fiscal management, and project planning.
Very good command of the written and spoken English language.
Ideally knowledge of dairy, beverage, cheese, and powder processing.
Able to travel extensively during implementation and commissioning of projects.
Pay Equity
Tetra Pak provides the following compensation range that in good faith believes it might pay and/or offer for this position. The range displayed reflects the minimum and maximum target for new hire salaries for the position across all US locations.
Ranges are determined by role, level and location. Within the range, individual pay is defined by work location and additional factors, including job-related skills, experience, and relevant education or training.
This compensation range is based on a full-time schedule. The estimate displayed is just one component of Tetra Pak's total compensation package for employees. Other rewards include overtime, annual performance bonus, competitive benefits, and work-related allowances.
Annual Base Salary Range (ABS): $100,522.00 – $143,000.00.
Short-term Incentive/Bonus (Variable Pay): Eligible to performance incentive of 10% of ABS.
Benefits: 401k company match, paid time off, paid holidays, health, dental, vision, life and disability insurance, paid parental leave, tuition reimbursement, company credit card, and much more!
We Offer You
A variety of exciting challenges with ample opportunities for development and training in a truly global landscape
A culture that pioneers a spirit of innovation where our industry experts drive visible results
An equal opportunity employment experience that values diversity and inclusion
Market competitive compensation and benefits with flexible working arrangements

Apply Now
If you are inspired to be part of our promise to protect what’s good; for food, people, and the planet, apply through our careers page at https://jobs.tetrapak.com/.
This job posting expires on 10/06/2024.
If you have any questions about your application, please contact Jatwana Calhoun Brown.

All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or status as a protected veteran.
title: Project Manager

benefits: Retire
description:
Overview:
Stellar Solutions, a nationally recognized “Great Place To Work”, has exciting opportunities providing Engineering solutions for innovative new-entrant space companies, as well as established space systems manufacturers, commercial space system operators and service providers, and other industry stakeholders including investors.

At Stellar Solutions, we offer talented, energetic, and immediately productive resources to satisfy our customers’ critical needs in systems engineering and integration, mission operations, program management and strategic planning. We are a leading service and expertise provider for high-tech commercial ventures, spanning communications, earth observation and remote sensing systems and data products, to the infrastructures that support earth orbiting and beyond earth orbit businesses.
Role/Responsibilities/Qualifications:
In this role, you will be part of a team managing a large system procurement, providing expert input and advice related to space, launch, and ground system commercial program management.

For this role, key qualifications include:
Excellent written and verbal communications with a demonstrated capability to work collaboratively with customers at all levels, partners, and colleagues
BS in Engineering (Mechanical, Electrical, Aerospace, or Systems preferred) with 8+ yr experience in commercial space systems program management
Experience working on commercial satellite programs, including communication space systems
Must be a self-motivated individual who can work independently and in a team
Comfortable working in fast-paced commercial and start up environments and enjoy working with multidisciplinary teams on a diverse array of challenges related to satellite system development and implementation
Must be a US citizen or greencard holder
Role is immediate, full time, and may be performed from N California, or S California or with regular travel. Other locations may be considered
Desired Qualifications:

Commercial Space Systems Program Management including evaluation of contracts, RDW, schedule/ IMS, management of key milestones and deliverables,
Spacecraft System Engineering expertise including but not limited to end-to-end architecture concepts, supplier evaluation, CONOPS development, ICD development, and creating technical proposals
Candidate may have experience in one of many of the following:
Subsystem design and analysis, Systems Architecture development, bus systems engineering, electrical system design, mechanical system design, TTC, Comm payload design, Orbit Dynamics, GNC/ ACS design, and design for manufacture and test
Domain expertise across a spectrum of technical domains such as: space environments analysis and test, PMP, thermal design/ analysis/ test, structural design/ analysis/ test, reliability, launch and mission analysis, ground system design
The typical pay range for this position is USD $130,000 - $220,000 per year, total package. Individual pay is determined by many factors including work location, job-related skills, experience, and relevant education or training. This position is also eligible for a discretionary annual performance bonus, retirement plan and other benefits (all included as part of package)

Role Index:

PMP: Project Management Professional
IMS: Integrated Master Schedule
RDW: Requirements Document Workshop
ICD: Interface Control Document
GNC: Guidance, Navigation, and Control
ACS: Attitude Control System
TRL: Technology Readiness Level
RFQ: Request for Quotation
RFI: Request for Information
SOW: Statement of Work
MSA: Master Service Agreement
SLA: Service Level Agreement
NDAA: National Defense Authorization Act
EVM: Earned Value Management
COTS: Commercial Off-The-Shelf
GSE: Ground Support Equipment
O&M: Operations and Maintenance
QA/QC: Quality Assurance/Quality Control
DFM/DFT: Design for Manufacturability/Design for Testability
LOI: Letter of Intent
EAC: Estimate at Completion
ROI: Return on Investment
CCB: Change Control Board
RFP: Request for Proposal
RTO: Recovery Time Objective
Deliverable(s):
Join our dynamic team to shape the future of commercial space systems! You'll play a pivotal role in managing large system procurements and providing expert advice on cutting-edge space and ground systems, working alongside top-tier professionals in a fast-paced and collaborative environment.
title: Project Manager

description:
Overview:
Join AIR as a Technical Project Manager in our Technology Solutions team where we use technology to transform the world we live in. Our cross-cutting Technology Solutions team provides technical expertise and solutions by focusing on responsive service and flexibility in delivery. Our collaborative, learning-oriented team works worldwide in a flexible working environment, towards the mission of making the world a better, more equitable place.

We design, architect, develop, and deploy cutting-edge, user-centered solutions, including:
Software development of data collection, processing, and reporting solutions for data-intensive projects
Dissemination of data and information through websites and content management systems
Solving complex problems using machine-learning and artificial intelligence
Data visualization
Online training courses and media development
With diversity, equity, and inclusion built into our DNA, we value the contributions of every member of our institution. Use your tech skills for good and collaborate with fellow changemakers in our Technology Solutions team.

This is a part time psoition. Candidates hired for the position may work remotely within the United States (U.S.) or from one of our U.S. office locations.This does not include U.S. territories.

About AIR:

Established in 1946, with headquarters in Arlington, Virginia, AIR is a nonpartisan, not-for-profit institution that conducts behavioral and social science research and delivers technical assistance to solve some of the most urgent challenges in the U.S. and around the world. We advance evidence in the areas of education, health, the workforce, human services, and international development to create a better, more equitable world.

AIR’s commitment to diversity goes beyond legal compliance to its full integration in our strategy, operations, and work environment. At AIR, we define diversity broadly, considering everyone’s unique life and community experiences. We believe that embracing diverse perspectives, abilities/disabilities, racial/ethnic and cultural backgrounds, styles, ages, genders, gender identities and expressions, education backgrounds, and life stories drives innovation and employee engagement. Learn more about AIR's Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion Strategy and hear from our staff by clicking here.
Responsibilities:
The responsibilities for the position include:

The Technical Project Manager will work to develop and implement various distance learning products and technologies and will work with staff and clients in the use of distance learning and other project-based technologies. Will also work collaboratively with staff and subject matter experts to develop various multimedia (including audio, video, and graphic production) in support of the implementation of distance learning.

Develop and implement distance learning and other project technology initiatives.
Work collaboratively with staff to develop multimedia (including audio, video, and graphic production) to support distance learning development efforts.
Design and deliver training related to project-based and distance learning technologies for staff.
Assist with implementation of information systems to support HSD program work.
Provide support in project planning and implementation by managing, monitoring, and tracking project tasks using standard processes and workflows.
Track project benchmarks and make recommendations for change as needed.

Qualifications:
Education, Knowledge, and Experience:

Bachelor’s degree in education, distance education, instructional technology, or computer science with 5+ years of relevant experience or Master’s degree with 4+ years of experience.
Experience developing, managing, and/or delivering online courses and products and various media in support of education and/or professional development efforts.
Experience developing various media (audio, video, etc.) in support of distance learning initiatives.
Experience with learning management systems (e.g. Moodle, Blackboard, etc.), instructional technologies (e.g. Articulate Storyline, Adobe Captivate, etc.) and general productivity software (e.g. Microsoft Office)
Experience providing direct technical support to a wide range of constituents.
Skills:
Ability to support others in the use of various technologies.
Commitment to working in a culturally competent work environment that values diversity, equity, and inclusion.
Organized with a proven ability to track and complete deadline-driven projects on budget.
Detail oriented, persistent, and organized team player.
Strong time management, organizational skills, and the ability to multitask.
Commitment to providing excellent customer service to clients.
Disclosures:

Applicants must be currently authorized to work in the U.S. on a full-time basis. Employment-based visa sponsorship (including H-1B sponsorship) is not available for this position. Depending on project work, qualified candidates may need to meet certain residency requirements.

All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without discrimination on the basis of age, race, color, religion, sex, gender, gender identity/expression, sexual orientation, national origin, protected veteran status, or disability.

AIR adheres to strict child safeguarding principles. All selected candidates will be expected to adhere to these standards and principles and will therefore undergo reference and background checks.

AIR’s Total Rewards Program, is designed to reward our staff competitively and motivate them to achieve our critical mission. This position offers an anticipated hourly rate of $52.88 - $62.50. Salary offers are made based on internal equity within the institution and external equity with competitive markets. Please note this is the annual salary range for candidates that are based in the United States.

AIR maintains a drug-free work environment.

Fraudulent Job Scams Warning & Disclaimer:

AIR is aware of individuals falsely presenting themselves as AIR representatives. Fraudulent job scams seek to extract sensitive information or money from victims. To protect yourself, please be aware that AIR recruitment will only email you from an “@air.org” domain. Please take extra caution while examining the email address, for example jdoe@air.org is correct and jdoe@aircareers.org is not a legitimate AIR email address. If you are unsure of the legitimacy of a communication you have received, please reach out to recruitment@air.org.

If you see a job scam, or lose money to one, report it to the Federal Trade Commission (FTC) at ReportFraud.ftc.gov. You can also report it to your state attorney general. Find out more about how to avoid scams at ftc.gov/scams.

#LI-MP1 #LI-Remote
title: Project Manager

description:
GENERAL PURPOSE:
Under the direction of the COO the Operations Project Manager provides oversight to all operations projects. This includes planning, organizing staff and stake holders, implementation, project control, and implementation. The Operations Project Manager leads projects as needed for Clinical Operations, Quality, and WIC, and collaborates with other departments as instructed by the COO.
MAIN RESPONSIBILITIES & DUTIES:
Plan the project.
Define the scope of the project in collaboration with senior management.
Create a detailed work plan which identifies and sequences the activities needed to successfully complete the project.
Determine the resources (time, money, equipment, etc.) required to complete the project and project estimated budget.
Develop a schedule for project completion that effectively allocates the resources to the activities.
Review the project schedule with senior management and all other staff that will be affected by the project activities; revise the schedule as required.
Determine the objectives and measures upon which the project will be evaluated at its completion.
Organizing the staff and stakeholder selection.
In consultation with the COO recruits all necessary staff and stakeholders with appropriate skills necessary to carry out all project activities.
Facilitates stakeholders staff meetings, takes minutes, and summarize deliverables to ensure stakeholders are organized and remain on task for the duration of the project.
Manage project staff and/or volunteers according to the established policies and practices of Ampla Health.
Ensure that all project personnel receive an appropriate orientation to the project.
Solicit qualified consultants to work on the project as appropriate and present candidates to senior management.
Oversee RFP process for new projects.
Implement the project.
Execute the project according to the project plan.
Develop forms and records to document project activities.
Set up files to ensure that all project information is appropriately documented and secured.
Monitor the progress of the project and make adjustments as necessary to ensure the successful completion of the project.
Establish a communication schedule to update stakeholders including appropriate staff within Ampla Health on the progress of the project, prepare progress reports for senior management.
Review the quality of the work completed with the project team on a regular basis to ensure that it meets the project standards.
Control the project.
Write progress reports on the project for senior management.
Monitor all budgeted project expenditures.
Monitor cash flow projections and report actual cash flow and variance to senior management on a regular basis.
Manage all project funds according to established accounting policies and procedures.
Ensure that all financial records for the project are up to date.
Evaluate the project.
Ensure that the project deliverables are on time, within budget and at the required level of quality.
Evaluate the outcomes of the project as established during the planning phase.
Understanding or healthcare management principles
Knowledge of operations of clinical settings and performance improvement.
This position will receive training for future Site Administrator job duties at Ampla Health.
QUALITIES &CHARACTERISTICS:
Maintains a professional relationship and positive attitude with co-workers, the public, patients and all Ampla Healths staff, Board of Directors, and vendors.
Maintains the highest professional ethics and is honest in dealing with people; is a model for all employees through his/her actions.
Strives to learn more and is receptive to learning different ways of doing things.
Displays enthusiasm toward the work and the missions of Ampla Health
PROFESSIONAL KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS & ABILITIES:
Education and Experience
Bachelors degree in Business Administration, Healthcare Administration, Public Health, Project Management is required. Bachelors and 2 years of experience, or a Masters in Healthcare Management, Healthcare Administration, Public Health in Healthcare Management is preferred.
Knowledge, skills, abilities
Proven experience in managing complex projects up to completion (example-full implementation of EHR, EDR, etc.) is required.
Knowledge of project management, timelines, deadlines, and follow-through on finished projects.
Proficiency in the use of computers for:
Microsoft Office Suite
Microsoft Visio
Microsoft Project Management
Proficient in ECW EHR or equivalent
COMMUNICATION SKILLS:
Communicate Effectively: Speak, listen, and write clearly, thoroughly, and timely using appropriate and effective communication tools and techniques.
Foster Teamwork: Work cooperatively and effectively with others to set goals, resolve problem, and make decisions that enhance Ampla Health effectiveness.
Lead: Positively influence others to achieve results that are in the best interest of Ampla Health.
Facilitate Decisions: Provide senior management with all the necessary information to facilitate and expedite decisions.
Organize: Set priorities, develop a work schedule, monitor progress towards goals, and track details, data, information, and activities.
Plan: Determines strategies to move the projects forward, set goals, creates, and implements actions plans, and evaluate the process and results.
Must have neat and legible handwriting.
Must be able to interact with patients courteously and calmly.
Ability to communicate well with the public.
WORKING CONDITIONS & PHYSICAL REQUIREMENTS:
Works well with patients, co-worker and vendors in a generally comfortable environment office. Employee must possess the following physical requirements:
Must be able to lift up to 40 lbs. and push up to 100 lbs (on wheels)
Must be able to hear staff on the phones and those who are served in person, speak clearly in order to communicate information to patients, vendors, agencies and staff.
Must have vision adequate to read memos, a computer screen, forms, and documents.
Must have high manual dexterity.
Must be able to reach above the shoulder level to work, bend, squat and sit, stand, stoop, crouching, reaching, kneeling and twisting/turning.

title: Project Manager

benefits: 401(k),Disability insurance,Health insurance,Paid
description:
About ITT::
ITT is an industrial manufacturer of critical, engineered components that serve fast-growing end markets in transportation, flow, energy, aerospace and defense. The company’s differentiation is sustained through a combination of several factors: execution, the quality of its leadership and our DNA as an engineering leader. We have a clear purpose as an organization: to provide our customers with cutting-edge solutions to help solve their most critical needs.
The company generated 2023 revenues of $3.3 billion and is comprised of three distinct segments:
Motion Technologies ($1.5B revenue) is a global leader in brake pads, shock absorbers and sealing solutions for the automotive and rail markets
Industrial Process ($1.1B revenue) is a global leader in centrifugal and twin-screw pumps for the chemical, energy, mining and industrial markets
Connect & Control Technologies ($0.7B) is a niche player in harsh environment connectors and control components in critical applications for the aerospace, defense and industrial markets.
ITT is headquartered in Stamford, Connecticut with over 10,000 employees in more than 35 countries and sales in approximately 125 countries.
Position Summary:
ITT Inc. is searching for a Project Manager to join their Motion Technologies division in Novi, MI. The Technical Project Manager is the lead technical liaison with customers. This position is responsible to lead and manage program expectations, timing, validation and industrialization activities coordinating with all ITT departments. Ensure testing is completed in time, perform data analysis, and report/review results with internal and external customers and stakeholders. The Technical Project Manager will need to have effective communication skills as well as a strong technical background. This position will be an integral part of the team creating a premier customer experience for ITT customers.
Essential Responsibilities:
Understand customer requirements and identify effective solutions
Provide technical, design, and product application guidance to meet customer needs requirements.
Lead industrialization activities for assigned projects coordinating with all internal departments
Manage design changes before and after start of production
Create and maintain a Design Verification Plan and Report with support of Application Engineer
Review and maintain design records (drawings, specifications, procedures)
Manage testing to complete product validation
Interface with customer engineers on a daily basis
Establish strong customer relationships, including the Engineering, Program Management, Testing, Quality, and Purchasing Departments.
Work proactively to find new opportunities by providing Engineered Solutions to increase customer satisfaction.
Interface with all ITT departments to ensure customer satisfaction
Conduct root cause analysis
Provide status reports to management
Identify and understand future trends and requirements
Observe and participate in external testing of ITT products
Position Requirements:
Strong problem solving and decision-making skills required
Bachelor's degree in Mechanical Engineering is preferred
5-10 years’ experience in automotive manufacturing and product launch experience is strongly preferred
Up to 25% local and international travel is required
Knowledge of the vehicle brake system and testing is a plus.
Ability to communicate technical solutions effectively.
Ability to build relationships at all levels within and outside of the organization
Safety is a core value at ITT. Our employees understand and follow all ITT safety policies and procedures, participate in workplace inspections, safety training, and in the development of job safety analyses.

ITT Corporation is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, protected veteran or disability status, or any other characteristic protected by law.

#LI-MC1

Equal Pay Act Statement: We aim to pay our ‘ITT’ers’ fairly and competitively in the locations that they live and work. Pay-for-performance is a principle that we believe in, and employees are rewarded based not only on ‘what’ they accomplish, but also on ‘how’ they reflect ITT’s values. ITT offers a competitive salary and robust total rewards package, such as health insurance, 401(k), short and long-term disability, paid time off, growth and developmental opportunities, and other incentive compensation programs. Specific benefits are dependent upon whether or not the position is part of a collective-bargaining agreement. The salary offered to a candidate is based several factors such as candidate experience and qualifications, location, as well as market and business considerations. Equal Pay Act Range: Annual Salary Range is $94,000 to $140,600 plus benefits and incentive plans.
title: Project Manager

benefits: 401(k) matching,Dental insurance,Health insurance,Vision
description:
Job ID: 18353
Benefits Offering
RailWorks is committed to helping our employees live better lives. We offer comprehensive benefits packages to eligible employees, including competitive pay, medical, dental and vision coverage, 401(k) with company match, and additional performance incentives

Pay Range: $150000 - $190000 / year

Position Summary
The Senior Project Manager leads, directs, and exercises functional authority over all aspects of constructions projects including planning, organizing, budgeting, and cost reporting. Ensures that the goals and objectives of each project are accomplished on schedule and within budget, and that quality and safety standards are met. Directs department staff in successfully accomplishing goals and objectives.

Primary/Essential Responsibilities and Duties
Reviews project proposals and plans to gain an understanding of the project requirements (time frame, budget, safety, quality, staffing, materials and equipment requirements) necessary to complete the project within the required time frame
Develops an execution plan that outlines staffing, materials, equipment, subcontracting, and other services that are necessary to deliver the project on time and within budget
Verifies estimates based on detailed review of proposal specifications
Coordinates with department managers to establish work plans and staffing for each phase of the project
Organizes and conducts meetings with project staff and management to communicate information related to each function’s needs concerning project requirements
Leads project activities to ensure that the project is executed in accordance with designs, budgets and schedules; takes appropriate action to minimize the impact of deviations
Monitors and oversees the efficient use of materials and equipment and the contractual performance of the project; confers with project staff to ensure that assigned duties and responsibility are performed per agreed upon expectations
Monitors and oversees onsite activities, quality, productivity, progress, and safety of employees and subcontractors
Oversees financial aspects of contracts
Provides technical assistance and recommends construction methods and equipment
Anticipates potential roadblocks and develops solutions to prevent issues from arising; resolves any problems that may arise during project execution
Implements and monitors safety programs
Represents the company in project meetings
Prepares written reports and/or updates (internal and external) for management, client, and project team, to ensure a clear understanding of project status
Hires, trains, and manages performance of staff
Administers financial tracking systems to monitor project costs and estimates.

Required Skills and Qualifications
A minimum of 5 years of construction management experience including a thorough knowledge of construction industry practices, methods, processes, and standards and their impact on project activities
Demonstrates a working knowledge of basic project accounting, project controls (cost, schedule, change management, etc.), material management, contract management, subcontract management, safety, and quality
Exhibits strong leadership qualities and abilities; applies innovative and effective management techniques to maximize employee performance
Track record of successfully planning and executing projects on schedule and within budget
Effective verbal and written communication skills and presentation skills
Strong client relations, influencing skills and organizational skills.


Physical Requirements and Working Conditions
Frequently works outdoors at construction sites and occasionally works indoors
Frequently stands, walks, climbs, balances, stoops, and crouches while negotiating work areas under construction
Sits, reads, writes, and uses a keyboard
May be exposed to harsh weather conditions including very hot and very cold weather
May be exposed to loud noise.

This job description is not intended to represent a complete, comprehensive list of all duties and responsibilities that may be required in this position. There may be unplanned activities and other duties as assigned.

RailWorks is North America’s leading track and transit system experts for over 100 years and with 45 offices across the U.S. and Canada. We take on challenging projects every day and our success rely on a collaborative and open-minded work environment that encourages teamwork, positivity, and ingenuity. We are committed to creating a culture of trust, respect, and acceptance. RailWorks also offers opportunities to grow your career, develop your skills and pursue success.
RailWorks is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment with RailWorks without regard to an individual’s sex, race, religion, creed, color, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity, marital status, age, disability, veteran status or other legally protected characteristics.


Nearest Major Market: Philadelphia
title: Project Manager

benefits: 401(k),401(k) matching,Health
description:
Location: Syosset, New York
Job Type: Permanent
Compensation Range: $125,000 - 140,000 per year
Our client, a fun & fast-growing start-up, is hiring a Director of Project Management to join their Marketing & Product teams. This is a direct-hire full-time opportunity to join a disruptor in the pet-care space.

This role is based on Long Island and requires in-office most days. Please do not apply if you are NOT able to commute to a LI office.
Responsibilities:
Work with executive leadership to make critical decisions that impact deadlines, resolve issues quickly, and clarify product-related questions.
Create and oversee detailed timelines for both new and ongoing product development, ensuring all projects remain on schedule.
Coordinate with internal teams to ensure everyone is informed of key deadlines and project milestones, using dashboards to track progress and flagging deadlines to responsible team members.
Act as the primary point of contact regarding deliverable timelines and deadlines between product development, marketing, operations, finance, and design to ensure smooth communication and collaboration.
Collaborate with external vendors to understand order volumes and manufacturing limitations, aligning these with project timelines and requirements.
Think creatively about how to adjust timelines nimbly to ensure on-time delivery while balancing the needs of both the internal and external teams.
Monitor and manage the distribution of samples to retail partners and maintain internal records for future reference.
Lead the adoption and transition of project management software to improve workflow efficiency and ensure team is trained and brought along for transition.
Identify and flag risks to project timelines and quality and work to create mitigation solutions.
Gain in-depth knowledge of component lead times and manufacturing constraints to enhance project planning and execution.
Understand costs and the implications on timelines, seeking efficiencies to optimize workflows and helping team to understand cost and benefits of continent plans.
Manage internal alignment meetings around product development and ensure tasks are clearly outlined to team.
Coordinate purchase ordering with operations and finance.
Qualifications:
Experience level: Director
Education: Bachelors (required)
10+ years of proven experience in consumer products development, operations, and managing multiple product lifecycles from business development to final delivery.
Deep familiarity with project management processes, tools, and development, including the ability to create dashboards and visually communicate timelines, milestones, and tasks.
Strong understanding of the product development process and the impact of components on design, development, and manufacturing.
Strategic thinker with strong analytical skills, adept at optimizing processes and thinking creatively about contingencies.
Excellent communication skills, with a track record of clearly managing tasks and milestones to keep projects on track.
Proven ability to influence multiple teams in fast-paced startup environments, including manufacturing, sourcing, creative, marketing, strategy, and product development.
Experience in bringing mass-produced consumer products to market and the agility to reorient the team as needed towards changing goals.
Excellent working knowledge of Microsoft Excel, PowerPoint and other digital project management tools like Asana, Workfront, etc.
