Summary
We are seeking an experienced and motivated individual for the position of Technical Program/Project Manager to join our dynamic team. This is an exciting opportunity for a candidate who is interested in taking the next step in their career and eager to take on new challenges and drive growth within our organization. As a Technical Program/Project Manager, you’ll play a crucial role in managing complex technical programs across various engineering disciplines.
Responsibilities
Collaborate with clients to understand technical requirements, review designs, and assess production schedules.
Provide feedback to Celestica’s internal Engineering, New Product Introduction, and Sustaining Teams to validate client requests and drive risk mitigation and process improvements.
Manage cross-functional projects spanning electrical design, manufacturing, and quality assurance.
Facilitate engineering meetings with Celestica and clients across different geographic regions and time zones (Asia and North America).
Utilize a growth mindset to identify innovative strategies and solutions that enhance customer relationships and drive business expansion.
Serve as a customer-facing liaison, building strong relationships with key clients and acting as their advocate within the organization.
Utilize previous experience and insights from customer-facing roles to gather and translate customer requirements into actionable strategies.
Monitor industry trends and competitor activities to stay ahead of market developments and identify potential opportunities for growth.

Electrical and electronic design, including reading basic schematics.
PCB and PCBA routing and placement.
Thermal cooling principles.
2D/3D mechanical design and fabrication.
Software/firmware program nomenclature (e.g., firmware, FPGA, CPLD, BSP, BMC) without requiring code writing.
Manufacturing process flow (from IQC to assembly and packing).
Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to effectively present complex information to both internal and external stakeholders.
Strategic thinker with the ability to analyze data, identify trends, and develop actionable insights.
Proficiency in relevant software and tools, including CRM systems and data analytics platforms.

Minimum of 8 years of progressive experience in customer program development, operations, and/or supply chain management.
Typical Education
Bachelor’s degree in Bachelor’s degree in Electrical Engineering, Computer Science, or Computer Engineering.
Salary
$88,000 - 120,000 USD/year

The salary range described in this posting is an estimate by the Company, and may change based on several factors, including by not limited to a change in the duties covered by the job posting, or the credentials, experience or geographic jurisdiction of the successful candidate.
Notes
If you are a forward-thinking professional with a passion for driving customer-centric growth and possess the qualifications mentioned above, we invite you to apply for the position of Customer Program Management Consultant. Join us in shaping the future of our organization and making a meaningful impact on our customers’ experiences.
This job description is not intended to be an exhaustive list of all duties and responsibilities of the position. Employees are held accountable for all duties of the job. Job duties and the % of time identified for any function are subject to change at any time.
All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or status as a protected veteran.


Celestica’s policy on equal employment opportunity prohibits discrimination based on race, color, creed, religion, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, marital status, veteran or disability status, or other characteristics protected by law.
This policy applies to hiring, promotion, discharge, pay, fringe benefits, job training, classification, referral and other aspects of employment and also states that retaliation against a person who files a charge of discrimination, participates in a discrimination proceeding, or otherwise opposes an unlawful employment practice will not be tolerated. All information will be kept confidential according to EEO guidelines.

Location: This is a remote position, with travel as necessary. We are open to considering candidates close to any of our US locations in Massachusetts, Pennsylvania, Minnesota, Texas, Arizona, Oregon or California as well as locations near major airports such as the Northeast, Southeast, Midwest and Pacific Coast.

COMPANY OVERVIEW:
Celestica (NYSE, TSX: CLS) enables the world’s best brands. Through our recognized customer-centric approach, we partner with leading companies in Aerospace and Defense, Communications, Enterprise, HealthTech, Industrial, Capital Equipment and Energy to deliver solutions for their most complex challenges. As a leader in design, manufacturing, hardware platform and supply chain solutions, Celestica brings global expertise and insight at every stage of product development – from drawing board to full-scale production and after-market services for products from advanced medical devices, to highly engineered aviation systems, to next-generation hardware platform solutions for the Cloud. Headquartered in Toronto, with talented teams spanning 40+ locations in 13 countries across the Americas, Europe and Asia, we imagine, develop and deliver a better future with our customers.

Celestica would like to thank all applicants, however, only qualified applicants will be contacted.
Celestica does not accept unsolicited resumes from recruitment agencies or fee based recruitment services.

description:
About Oliver Wyman
Oliver Wyman is a global leader in management consulting. With offices in more than 70 cities across 30 countries, Oliver Wyman combines deep industry knowledge with specialized expertise in strategy, operations, risk management, and organization transformation. The firm has more than 6,000 professionals around the world who work with clients to optimize their business, improve their operations, and risk profile, and accelerate their organizational performance to seize the most attractive opportunities. Oliver Wyman’s thought leadership is evident in our agenda-setting books, white papers, research reports, and articles in the business press. Our clients are the CEOs and executive teams of the top Global 1000 companies.
Visit our website for more details about Oliver Wyman: www.oliverwyman.com
This role is open in multiple locations: Boston, NY, Chicago and Washington DC.
Job Overview:
The Internal Consulting Hub team is looking for a dynamic and experienced Project Manager to join the team based in the Americas’ leading large-scale change initiatives across the organization. The ideal candidate will have a proven track record in managing complex projects, driving organizational change, and fostering collaboration among diverse teams. This role requires strong leadership skills, strategic thinking, and the ability to navigate through ambiguity.
Within Oliver Wyman, there is a consistent stream of initiatives and change projects that exhibit one or more of the following characteristics:
Has significant strategic importance to the organization
Spans uniformly across Support functions with no clear fit of responsibility
Spans across Business Units/Regions/organizational boundaries which expands beyond the responsibilities of individuals working within a single organizational unit
Requires business-side ownership to manage change (i.e. push adoption, set-up supporting infrastructure, etc.)
Requires access to sensitive information which does not permit a temporary resource (i.e. beached consultant) to perform the task
Key Responsibilities:
Plays a lead role in the delivery of strategic initiatives across Oliver Wyman
Identify potential risks and develop strategies to mitigate them. Monitor project progress and adjust plans as needed to address challenges.
Collaborate with senior leadership, function heads, and key stakeholders to define project goals and ensure alignment with organizational objectives. Facilitate regular communication and updates.
Manage change programs or projects that span across support functions and/or Business Units/Regions/organizational units (e.g. Task Tracker, BFF)
Execute initiatives requiring access to sensitive information (e.g. Partner Survey, Infrastructure Satisfaction Survey, etc.)
Support functions that operate at a global and cross-function/practice level when required (e.g. Internal Communications)
Develop recommendations to issues and challenges from tasks at hand
Experience Required:
3-5 years of Project/program management experience in complex and long-term initiatives
Track record of sound strategic decision-making and ownership of business issues
Proficiency in project management tools and software
Proficiency with Microsoft Office Suite
Solved complex problems across multiple disciplines and functions
Broad knowledge of support/operational functions within Oliver Wyman
Skills and Attributes:
Strong project, process and change management skills
Ability to work independently with minimal oversight while adapting to project constraints
Strong interpersonal skills to interact with individuals across functions and levels
Natural ability to train and influence behavior of all types of individuals
Ability to summarize key information for discussion and decision by firm leaders
Intellectual curiosity to learn and understand processes/operations in the organization
Ability to see the strategic picture and complex interdependencies concurrently
Initiative to pursue answers while ensuring stakeholders participate and are informed
Ability to converge and formulate recommendations within challenging constraints
Strong analytical skills to derive fact-based recommendations
Can produce flawless analytics and derive deep insight
Ability to interpret and handle sensitive information within a broader context
Ability to re-prioritize responsibilities and tasks dependent on organizational needs
Comfortable in an ambiguous and fast-changing environment
Significant personal network, well-respected role model and seen as a leader
Marsh & McLennan Companies is a global professional services firm providing advice and solutions in the areas of risk, strategy and human capital. It is the parent company of a number of the world's leading risk experts and specialty consultants, including Marsh, the insurance broker and risk advisor; Guy Carpenter, the risk and reinsurance specialist; Mercer, the provider of HR and related financial advice and services; and Oliver Wyman, the management consultancy. With over 81,000 colleagues advise clients in 130 countries and annual revenue of nearly $19 billion, Marsh & McLennan Companies provides analysis, advice and transactional capabilities to clients in more than 130 countries. Its stock (ticker symbol: MMC) is listed on the New York, Chicago and London stock exchanges.
Marsh & McLennan Companies offers competitive salaries and comprehensive benefits and programs including health and welfare, tuition assistance, 401K, employee assistance program, domestic partnership benefits, career mobility, employee network groups, volunteer opportunities, and other programs. For more information about our company, please visit us at: www.mmc.com. We embrace a culture that celebrates and promotes the many backgrounds, heritages and perspectives of our colleagues and clients. For more information, please visit us at: www.mmc.com/diversity. Marsh McLennan and its Affiliates are EOE Minority/Female/Disability/Vet/Sexual Orientation/Gender Identity employers.
The base pay offered will be determined on factors such as experience, skills, training, location, certifications, education, and any applicable minimum wage requirements. Decisions will be determined on a case-by-case basis. In addition to the base salary, this position may be eligible for performance-based incentives.
We are excited to offer a competitive total rewards package which includes health and welfare benefits, tuition assistance, 401K savings and other retirement programs as well as employee assistance programs.

description:
The University Design Institute (UDI) partners with universities, higher education systems, philanthropic organizations and national governments to co-design new strategies for higher education. We are seeking a passionate, driven and agile Project Manager to join our dynamic team at UDI. This key role will lead the operational, logistics and event management efforts for our expanding portfolio of programs with a focus on our newly developing global Design Clinics. These immersive, executive programs will provide participants with the context, tools and deeper understanding needed to advance their institution forward in topics critical to higher education. By joining UDI, you will have the unique opportunity to shape the future of higher education globally. To date, UDI has worked with 120+ institutions across 24 countries.

The ideal candidate will:
Operationally manage the design and development process for the Design Clinics, working with a network of experts.
Deliver exceptional, end-to-end participant experience through high-end, high-touch efforts from registration management, participant management, event management during each Design Clinic event and post-program efforts.
Develop clear and scalable processes to support program growth globally.
The ideal candidate is a(n):
Detailed Project Manager: Ability to oversee all aspects of program planning, from initial concept to final execution, ensuring timelines and budgets are met.
Relationship Manager: Ability to build and maintain strong relationships with clients, vendors, sponsors and others, ensuring their needs are met and partnerships are beneficial.
Strategic Planner: Expertise in developing long-term strategies to align objectives with organizational goals and drive successful outcomes.
Detailed Budget Manager: Proficiency in creating and managing budgets, negotiating contracts and optimizing resources to deliver high-quality events within financial constraints.
Persuasive Communicator: Excellent written and verbal communication skills for coordinating with vendors, clients and teams, and for delivering clear, persuasive presentations.
Adaptive Problem Solver: Quick and effective decision-making to address and resolve unexpected challenges during the planning and execution phases. Flexibility to adapt to changing circumstances and requirements, often in fast-paced or high-pressure environments.
The ideal candidate has:
Experience working with global clients with emphasis on executive audiences.
Experience advancing scalable project management strategies for newly developing executive education style programs.
Rich experience working in diverse delivery models (in-person, hybrid, zoom, etc.).
Experience seamlessly blending efficient and effective event operations with high-end stakeholder management.
Experience navigating a variety of cultures and structures across all levels of hierarchy.
This position is based on-site at UDI’s ASU SkySong offices, located in Scottsdale, Arizona. The role will report to the Executive Director, Services.

Visual acuity and manual dexterity associated with daily use of desktop computer; bending, stooping, reaching and lifting up to 20 pounds. Ability to clearly communicate verbally in English, read, write, see and hear to perform essential duties. Regular review of completed tasks.
Department Statement
Established in 2019, The University Design Institute at Arizona State University advances innovation and design in higher education around the globe. Higher education has a fundamental responsibility to improve human and planetary wellbeing, and UDI’s vision is to support universities and institutions of higher education to emerge as powerful engines of social and economic impact.

We are a values-driven organization with a focus on 6 critical values.
Intentional Inclusionists: We create an environment of trust, support, acceptance and safety to foster a sense of belonging and wellbeing.
Eternal Optimists: Change is an opportunity for progress, so we tirelessly work to co-create solutions to transform higher education.
Avid Learners: We embrace curiosity and an exploratory mindset to promote individual and institutional growth.
Constructive Challengers: We commit to challenge processes and perspectives in a supportive environment to push towards continuous improvement.
Collaborative Connectors: Through a culture of collaboration, we weave together a community of problem-solvers to move from ideas to implementation.
Relentless Innovators: We fail forward, take risks, and move quickly to craft solutions with purpose.
ASU Statement
Arizona State University is a new model for American higher education, an unprecedented combination of academic excellence, entrepreneurial energy and broad access. This New American University is a single, unified institution comprising four differentiated campuses positively impacting the economic, social, cultural and environmental health of the communities it serves. Its research is inspired by real world application blurring the boundaries that traditionally separate academic disciplines. ASU serves more than 100,000 students in metropolitan Phoenix, Arizona, the nation's fifth largest city. ASU champions intellectual and cultural diversity, and welcomes students from all fifty states and more than one hundred nations across the globe.

ASU is a tobacco-free university. For details visit https://wellness.asu.edu/explore-wellness/body/alcohol-and-drugs/tobacco

ASU conducts pre-employment screening for all positions which includes a criminal background check, verification of work history, academic credentials, licenses, and certifications. Employment is contingent upon successful passing of the background check.

description:
Summary

Posted: Aug 8, 2024

Role Number:200560136

Imagine what you could do here! Do you care about how products perform, what makes them delightful yet keeps them safe and user-friendly in the deepest sense? Do you ever consider what care and intention put into Apple’s product design allows us to uphold user trust and confidence? The engineering team in Apple’s cutting-edge PACE (Product Analysis & Certification Engineering) group is responsible for ensuring our products meet international Product Safety, Environmental, EMC, and Regulatory standards and regulations, but also exceed those requirements to befit Apple’s expectations. We’re looking for a talented professional and seasoned leader who enjoys tackling tough challenges, managing engineering issues, and leading engineers in a fast-paced and demanding product development climate. We’re looking for bright, hungry people who care about the user experience and upholding the highest standards of product integrity. The PACE Senior Engineering Project Manager (EPM) is a highly visible role with company-wide impact. You will be regularly leading reviews with cross functional VP’s on key upcoming standards and regulations impacting Apple’s business. To achieve this, you will drive alignment across the Product Safety, Environmental, EMC, and Regulatory Teams while ensuring the standards and regulations for each are up to date. You will work closely with internal engineering teams and senior managers to ensure our products meet the highest international and Apple-specified requirements. If this sound like a perfect fit, and a challenge built for you, then read on!

Description

- You will drive and track Product Safety, Environmental, EMC, and Regulatory standards / regulations and their impact to Apple’s business. - You will develop, refine and uphold project schedules needed to ensure the continued development of our internal regulatory tracker. - You will oversee issue and priority management efforts among EPMs to drive data-driven decisions impacting product integrity. - You will be responsible for communicating and delivering briefings and updates to senior engineering management and executives to enable rapid decision-making within Apple’s product development life cycle. - You will be working closely with cross-functional engineering and operations teams to develop plans to ensure compliance to required standards and regulations. - Manage key project management collaborative, tracking, and communications tools and systems; administer effective use of those systems to ensure established processes are followed. - Continually innovate in EPM process improvements and ensure the highest levels of project execution and rigor.
Exceptional program/project manager with impeccable organizational skills and attention to details, with at least 7 years of experience.
Demonstrated skills in project management tools, schedule development/management, and leadership experience.
You possess strong technical intuition and understanding of basic engineering concepts with ability to grasp complex design and process problems, while distilling them to their barest essences.
Proven ability to work cross-functionally, harness the powers of teamwork, and relate to myriad technical partners.
Highly effective communicator, using both in spoken and written forms; sharp interpersonal skills who understand how to communicate across varied audiences in a climate of debate.
Sound executive presence with the strong ability to communicate at the senior leadership levels.
Strong hunger factor and courageous spirit with a proclivity towards action and creative problem-solving.
Calm under fire, high resilience and interest in complex problem-solving within a challenging and fast-paced environment.
Ability to travel unrestricted, up to 10% of the time. Our work requires periodic travels to address anticipated (and unanticipated) project demands.
HW EPM experience, launching products, and driving new product development cycles.
B.S. in Engineering or Technical degree

Preferred Qualifications
M.S. or PhD in Engineering or Technical degree with 7+ years of experience in a related field or industry.
Experience in international and/or regional Product Safety, Environmental, EMC, and Regulatory standards/regulations, and/or government affairs are a big plus.

Pay & Benefits
At Apple, base pay is one part of our total compensation package and is determined within a range. This provides the opportunity to progress as you grow and develop within a role. The base pay range for this role is between $165,500 and $293,800, and your base pay will depend on your skills, qualifications, experience, and location. Apple employees also have the opportunity to become an Apple shareholder through participation in Apple’s discretionary employee stock programs. Apple employees are eligible for discretionary restricted stock unit awards, and can purchase Apple stock at a discount if voluntarily participating in Apple’s Employee Stock Purchase Plan. You’ll also receive benefits including: Comprehensive medical and dental coverage, retirement benefits, a range of discounted products and free services, and for formal education related to advancing your career at Apple, reimbursement for certain educational expenses - including tuition. Additionally, this role might be eligible for discretionary bonuses or commission payments as well as relocation. Learn more about Apple Benefits. Note: Apple benefit, compensation and employee stock programs are subject to eligibility requirements and other terms of the applicable plan or program.

More
Apple is an equal opportunity employer that is committed to inclusion and diversity. We take affirmative action to ensure equal opportunity for all applicants without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, Veteran status, or other legally protected characteristics. Learn more about your EEO rights as an applicant.

description:
This is a full-time temporary, benefit-based position with an anticipated end date of June 30, 2025. The appointment is renewable at the discretion of the University and dependent upon performance and continued funding.
This is an exciting opportunity to expand our current Pactful programs and spearhead new initiatives. The Pactful Project Manager at the Jacobs Institute for Innovation in Education at the University of San Diego oversees strategic planning, growth, and the meaningful implementation of academic leadership and operational support for Pactful's professional and student learning programs. We are seeking agile candidates with an innovator and entrepreneurial mindset, a learner-centered focus, and an emphasis on team and partnership development, along with a background in building and scaling inclusive and innovative educational programs.
Duties and Responsibilities:
Leadership of Pactful’s Core Services and Programs
Manage, implement and oversee the Pactful Team on the design, implementation and evaluation of high quality Pactful initiatives, including the annual Jacobs Teen Innovation Challenge, ImPactful Teen Innovation Sandbox and Bootcamp experiences, Social Innovation teacher engagement opportunities, and other emerging Pactful initiatives.
Work closely with the Executive Director and Assistant Director of Finance and Administration on annual goals and objectives, projections, staffing, and budgeting for Pactful initiatives.
Actively pursue grant and contract funding opportunities from foundations and organizations to support the development of Pactful initiatives.
Initially focus on the current priorities, including:
Develop and implement a strategy for Pactful's newly developed Spanish program and its expansion to Mexico and other Latin American regions.
Establish a framework to scale the ImPactful Teen Innovation Sandbox and Bootcamp programs to other schools and school districts.
Team Leadership, Training, and Mentoring
Coordinate hiring and recruitment of Pactful Team members.
Oversee performance development cycles, conduct goal-setting, coaching, and annual reviews.
Encourage a culture of innovation and provide ongoing mentoring, feedback, recognition and professional development opportunities to build the collective capacity of the organization.
Plan and facilitate regular, collaborative team meetings.
Strategic Partnerships and Development
Establish a national footprint for the Pactful team through attendance at conferences and industry events.
Engage SOLES and other USD faculty, staff, and students in Pactful initiatives.
Stay current with professional readings and research in relevant fields.
Maintain and cultivate relationships within University of San Diego and with other key educational partners, such as the San Diego County Office of Education, San Diego Unified School District, community organizations, industry experts, and relevant local leaders, as well as international representatives.
Identify relevant grants, prepare comprehensive grant applications, and manage the grant lifecycle, from submission to reporting.
Explore creative funding strategies such as public-private partnerships, impact investing, and philanthropy to diversify the institute's revenue streams and support new program development.
Cultivate partnerships with philanthropic foundations and organizations that share the institute's mission, seeking financial support and collaboration opportunities to launch new educational initiatives.
Jacobs Institute Leadership and Engagement
Provide regular updates to the Jacobs Institute team.
Serve on Jacobs Institute, SOLES, and/or University committees as assigned.
Represent the Institute professionally in all activities.
Collaborate with other team members to advance the work of the Jacobs Institute.
Contribute to, facilitate and/or participate in community engagement activities as part of the Jacobs Institute team.
Research and Advancement
Regularly evaluate, develop and enhance Pactful programs, models, resources, materials, and frameworks through inclusive best practices in feedback and research.
Collaborate with the Research and Evaluation team to evaluate the impact of Pactful initiatives and engage in research to advance knowledge.
Identify and integrate relevant emerging technologies into Pactful and related programs.
Communications and Dissemination
Oversee effective communication, including storytelling, of Pactful initiatives.
Collaborate with USD, SOLES, and Institute communications staff to increase visibility of Pactful projects.
Support recruitment of educators and student participants for Pactful initiatives.
Support the creation of newsletters to keep educators and other members of the Pactful community informed.
Create and participate in webinars and podcasts as part of the programming and engagement.
Oversee social media updates and ensure the website is current with the latest Pactful activities.
Research and disseminate insights from Pactful with the wider educational community through published articles, conference participation, reports, white papers, and speaking sessions, contributing to the advancement of educational innovation and technology.
Special Conditions of Employment:
Effective June 1, 2023, based on CDC guidance, the University strongly encourages all campus members to stay up to date with Influenza and COVID-19 vaccination recommendations. For more regarding information USD's COVID-19 protocols, please visit sandiego.edu/onward.
Occasional early mornings, evenings, or weekend work hours.
Approximately 10% regional, national, or international travel.
Background check: Successful completion of a pre-employment background check.
Degree Verification Requirement: Persons offered employment in this position will be required to provide official education transcripts for degree verification purposes.
Job Requirements:
Minimum Qualifications:
Belief that today’s teenagers, when provided access to innovation culture, tools, and entrepreneurial experiences, can literally change the world.
Master’s or PhD degree in education, social innovation, educational technology, learning sciences, or a related field.
Experience in K-12 education, curriculum development, and implementation of innovative programming.
Demonstrated ability to develop and write professional publications, training materials, grants, and reports.
Experience with public speaking, presenting, and engaging diverse audiences of various social, cultural, economic and educational backgrounds.
Proven ability to collaborate effectively with diverse teams, including educators, designers, developers, and administrators.
Adaptability to evolving technologies and trends in the EdTech landscape.
Excellent interpersonal communication and project management skills.
Must be responsive, team-oriented, reliable, and detail-oriented.
Experience resolving complex problems in a dynamic, collaborative work environment.
Preferred Qualifications:
2-3 years of leadership experience developing and scaling educational programs in higher education.
Experience implementing educational programs with current and emerging technologies such as virtual reality, AI, etc.
Knowledge of current learner-centered models, online and blended programs, and transformative technology practices in K-higher ed environments.
Knowledge of K-12 education policies and practices.
In-depth knowledge of national and international professional learning market conditions and ability to determine strategic education sectors.
Successful grant-writing experience.
Entrepreneurial experience.
Spanish fluency.
Posting Salary:
$6,000-7,000 per month; Excellent Benefits

The University of San Diego offers a very competitive benefits package including; medical, dental, vision, a retirement contribution given to you by the University, and access to on-campus Fitness Centers. Please visit the benefits section of our website to view all of the perks and benefits that USD has to offer.
The salary range provided in this posting reflects what we reasonably expect to pay for this position. Actual compensation offered or earned is dependent on experience, education and other factors including departmental budget.
Special Application Instructions:
Resume and Cover Letter Required
Click the 'Apply Now' button to complete our online application. In addition, please upload a cover letter and resume to your application profile for the hiring managers’ review. If you have any questions or difficulties please contact the Employment Services Team at jobs@sandiego.edu.

description:
Job Title: Project Manager
PVN ID: LA-2409-006440
Category: Managerial and Professional
Location: LAGUARDIA C. C.
Status: Full Time
Annual Salary: $130,000.00 - $160,000.00
Hour(s) a Week: 35
Closing Date: Oct 18, 2024 (Or Until Filled)
LaGuardia Community College/CUNY is seeking a Project Manager to oversee the development of the Cohen Career Collective, a new vocational education facility that requires the renovation of approximately 160,000 square feet of vacant industrial space in Long Island City, Queens.
The Cohen Career Collective will be a state-of-the-art workforce training center at LaGuardia Community College. Made possible by a historic gift of $116.2 million from the Steven & Alexandra Cohen Foundation, the facility will include specialized shops, labs, and classrooms for hands-on instruction and training. It will also have quiet study areas, student meeting rooms, a Career Services Center, computer labs, a lecture hall, storage areas for equipment and materials, restrooms, locker rooms, mechanical rooms, electrical/data closets, and a Student Welcome Center.
Education and training programs at the Cohen Career Collective will lead to associate degrees, industry certifications, and other credentials required for jobs in high-demand sectors, including Healthcare, Construction, Technology, Culinary & Hospitality, Green Jobs, and Film and Television. Comprehensive student support services will be available. In addition to career and technical training, the Cohen Career Collective will provide English for Speakers of Other Languages (ESOL) classes for students who need to improve their English before taking vocational training. High-school equivalency classes will be offered to ensure that trainees obtain their GEDs. Construction of the facility is anticipated to be completed by January 2029.
Duties and Responsibilities
Reporting to the College President and Senior Vice President of Administration and Finance, the Project Manager will oversee the development of the Cohen Career Collective. Responsibilities may include, but are not limited to:
· Serve as liaison between college leadership and key project stakeholders. Manage project governance/decision-making process and procedures.
· Ensure proactive engagement of faculty in project planning and development.
· Identify and engage employer partners in project planning and development.
· Develop and issue RFPs, manage solicitation of bids, and lead procurement of and contracting for project consultants and contractors.
· Coordinate with government agencies, including CUNY, DASNY, and NYC DOB, architects, engineers, expeditors, construction managers, contractors, subcontractors, owner’s reps, and others to ensure project objectives are met on time and within budget.
· Provide proactive oversight to minimize change orders and ensure that construction is undertaken properly and within agreed-upon budget and timelines.
· Establish insurance and indemnification policies and procedures.
· Work closely with LaGuardia administrators to minimize disruption to academic and administrative operations of the college.
· Oversee project budget, expense management, and financial reporting.
· Provide regular progress reports to college leadership and stakeholders, including, as needed, budget updates, construction schedules, and other milestones of project delivery.
· Review, verify, and approve contractor progress billings.
· Provide cash flow forecasting and processing of payment requests.
· Review commissioning, quality assurance, and quality control in collaboration with the college’s Facilities Management team.
· Coordinate site tours as needed for project constituents, end users, and others.
· Manage project-related documents, including contracts, insurance, budgets, construction documents, change order logs, weekly status reports, project meeting minutes, etc.
· Facilitate field visits and construction document reviews in anticipation of substantial completion and start- up operation.
Other Duties
Perform other duties as assigned.
Qualifications
· Education: Bachelor’s degree in construction management or architecture or engineering preferred.
· 10+ years relevant work experience in construction/project management.
· Experience with construction contract administration.
· Experience with Prevailing Wage and/or PLA requirements of public work projects.
· Knowledge of relevant construction practices.
· Experience in managing projects with multiple stakeholders.
· Excellent verbal and written communication skills.
· Strong proficiency in Excel, MSWord, MS Project, PowerPoint, Outlook, and other relevant information platforms and systems.
About LaGuardia Community College
LaGuardia Community College is one of seven community colleges of the City University of New York/CUNY. LaGuardia offers more than 60 associate degree and certificate programs. Upon graduation most students transfer to four-year colleges, typically in CUNY, to complete their baccalaureate degrees. Graduates of career programs such as Nursing, Computer Technology, and Veterinary Technology enter the workforce.
In 2022, LaGuardia served over 23,000 students in pre-college, associate degree, and continuing education programs. More than one-third of LaGuardia students are foreign-born. They come from 130 countries and speak 54 heritage languages. More than half (54 percent) are first-generation college students. Virtually all students are ethnic minorities (88 percent), 57 percent are women, 29 percent are over the age of 25. Forty- eight percent of LaGuardia students are Hispanic, almost double the threshold of 25 percent required by the US Department of Education for designation as a Hispanic-Serving Institution (HSI). Seventy-three percent of LaGuardia students receive some form of government financial aid.
How to Apply
All application must be submitted via the Research Foundation’s website at https://www.rfcuny.org. Please visit https://www.rfcuny.org/careers/postings?pvnID=LA-2409-006440 to apply for this position directly.
Please select the “Apply” button located under the Action Menu and follow the instructions on how to submit your documents.

401(k)

Paid time off

Monday to Friday

description:
Calling all innovators – find your future at Fiserv.
We’re Fiserv, a global leader in Fintech and payments, and we move money and information in a way that moves the world. We connect financial institutions, corporations, merchants, and consumers to one another millions of times a day – quickly, reliably, and securely. Any time you swipe your credit card, pay through a mobile app, or withdraw money from the bank, we’re involved. If you want to make an impact on a global scale, come make a difference at Fiserv.
Job Title
Senior Project Manager
What does a successful Senior Project Manager do at Fiserv?
You will own the execution of initiatives across the Bank of America relationship, including product end-of-life and compliance updates. You’ll own the client and stakeholder experience and ensure operational readiness is implemented, executing the changes needed to complete the project.
What you will do:
Lead the planning, execution, and tracking of activities, decisions, risks, and issues associated with the business project for a given work stream and/or client product customizations in a fast-paced, start-up like environment.
Follow up with business work stream leads to ensure that action items have resolution, risks and issues are captured and escalated, and that regular status is provided to executives.
Keep all stakeholders (internal & external) engaged in the project, aligned on expected outcomes and informed about what is occurring throughout project.
Work effectively with Product, Marketing, Technology project management and Client Services teams as well as Fiserv and Bank of America cross organizational areas, including account management and sales, to ensure readiness.
Draft internal & client communication and training materials partnering with Bank of America to execute per their direction.
Represent Fiserv and Bank of America in client facing interactions to prepare for client impacting activities.
What you will need to have:
Minimum 5 years’ experience in merchant services industry
Consulting experience including experience creating or editing executive level presentations
Ability to travel 10%-15%
Experience working with a banking, financial services, and/or technology/vendor firm
Experience standing up and managing Microsoft Teams and SharePoint
What would be great to have:
Professional Certifications a plus, such as PMP, Six Sigma
Bachelor’s degree
Experience driving efforts as well as experience coordinating resources in a matrix organization.
Salary Range
$77,000.00 - $137,500.00
These pay ranges apply to employees in Colorado, Hawaii, Nevada, Rhode Island and Washington. Pay ranges for employees in other states may differ. Certain Positions are Commissions eligible.
Thank you for considering employment with Fiserv. Please:
Apply using your legal name
Complete the step-by-step profile and attach your resume (either is acceptable, both are preferable).
What you should know about us:
Fiserv is a global leader in payments and financial technology with more than 40,000 associates proudly serving clients in more than 100 countries. As one of Fortune® magazine's "World's Most Admired Companies™" 9 of the last 10 years, one of Fast Company’s Most Innovative Companies, and a top scorer on Bloomberg’s Gender-Equality Index, we are committed to innovation and excellence.
Our commitment to Diversity and Inclusion:
Fiserv is an Equal Opportunity Employer, and we welcome and encourage diversity in our workforce that reflects our world. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, protected veteran status, or any other category protected by law.
We will ensure that individuals with disabilities are provided reasonable accommodation to participate in the job application or interview process, to perform essential job functions, and to receive other benefits and privileges of employment. Please contact us to request accommodation.
Warning about fake job posts:
Please be aware of fraudulent job postings that are not affiliated with Fiserv. Fraudulent job postings may be used by cyber criminals to target your personally identifiable information and/or to steal money or financial information.
Any communications from a Fiserv representative will come from a legitimate business email address. We will not hire through text message, social media, or email alone, and any interviews will be conducted in person or through a secure video call. We won’t ask you for sensitive information nor will we ask you to pay anything during the hiring process. We also won’t send you a check to cash on Fiserv’s behalf.
If you see suspicious activity or believe that you have been the victim of a job posting scam, you should report it to your local FBI field office or to the FBI’s Internet Crime Complaint Center.

description:

ABOUT THIS POSITION

Over 48 million passengers traveled through Phoenix Sky Harbor International Airport (PHX) in 2023, one of the busiest airports in the country in the nation's 5th largest city. Sky Harbor is the largest of three airports in the Phoenix Airport System (Phoenix Sky Harbor, Deer Valley, and Goodyear airports) which is manage and operated by the City of Phoenix Aviation Department and has an annual economic impact of $44.3 billion.
The Aviation Department has a vacancy for an Airline Affairs Project Manager position. This position manages the business relationships with airlines serving Phoenix. The Project Manager (PM) position will have ownership of managing the development, execution, and oversite of airline Letters of Authorization (LOA), International Facility License Agreements (IFLA), and other business agreements governing those relationships. This position is responsible for the completion of lease agreements or lease amendments as they relate to the airline tenants; day-to-day management of airline tenant relations; inspection of tenant leased spaces; coordination of tenant work orders and tenant improvement projects; and tenant contract compliance oversight and monitoring for insurance, bonds, letters of credit, rental adjustments, and reporting requirements.
The Airline Affairs Project Manager role is a professional position requiring interpersonal skills, business writing skills, critical thinking, financial and statistical data interpretation, contract leasing negotiation experience, and a willingness to work directly and collaborate with co-workers to identify solutions to complex challenges. The selected candidate will be required to function in a fast-paced airport business environment, handling a variety of projects concurrently, and with a high degree of tenant interaction.
This position is responsible for:
Hosting tenant meetings.
Reviewing monthly reports.
Inspection of tenant leased spaces.
Processing tenant account billing invoices.
Day-to-day management of airline tenant relations.
Coordination of tenant work orders and tenant improvement projects.
Research, evaluate, develop, and recommend new revenue opportunities.
Coordinating with other Aviation divisions to facilitate the onboarding of new airlines.
Completion of lease agreements or lease amendments as they relate to the airline tenants.
Tenant contract compliance oversight and monitoring for insurance, bonds, letters of credit, rental adjustments, and reporting requirements.
Conducting industry benchmarking, developing solicitation documents, and collaborating with tenants and internal stakeholders to implement new services, and programs.
IDEAL CANDIDATE
Knowledge of FAA air traffic management policies, airport and airline business principles, and procedures.
Proficient with Microsoft Office 365.
Excellent communication and writing skills.
Strong decision-making skills and effective at problem solving and negotiating resolutions.
Ability to develop consensus around complex issues and situations.
Ability to compile financial analysis, conduct research, summarize surveys.
Ability to develop clear and effective reports and presentations to diverse audiences.
Ability to use research methods, data and statistical analysis, and benchmarking to develop business decisions.
Ability to develop and maintain effective working relationships with employees, business partners, tenants, customers, and representatives of governmental agencies.
SALARY

description:
Committed to providing life insurance solutions since 1969 in the United States and globally since 1975, Citizens, Inc. is a publicly traded company (NYSE: CIA) that has maintained a listing on the New York Stock Exchange since 2002. Operating through our insurance subsidiaries, we strategically offer traditional insurance products in niche markets to capitalize on competitive advantages. With a dedicated team of employees located in Austin, Louisiana and a global network of agents, our reach extends to Latin America, Central America, and Asia.
THE OPPORTUNITY
Title: Senior Project Manager
Job Type : Full-time Exempt
Reports to : VP of Strategy & Analytics
Location : Austin, TX (Corporate Headquarters located in the Domain)
At Citizens, Inc., we've curated an exceptional work environment that goes beyond the ordinary. Our open-plan workspace offers panoramic views of the Domain with multiple conference rooms readily available. Start your day with complimentary coffee in our large break area, enjoy walks on the scenic trails nearby, or hit our onsite gym. Our Lunch Drop service provides the luxury of delivering delicious meals directly to our suite for a stress-free lunch break. For financial needs, the onsite bank is at your service. Furthermore, enjoy the convenience of free covered parking in our garage, featuring charging stations for electric vehicles. Participate in our various monthly employee events designed to enhance our cultural engagement. At Citizens Inc., we prioritize strong employee involvement to foster a dynamic workplace culture. Elevate your career with us, where your workplace is more than just an office; it's a destination for growth, innovation, and a flourishing community.
Summary: Citizens Inc. seeks a motivated and high-performing individual to join our team as the Senior Project Manager. This position requires the employee to work quickly with great attention to detail. The Senior Project Manager reports directly to the VP of Strategy & Analytics and is located at the corporate headquarters in the Domain. The Senior Project Manager will develop and coordinate people and processes to ensure that our projects are delivered on time and produce desired results. The Senior Project Manager will be responsible for time management, planning and designating resources, monitoring the progress, and keeping stakeholders informed throughout the life cycle of each corporate project.
WHAT YOU WILL GET TO DO
Project Planning and Initiation
Determine and define project scope and objectives
Predict resources needed to reach objectives and manage resources in an effective and efficient manner
Project Execution
Develop and manage a detailed project schedule and work plan
Utilize industry best practices, techniques, and standards throughout the entire project execution
Stakeholder Management
Provide project updates consistently to various stakeholders about strategy, adjustments, and progress
Project Monitoring and Control
Monitor progress and adjust as needed
Measure project performance to identify areas for improvement
Post-Project Evaluation
Provide postproduction retrospectives on all projects
WHAT YOU NEED TO SUCCEED
Bachelor's degree in Marketing, Business, or related field or equivalent experience
7-10 years of project management and related experience
Proven ability to solve problems creatively
Advanced proficiency with project management software tools, methodologies, and best practices
Advanced proficiency in Microsoft Office Suite, specifically Project, Visio, and PowerPoint.
Advanced experience seeing projects through the full life cycle
Communicating strategy effectively throughout the company.
Ensuring suitable metrics are in place to measure performance and progress.
Monitoring execution of business initiatives.
Proven ability to complete projects according to outlined scope, budget, and timeline
Preferred Qualifications:
Project Management Professional (PMP) certification
Advanced knowledge of SharePoint
Insurance experience preferred.
Knowledge, Skills & Abilities:
Ability to effectively prioritize and execute tasks in a fast-paced environment
Demonstrates ownership and dedication
Active listening skills
Strong problem-solving skills with creative mindset
Good verbal and written communication skills
Ability to identify critical issues quickly and accurately
Ability to collaborate and interact effectively with internal & external stakeholders
BENEFITS (the fun stuff)
As an employee of Citizens, we promise you the opportunity to make a meaningful difference in the lives of our customers, communities, and one another. We believe in fostering a culture of camaraderie, where your ideas are valued, and collaborative efforts drive innovation. Our commitment to rewarding work extends beyond professional growth to recognize your individual contributions and achievements.
We take a complete approach to our employees' well-being. Our benefits package includes medical, dental, vision, short-term and long-term disability, AD&D, group term life insurance, and a matching 401k to secure your financial future. Our benefits plan allows for Virtual Visits and access to our Employee Assistance Program, showcasing our commitment to your health and work-life balance. Enjoy the added perks of generous Paid Time Off and holidays, ensuring you have the time to recharge and savor life outside of work. Join us and embrace a workplace that values not only your professional growth but also your personal fulfillment.
At Citizens, our employees and customers are at the heart of everything we do. Our success as a company begins with our team of employees and departments to service our customers. That's why we strive to create an environment where employees are equipped and challenged to reach their full potential.
Citizens is an equal opportunity employer. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, color, religion, sex, gender identity, national origin, age, disability, or veteran status. We are committed to fostering a diverse and inclusive workplace where every individual is valued, and all qualified applicants are encouraged to apply.
title: Project Manager

description:
Overview:
Steampunk is seeking a Senior Project Manager who is technical, creative, and a hands-on expert in delivering innovative technology solutions. Ideal candidates will thrive working with clients in a consultative capacity. We are committed to delivering high-quality, innovative solutions that meet our clients' needs. Our team is focused on continuous improvement, agile delivery, and creating value in every project we undertake. This role is crucial in leading project teams, managing complex IT projects, and integrating Agile and Lean principles into our work. The ideal candidate will not only coach and guide teams but may also be hands-on in driving project success.

Contributions:
As a Senior Project Manager, you will ensure that the project teams maintain a strong focus on quality and continuous delivery while providing clear visibility into project targets, commitments, and progress.

Ensures team(s) maintain focus on quality and continuous delivery
Provides visibility into delivery targets, commitments, and progress
Creates roadmaps and milestone charts for the project
Be well managed – understand and coach the team on delivery controls, compliance to minimize operational and reputational risk
Proactively identifies impediments and appropriately resolves using a network of peers and formal channels (including escalation if required)
Integrates Agile and Lean principles into team practices and work product
Coaches Product Owner and team on backlog refinement and prioritization
Coaches the team to improve collaboration and self-organization
Utilizes team feedback and metrics (quality, delivery rate, etc.) to identify areas of opportunity and works with the team to continuously improve
Assesses the current organization and delivery environment and recommends optimal Agile practices tailored to the client
Innovates with practices and frameworks through experimentation to improve the team and their delivery
Develops understanding and encouragement of team’s innovation and improvement
Prepares and delivers effective communications both verbally and in writing regarding progress and status for both internal and client teams
Performs hands-on project work, including analysis, design, and change management, as needed by the project
Understands domain architecture and targets to identify upstream and downstream dependencies and to support the team in risk management.
Qualifications:
Required
Master's degree in a related program and 8 years of experience; OR
Bachelors degree in a related program and 10 years of relevant experience; OR
No degree and 16 years of relevant experience
12+ years managing IT projects using Agile methodologies and approaches; proven background in consulting and project management
Possesses at least one professional certification relevant to the technical service provided.
Preferred
Ability to establish immediate credibility with clients, build consensus, and achieve goals through influence
Ability to help teams write user stories/epics, identify dependencies, and design optimal solutions
Flexibility to work with teams, individuals, and executives and willingness to help with a wide variety of work products and people
Demonstrated ability to influence and consult while providing thought leadership to sponsors/stakeholders in solving governance, program/project management, business process and/or technical problems
Excellent communication skills (both written and verbal) with strong presentation and facilitation skills
PMP certification preferred
Strong organizational and analytical skills
About steampunk:

Steampunk relies on several factors to determine salary, including but not limited to geographic location, contractual requirements, education, knowledge, skills, competencies, and experience. The projected compensation range for this position is $150,000 to $190,000. The estimate displayed represents a typical annual salary range for this position. Annual salary is just one aspect of Steampunk’s total compensation package for employees. Learn more about additional Steampunk benefits here.

Steampunk is a Change Agent in the Federal contracting industry, bringing new thinking to clients in the Homeland, Federal Civilian, Health and DoD sectors. Through our Human-Centered delivery methodology, we are fundamentally changing the expectations our Federal clients have for true shared accountability in solving their toughest mission challenges. As an employee owned company, we focus on investing in our employees to enable them to do the greatest work of their careers – and rewarding them for outstanding contributions to our growth. If you want to learn more about our story, visit http://www.steampunk.com.

We are an equal opportunity employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, disability status, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law. Steampunk participates in the E-Verify program.

description:

A clear understanding of your background and work history will help us potentially place you in a position that meets your objectives and those of the organization. KHS reasonably expects to pay starting compensation for the position of Project Manager III in the range of $85,757- 110,808 annual.
About us

Kern Health Systems is dedicated to improving the health status of our members through an integrated managed health care delivery system.

** Hybrid Position**

General Purpose: Under the direct supervision of the Project Management Manager, the Project Manager III manages multiple medium to large-scale projects and can drive a large-scale program with multiple project tracks.

Duties: Accountable for on time, on budget and on scope delivery of medium to large concurrent projects over their entire life cycle (initiate, plan, execute, control, close). Expected to have a mastery of advanced project management skills and the ability to mentor others. Expected to train Project Manager Peers in core competencies and department Project Leads in simplified and tailored project management skills.

Responsibilities:
Adheres to and internally promotes the standardized project management and Agile methodologies.
Collaboratively works with project owners to create project proposals that establish projects goals and define anticipated benefits.
Facilitates, directs and manages the project team in the creation of project artifacts including the project charter, scope statement, requirements, work breakdown structure, resource loaded schedule, budget, communication plans, RAID log, etc.
Works with resource managers to coordinate resources efficiently to ensure project milestones are met.
Identifies potential risks and develop mitigation strategies to ensure project success.
Monitors and controls the execution of the project to the successful delivery of the scope, schedule, budget, goals and benefits of the project.
Drives team and stakeholder communications for all projects and presents effective report outs for stakeholders.
Builds, develops and nurtures business and technical relationships vital to the success of the project.
Collaboratively creates Return on Investment (ROI) models with project owners or stakeholders and establish operational ROI tracking.
Mentor project managers in all aspects of project management including leadership and methodology.
Effectively creates training materials and educates PM peers in core competencies of the project management profession.
Drives team resolution for problems.
Drives project change impacts assessments.
Conducts project-related presentations at varying audience levels (based on Business needs) and demonstrates a mastery for presentations at higher leadership levels.
Effectively drives Discovery activities (with Agile methods applied) for decomposition of work breakdown at the Leadership and Team levels. Can mentor project managers in all aspects of Discovery skill sets.
Identifies opportunities for process improvements and implements best practices.
Other relevant duties as assigned.

Large Project

Any Duration

Moderate to Extremely Aggressive Timeline

All risk levels

Span of Impact within organization:
Enterprise

Up to 10

Many
Additional Requirements

Qualifications:
Project Management Professional (PMP®) within 1 year of hire or internal transfer

Education and experience:
Bachelor’s degree in Business Management or other related business field from an accredited college or university, AND five (5) years of project management experience;
OR
Seven years of project management experience.

Other: Possession of a valid California Drivers’ License and proof of valid State required liability insurance. Required Travel up to 10%

title: Project Manager

description:
JOB SUMMARY
The Project Manager oversees and leads the execution of client onboarding and engineering projects while managing communication and coordination among the project team, the client and vendors. Ensure that the project is completed on time, within scope, and within budget, while managing resources, risks, and communication among stakeholders. This position also evaluates and approves changes that substantially impact the scope, budget, or schedule of projects.
ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS
Develop comprehensive project plans outlining key milestones, deliverables and timelines, resources, and risk management strategies.
Lead cross-functional project teams comprising of consultants, technical experts, and client stakeholders to execute project objectives effectively and efficiently.
Serve as the primary point of contact and liaison between the client, internal team members, and external stakeholders throughout the project lifecycle process.
Assign tasks and monitor progress to ensure project milestones are met.
Performs risk management to minimize project risks.
Uses project management tools to track project performance and schedule adherence.
Provide feedback, guidance, and support to team members.
Communicate project progress, risks, issues, and timelines effectively to stakeholders.
Prepare and present status reports, including detailed project updates, to executive management.
Manage project budgets, ensuring costs are tracked and aligned with project forecasts.
Allocate resources efficiently and reallocate as necessary to meet project needs.
Coordinate with procurement for the acquisition of tools, software, and third-party services.
Meet financial objectives by forecasting requirements, preparing an annual budget, scheduling expenditures, analyzing variances and initiating corrective actions.
Ensure successful project handoff to operational teams and assist with post-project support if necessary.
Conduct post-project reviews to evaluate project success and areas of improvement.
OTHER DUTIES
Accomplishes all other duties and tasks as appropriately assigned or requested.
EDUCATION & EXPERIENCE
Prior MSP experience highly desired.
PMP Certification preferred.
Bachelor’s degree in business administration preferred but not required.
6-8 years of project management experience required.
Strong working knowledge of Microsoft Office.
Valid driver’s license.
KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS & ABILITIES
Proficiency in project management methodologies (Waterfall).
Technical background, with understanding or hands-on experience in the technology sector..
Ability to manage multiple projects simultaneously.
Experience driving complex issues to closure with customers.
Solid organizational skills including attention to detail and multi-tasking.
Excellent written and verbal communication skills.
Pay Range: $60,000 – $100,000 annually based on experience.

description:
JOB SUMMARY:
Will join the Lendlease Smithsonian team providing owner-representative services to plan and manage museum construction projects, especially including historical preservation portions, on behalf of the OPDC Architectural History and Historic Preservation Office client.
Full-time onsite role at the Smithsonian office in downtown DC (600 Maryland Ave SW, Washington DC 20024). Will regularly travel to nearby museums. Parking is provided as well as is conveniently located near mass transit.

ESSENTIAL RESPONSIBILITIES:
The following is intended to describe the general nature and level of work anticipated to be performed. It is not a complete list of all that may be required.
Work with OPDC facilities AHHP preservation staff to provide construction and administrative support for projects. This will include site observation, conservation reports, field reports, scheduling meetings, tracking responses, preparing and distributing meeting notes, administering DropBox and Teams sites, obtaining, analyzing, and preparing relevant documents, PowerPoint presentations, etc., to assist the Smithsonian Institute Historic Preservation Contracting Officer’s Technical Representative.
Support OPDC Historic Preservation COTR for architectural conservation and technical preservation projects in coordinating with outside Architectural and Engineering (AE) consultants in the performance of their work.
Collaborate with OPDC, AHHP, and planning staff members in the preparation of public-facing documents as part of the Section 106 review and DC External Agency review processes. Post documents to AHHP’s website, in conformance with ADA 508 compliance.
Assist in assembling and preparing deliverables and reports, including distribution within Smithsonian Institute.
Research files as needed for issue resolution and back-checking reports.
MINIMUM REQUIREMENTS:
Demonstrated understanding of conservation of historic materials through site-specific preservation projects.
Experience working with historic preservation regulations at the municipal, state, or federal levels.
Experience with historic preservation construction projects.
Experience with architectural history research and writing of reports.
Familiarity with museum designs and cultural institutions, such as the Smithsonian, desired.
Must be able to perform administrative duties including but not limited to note-taking, document management, and scheduling.
Ability to use DropBox, Teams, Excel, Word, Outlook, PowerPoint, and Adobe Suite. AutoCAD drawing skills and GIS would be a plus but are not required.
Ability to work and communicate effectively within a team, and ability to work independently required.
Bachelor’s degree in materials conservation, architecture, historic preservation, or other design/construction related major, with an emphasis on skills relevant to architectural history and historic preservation.
Base Salary Range: $92,000 - $116,000
The above salary range represents Lendlease’s good faith and reasonable estimate of the possible base compensation range at the time of posting and is one part of the total rewards Lendlease provides to employees. The base compensation amount offered to a successful candidate will be decided based on a range of factors, including but not limited to the candidate’s experience, skillset, and education level.

Position Information
Be a Tar Heel!
A global higher education leader in innovative teaching, research and public service, the University of North Carolina at Chapel Hill consistently ranks as one of the nation’s top public universities. Known for its beautiful campus, world-class medical care, commitment to the arts and top athletic programs, Carolina is an ideal place to teach, work and learn.
One of the best college towns and best places to live in the United States, Chapel Hill has diverse social, cultural, recreation and professional opportunities that span the campus and community.
University employees can choose from a wide range of professional training opportunities for career growth, skill development and lifelong learning and enjoy exclusive perks for numerous retail, restaurant and performing arts discounts, savings on local child care centers and special rates on select campus events. UNC-Chapel Hill offers full-time employees a comprehensive benefits package, paid leave, and a variety of health, life and retirement plans and additional programs that support a healthy work/life balance.

Primary Purpose of Organizational Unit
The UNC School of Medicine has a rich tradition of excellence and care. Our mission is to improve the health and wellbeing of North Carolinians, and others whom we serve. We accomplish this by providing leadership and excellence in the interrelated areas of patient care, education, and research. We strive to promote faculty, staff, and learner development in a diverse, respectful environment where our colleagues demonstrate professionalism, enhance learning, and create personal and professional sustainability. We optimize our partnership with the UNC Health System through close collaboration and commitment to service.
OUR VISION
Our vision is to be the nation’s leading public school of medicine. We are ranked 2nd in primary care education among all US schools of medicine and 5th among public peers in NIH research funding. Our Allied Health Department is home to five top-ranked divisions, and we are home to 18 top-ranked clinical and basic science departments in NIH research funding.
OUR MISSION
Our mission is to improve the health and well-being of North Carolinians and others whom we serve. We accomplish this by providing leadership and excellence in the interrelated areas of patient care, education, and research.
Patient Care: We will promote health and provide superb clinical care while maintaining our strong tradition of reaching underserved populations and reducing health disparities across North Carolina and beyond.
Education: We will prepare tomorrow’s health care professionals and biomedical researchers by facilitating learning within innovative curricula and team-oriented interprofessional education. We will cultivate outstanding teaching and research faculty, and we will recruit outstanding students and trainees from highly diverse backgrounds to create a socially responsible, highly skilled workforce.
Research: We will develop and support a rich array of outstanding health sciences research programs, centers, and resources. We will provide infrastructure and opportunities for collaboration among disciplines throughout and beyond our University to support outstanding research. We will foster programs in the areas of basic, translational, mechanistic, and population research.

Position Summary
The UNC Lineberger Comprehensive Cancer Center (LCCC) oversees and coordinates oncology clinical trial research for the UNC School of Medicine and UNC Cancer Care. The UNC LCCC Multicenter Clinical Trials Operations office is part of the UNC Lineberger Oncology Clinical Protocol Office (CPO). The UNC LCCC Multicenter office is primarily responsible for coordinating the clinical research program (investigator-initiated studies and cooperative group studies) of UNC LCCC across the state of North Carolina (NC) and throughout the United States (US). This position will be responsible for organizing, managing, conducting, and supporting these trials across NC and the US. This Senior Project Manager position will oversee activation of UNC LCCC treatment clinical trials across study sites located in clinics and healthcare systems within the US. The position will oversee study activation, monitor project execution, compliance, and risk surveillance. The position will oversee financial management and project status reporting to funding sources. The position will also ensure appropriate project close-out. This individual will also be responsible for training staff and investigators across study sites on project specific guidelines to ensure compliance throughout the execution of the studies through close-out. This individual will also assist in training and orienting new team members.

Minimum Education and Experience Requirements
Bachelor’s degree in a discipline related to the field assigned and one year of related training or experience; or equivalent combination of training and experience. All degrees must be received from appropriately accredited institutions.

Required Qualifications, Competencies, and Experience
Must demonstrate in depth knowledge of and skill in applying applicable clinical research regulatory requirements, i.e. Good Clinical Practice (GCP), Food and Drug Administration (FDA) regulations and International Conference on Harmonization (ICH) guidelines. Possess excellent interpersonal skills including leadership, team building, motivation, communication, influencing, decision making, political/cultural awareness, trust building, negotiation, conflict management and coaching. Comfortable interacting with individuals at all levels internal and external to UNC Lineberger. Candidate must enjoy working collaboratively with multidisciplinary groups of colleagues. Excellent customer service skills and good judgement required. Ability to manage multiple projects at various stages and work independently with occasional guidance from supervisor. Strong organization and problem-solving skills required. Must have a demonstrated ability to deliver high quality results on time and to manage competing priorities. Must possess clinical trials and/or project management experience. Strong software and computer skills.

Preferred Qualifications, Competencies, and Experience
ACRP-PM or PMI certification preferred. Oncology clinical trials or project management experience.

Special Physical/Mental Requirements

Campus Security Authority Responsibilities
Not Applicable.
